text_en:
President. Ladies and gentlemen.

Let's talk about the masks in this rostrum again. We'll do it a few hours before they change their regulations. We are going to move from full-time regulation to part-time regulation, from a need to take it permanently to an option to take it occasionally depending on what the circumstances generate. Let us say that there is a greater responsibility to citizens in this case, because you have to choose where there is risk, where there is danger and, therefore, where it should be protected and where it should be protected.

That we go to a more open regulation does not mean that the instrument ceases to be effective and has, moreover, necessarily to be used.

We are seeing that there are countries in the world that are making more progress in this opening of health controls and that, however, new outbreaks, new strains, some abuses, some misuses are leading to some step backwards. And, therefore, what happens elsewhere must also teach us. And it must also give it the prominence, the importance it has to this instrument that has been shown to be an effective air regulator that we breathe, an effective regulator of those harmful elements that are in the air and that we need to protect ourselves from.

That is why the role of public administrations, in this case the Basque Government, in this case the advice that you have responsibility, very directly from Kontsumobide, has been very important so that, by ensuring security, guarantees, the effectiveness of masks, citizens, who have made a remarkable social, economic, personal effort, can be assured that the instrument is an appropriate and functioning instrument.

About three months ago, three months less a day like this, in this House it was announced on which lines a campaign of control and guarantees on the quality of masks was to be carried out. Three months later that is done and it is necessary to know those results.

Because, indeed, as you will see, there have been those who have wanted to slip down the path of fraud, the path of irregularity in relation to this product so essential to protect and protect others. And, therefore, it is important that, as a tribute also to the citizens who have had to carry this instrument for a long time and who will have to continue to carry it, what better tribute to that effort than to guarantee them from the public administrations that the mask does, the one that is for sale, the one that can be purchased in the different establishments, it does comply with the rules, with the guarantees and, therefore, it is effective.

In this sense the question is asked, Mr Hurtado. And I believe that, in an exercise of transparency towards citizens, it is very important to know what has been the result of this campaign.

Thank you very much.
text:
Presidenta. Señorías.

Volvemos hablar de las mascarillas en esta tribuna. Lo hacemos a unas horas de que cambie su regulación. Vamos a pasar de una regulación a tiempo completo a una regulación a tiempo parcial, de una necesidad de llevarla permanentemente a una opción de llevarla ocasionalmente en función de lo que generen las circunstancias. Digamos que se traslada, en este caso, una responsabilidad mayor a la ciudadanía, porque tiene que optar por saber dónde hay riesgo, dónde hay peligro y, por lo tanto, dónde debe de protegerse y dónde debe de proteger.

Que vayamos a una regulación más abierta no significa que el instrumento deje de ser eficaz y que tenga, además, necesariamente que ser usado.

Estamos viendo que hay países en el mundo que van más avanzados en esta apertura de controles sanitarios y que, sin embargo, nuevos brotes, nuevas cepas, algunos abusos, algunos malos usos están llevando a tener que dar algún paso hacia atrás. Y, por lo tanto, lo que pasa en otros sitios también nos debe de enseñar. Y debe darle también el protagonismo, la importancia que tiene a este instrumento que se ha mostrado como un eficaz regulador del aire que respiramos, como un eficaz regulador de esos elementos nocivos que están en el aire y que de ellos necesitamos protegernos.

Por eso, ha sido muy importante el papel de las administraciones públicas, en este caso del Gobierno Vasco, en este caso de la consejería que usted tiene responsabilidad, muy directamente desde Kontsumobide, para que, velando por la seguridad, por las garantías, por la eficacia de las mascarillas, los ciudadanos y ciudadanas, que han hecho un notable esfuerzo social, económico, personal, puedan tener garantías de que el instrumento es un instrumento adecuado y que funciona.

Hace tres meses aproximadamente, tres meses menos un día algo así, en esta Cámara se anunció en qué líneas se iba a hacer una campaña de control y de garantías sobre la calidad de las mascarillas. Tres meses después eso está hecho y es necesario conocer esos resultados.

Porque, efectivamente, como se verá, ha habido quien se ha querido deslizar por el camino del fraude, por el camino de la irregularidad en relación con este producto tan imprescindible para proteger y proteger a los demás. Y, por lo tanto, es importante que, como homenaje también a los propios ciudadanos que durante mucho tiempo han tenido que llevar este instrumento y que tendrán que seguir llevando, qué mejor homenaje a ese esfuerzo que garantizarles desde las administraciones públicas que la mascarilla sí cumple, la que está a la venta, la que se puede adquirir en los distintos establecimientos, sí cumple con las normas, con las garantías y que, por lo tanto, es eficaz.

En este sentido está hecha la pregunta, señor Hurtado. Y yo creo que, en un ejercicio de transparencia hacia la ciudadanía, es importantísimo conocer cuál ha sido el resultado de esta campaña.

Muchas gracias.

text_en:
Thank you, Mr. President.

Well, first of all, Mrs. Kotja, I'd like to say that I think it's good for me to talk about the European Social Card.

You've started your speech on the first round, the compass, the ship... I can't remember how it is... I mean, talking about that phrase. And when you said that, I thought of another sentence. I don't know who the author is, or is old age, but there was one who said: He who knows where he goes needs to know where he's from. And, in that respect, I think we have a clear idea of where we come from and where we would have liked to go.

And we are conscious of the changes which you have alluded to: digital revolution, ecological, transitions, etc., etc. But I think...

... here you have mentioned the changes which we have before us: digital revolution, ecological, transitions, etc., etc. But, I think, if we all ask for change, we should start to change a few points of view, and, instead of always seeing them as threatening, we should perhaps begin to see them as possible. For sometimes it seems that we have threats and threats upon us, and it is only in our discourse about it that we feed a discourse which is well formed and well rounded first.

Eta, aldaketa horretan, aldatus beharko genituzke gauza asko. Gu geu ére aldatu beharko ginateke, aipatu dudan bidetik beharbada. Bath, hut, aldotu beharko genituzke empresak, age, horretarako, trading kolektiboari aukerak eman behar zaizkio. Baina, bai, egon zen hemen, aurreko legegintzaldian, ekimen bat, eta da empresa inklusiboena eta parta-hartzaileena jorratu beharko genukeena. It's time, nik uste, benetak akordio beats the irritator and ahal izango litzatekeela. Aipatu duzu, ez dakit nork esaten duela, "not running good times for life". In the years I've lived, I think I've known them a lot worse. I think I've known quite a lot worse times for life, and in the last eight or ten, the truth is, I think they're much better. And remembering that phrase of Ortega and Gasset, which spoke of two things: memory and hope. And with memory and hope, I believe that we will also have to address the future.

You said we didn't come to the agreements, and in the first round you mentioned the bla-bla-bla-bla. Well, I-l-bla-bla-bla, you'll forgive me, but you'll excuse me. For here, in order to make an agreement, I am the only one who has made the proposal, whether good or bad or mediocre, and I have not received any opposition. I've gotten my opinions, but I've got my counter-proposies in writing, not them. So, bla-bla-bla, maybe we're not the most of us.

I don't know what sort of a young man I used to say. And I, when things happen, don't think what others will say. But you will confess to me that there are some classics in every discussion, and very predictable ones, and we shall all have them. But when one says, I know what you'll say to me when I describe the good situation and the positive indexes-Well, well, I know what you'll say to me: I have to tell you that I have to kill him with self-internity and success, that we are in danger.

That's why I'll tell you something. we ourselves have our concerns about the situation. We know that all the fields are its lights and shadows. And I think I have already said this before: I believe that we ought to continue on the road with the political and democratic patience of which I have been speaking, and that the frequent agreements we make should generally be much more numerous than we do.

Thank you.

Eskerrik asko, legebiltzarburu andrea.

Bueno, lehenengo gauza, Kortajarena andrea, nik esan nahi nizuke niri Europako Gizarte Kartari buruz hitz egitea Legebiltzar honetan egokia iruditzen zaidala.

Zure diskurtsoa hasi duzu lehendabiziko txandan, iparrorratza eta itsasontziaren… ez naiz gogoratzen nola den… zera, esaldi hori aipatuz. Eta, hori zenionean, niri beste esaldi bat etorri zait gogora. Ez dakit egilea nor den, edo atsotitza den, baina bazegoen bat esaten zuena: Dakienak badaki nora dihoan jakiteko behar duela nondik datorren jakin. Eta, alde horretatik, nik uste guk argi daukagula nondik gatozen eta nora joatea nahiko genukeen.

Eta kontziente gara, baita ere, zuk aipatu dituzun hor aurrez aurre dauzkagun aldaketak: iraultza digitala, ekologikoa, trantsizioak, eta abar, eta abar. Baina, nik uste…

… aipatu dituzun hor, aurrez aurre dauzkagun aldaketak: iraultza digitala, ekologikoa, trantsizioak, eta abar, eta abar. Baina, nik uste dut, denoi aldaketa eskatzen digun honetan, beharbada, zenbait ikuspuntu ere aldatzen hasi beharko ginatekeela, eta beti mehatxu bezala ikusi beharrean egoera horiek, beharbada, aukera bezala ikusten hasi beharko ginateke. Ze, batzuetan ematen du mehatxuaren, mehatxuak gainean dauzkagula, eta horren inguruko diskurtsoarekin ematen du, beno, ba aldez aurretik ondo osatua eta ondo borobildua dagoen diskurtso bat elikatzen baino ez garela ari.

Eta, aldaketa horretan, aldatu beharko genituzke gauza asko. Gu geu ere aldatu beharko ginateke, aipatu dudan bidetik beharbada. Baina, baita ere, aldatu beharko genituzke enpresak, eta, horretarako, negoziazio kolektiboari aukerak eman behar zaizkio. Baina, bai, egon zen hemen, aurreko legegintzaldian, ekimen bat, eta da enpresa inklusiboena eta parte-hartzaileena jorratu beharko genukeena. Eta hori, nik uste, benetako akordio bat izatera iritsi ahal izango litzatekeela. Aipatu duzu, ez dakit nork esaten duela, "no corren buenos tiempos para la vida". En los años de vida que yo llevo creo que los he conocido bastante peores. Creo que he conocido bastante peores tiempos para la vida, y, en los últimos ocho o diez, la verdad es que los considero bastante mejores. Y, recordando a aquella frase de Ortega y Gasset, que hablaba de dos cosas: memoria y esperanza. Y con memoria y esperanza creo que tendremos que abordar también el futuro.

Aipatu duzu akordioetara ez garela iritsi, eta lehendabiziko txandan aipatu duzu bla-bla-bla. Bueno, nik bla-bla-bla, barkatuko didazu, baina bla-bla-bla zurea. Ze, hemen, akordioetara iristeko, proposamen ona, txarra edo erdipurdikoa izan, proposamena egin duen bakarra ni izan naiz, eta ez dut kontraproposamenik jaso. Jaso ditut iritziak, baina kontraproposamenak, idatziz, ez. Beraz, bla-bla-bla, ba, beharbada, ez gara gu gehien egin dugunak.

Nik ez dakit gazteleraz asumir esaten nuen; nik euskaraz irakurtzen dizut. Eta, nik, gauzak gertatzen ditudanean, ez naiz pentsatzen ari besteak zer esango duen. Baina, aitortuko didazue badaudela klasiko batzuk, eztabaida guztietan, eta oso aurreikusgarriak direnak; denok izango ditugu. Baina, batek esaten duenean, badakit zer esango didazuen, egoera onak eta indize positiboak deskribatzen ditudanean... Ba, bueno, ba badakit zer esango didazuen: autokonplazentzia eta arrakastaz hiltzeko zera daukadala, arriskua daukagula.

Horregatik, nik, gauza bat esango dizut: guk ere geure kezkak ditugu egoerari buruz. Badakigu arlo guztiak bere argiak eta itzalak daudela. Eta uste dut aldez aurretik ere horrela esan dudala: nik uste bidean jarraitu beharko genukeela, lehen aipatu ditudan borondate politiko eta pazientzia demokratikoarekin, eta horren inguruan akordioak sarritan egiten ditugunak, oro har, egiten ditugunak baino askoz ere ugariagoak izan beharko liratekeela.

Eskerrik asko.

text_en:
President. Ladies and gentlemen.

I believe that the act we are doing today, this debate through a non-legislative proposal, is important because it serves two things fundamentally. The first, so that the institutions...

... debate through a non-law proposal, because it serves two things fundamentally. The first, for the institutions to manifest themselves – in this case, the Basque Parliament – against violence, without any doubt and without any interpretation. And the second, to close ranks with the Basque Police in the performance of their tasks and in the face of the situations they have had to live and bear, and which are absolutely irrational and unfair and therefore deserve that recognition.

A recognition that goes also, and a solidarity that is also expressed, to the people who have had to suffer this violence, these episodes of violence in many cases, and who have suffered destruction, looting, disruption of their lives in their homes and in the streets and therefore also deserve all solidarity.

Violence has neither categories nor justifications. Anyone who moves in the field of lukewarmness to condemn violence will find categories and justifications, and will propose debates on the debates so as not to be clear in condemning such violence. The violence that has occurred in this period, at this time, in countless cities and villages in the Basque Country, as Mr Barrio has pointed out, is not violence that has to do with young people, it is more, those who have acted there are a minority against a majority of the population, and a majority of the population, as may be the case in this case, among them the youth segment.

In fact, in the statement that this Parliament will make by a majority, in the PNL resolution, there is no talk of young people, of people who practice violence, because it is not young people who practice violence, it is people who may be one age, it is people who may be another, but it is people who practice violence. It doesn't have to do with that violence either with a leisure model, the leisure model can be reviewed. And, finally, who is going to do it, who is going to do it, who is going to put things on the table, because we are going to meet a society that is organized around a preaching that has little to do with its behavior and, therefore, we are going to enter into a degree of contradictions and cynicism about our practices, which is going to be precious to see. I'd like to see anyone here who wants to discuss it. I'll give you just one example.

Alcohol is a problem, because it is a toxic substance and alters behavior. We say this in a country where a type of alcohol, which is very important for the economy and even for fun, we call it food. Well, let's see how we explain to those who want to educate you about the leisure model in relation to the behaviors and contradictions that put us in politics and other things. But, finally, this is another matter, because my line of argument does not go by the justifications and does not go by the categories of violence, but goes by, in a clear and consistent way, condemn the violence and help the Basque police to do their job.

And that also goes with the appeals that have also been made on some occasion with ignorance. Violent people are fully aware of what they are doing, have the capacity and a level of thought and will to commit crimes that express it in such acts of violence, and are therefore people who are capable of violence and therefore have to be able to assume responsibilities, and so that those responsibilities are not diluted to any other degree of lukewarmness, as I said.

The acts of violence have to do with, without any doubt, the one that wants to put a blindfold on it, but the acts of violence in the Basque Country have to do with organized violence and the tactics employed in the use of violence have to do with organized violence. There are violent professional provocateurs in some of these actions, it is evident that it is added to a crime or violence of criminals, who take advantage of the occasion, and it is evident that it is also added to at times a clumsy evidence, which can have that a higher level of spontaneity, because well, since we are here, we do the night doing some more things.

Indeed, it is a violence that has different roots, different elements, but, without any doubt, it also has an organizational component that seeks to disrupt coexistence, that seeks to destabilize, that seeks to accentuate criticism of the police model, that seeks to discredit the police itself, that seeks to provoke certain radical thoughts or attitudes to have more justification or influence or presence in the world in which we live.

Therefore, the violence we have suffered must have an explicit condemnation, must have a condemnation without any kind of lukewarmness and without any sort of categorization. Therefore, the two elements that I pointed out at the beginning are the only two elements that contain the compromise amendment that we have made. And when you want to talk about other things, we'll talk about other things. But, certainly, when there has been free, unnecessary, absurd violence,...

... So we'll talk about other things. But, certainly, when there has been free, unnecessary, absurd violence, just because of the practice of violence, wanting to apply to that attenuating in relation to the leisure model, to the socio-laboral difficulties that may have certain collectives or to anything else of the multiple problems and contradictions that a society has, it is simply wanting to escape a unitary condemnation.

Thank you very much.
text:
Presidenta. Señorías.

Considero que es importante el acto que estamos haciendo hoy, este debate a través de una proposición no de ley, porque sirve para dos cosas fundamentalmente. La primera, para que las instituciones…

… debate a través de una proposición no de ley, porque sirve para dos cosas fundamentalmente. La primera, para que las instituciones se manifiesten –en este caso, el Parlamento Vasco– en contra de la violencia, sin ningún tipo de duda y sin ningún tipo de interpretación. Y la segunda, para cerrar filas con la Policía Vasca en el desempeño de sus tareas y ante las situaciones que ha tenido que vivir y que soportar, y que son absolutamente irracionales e injustas y, por lo tanto, merecen ese reconocimiento.

Un reconocimiento que a la vez va también, y una solidaridad que se expresa también, a las personas que han tenido que sufrir esta violencia, estos episodios de violencia en muchos casos, y que han sufrido destrozos, saqueos, perturbación de su vida en sus domicilios y en las calles y que, por lo tanto, también merecen de toda la solidaridad.

La violencia no tiene ni categorías ni justificaciones. Quien se mueva en el campo de la tibieza para condenar la violencia, encontrará categorías y encontrará justificaciones, y propondrá debates sobre los debates para no ser claro en la condena de esa violencia. La violencia que ha sucedido en este periodo, en este tiempo, en innumerables ciudades y pueblos del País Vasco, como ha señalado el señor Barrio, no es una violencia que tenga que ver con los jóvenes, es más, quienes han actuado allí son una minoría frente a una mayoría de población, y a una mayoría de sectores de población, como puede ser en este caso, entre ellos el segmento de los jóvenes.

De hecho, en la declaración que hará este Parlamento por mayoría, en la resolución de la PNL, no se habla de jóvenes, se habla de personas, de personas que practican la violencia, porque no son los jóvenes los que practican la violencia, son personas que pueden tener una edad, pueden tener otra, pero son personas las que practican la violencia. No tiene que ver esa violencia tampoco con un modelo de ocio, el modelo de ocio se puede revisar. Y, en fin, quién esté por hacerlo, que lo haga, que vaya poniendo cosas encima la mesa, porque nos vamos a encontrar con una sociedad que se organiza en torno a un predicamento que poco tiene que ver con su comportamiento y, por tanto, vamos a entrar en un grado de contradicciones y de cinismo sobre nuestras prácticas, que va a ser precioso de ver. Me gustará ver aquí a quienes quieran debatirlo. Pondré solo un ejemplo.

El alcohol es un problema, porque es una sustancia tóxica y altera la conducta. Esto lo decimos en un país donde a un tipo de alcohol, que es importantísimo para la economía e, incluso, para la diversión, le llamemos alimento. Bueno, vamos a ver cómo explicamos a los que queremos educarles esto del modelo de ocio en relación con los comportamientos y con las contradicciones que nos meten en la política y en otras cosas. Pero, en fin, este es otro asunto, porque mi línea argumental no va por las justificaciones y no va por las categorías de violencia, sino va por, de una forma clara y rotunda, condenar la violencia y ayudar a la Policía vasca a que haga su trabajo.

Y eso tampoco va con las apelaciones que también se han hecho en alguna ocasión con la ignorancia. Los violentos son plenamente conscientes de lo que están haciendo, tienen la capacidad y un nivel de pensamiento y de voluntad para delinquir que lo expresan en esos actos de violencia y, por lo tanto, son personas que están capacitadas para la violencia y, por tanto, tienen que estar capacitadas para asumir las responsabilidades, y para que no se diluyan esas responsabilidades en ningún otro grado de tibieza, como decía.

Los actos de violencia tienen que ver con, sin ningún lugar a dudas –el que se quiera poner una venda en los ojos que se la ponga–, pero los actos de violencia en el País Vasco tienen que ver con una violencia organizada y las tácticas empleadas en el uso de la violencia tienen un componente de violencia organizada. Hay provocadores profesionales violentos en algunas de esas acciones, es evidente que a ella se suma una delincuencia o una violencia de delincuentes, que aprovechan la ocasión, y es evidente que también a ella se suma en algunos momentos una evidencia gamberra, que puede tener ese un nivel mayor de espontaneidad, porque bueno, pues ya que estamos aquí, hacemos la noche haciendo algunas cosas más.

Efectivamente, es una violencia que tiene distintos distintas raíces, distintos elementos, pero, sin ningún lugar a dudas, también tiene un componente de organización que busca perturbar la convivencia, que busca desestabilizar, que busca acentuar la crítica al modelo policial, que busca denostar a la propia policía, que busca provocar para que ciertos pensamientos o actitudes radicales puedan tener más justificación o más influencia o presencia en el mundo en el que vivimos.

Por lo tanto, la violencia que hemos padecido tiene que tener una condena explícita, tiene que tener una condena sin ningún tipo de tibieza y sin ningún tipo de categorización. Por eso, los dos elementos que he señalado al principio son los dos únicos elementos que contiene la enmienda transaccional que hemos realizado. Y cuando se quiere hablar de otras cosas, pues hablaremos de otras cosas. Pero, ciertamente, cuando se ha producido una violencia gratuita, innecesaria, absurda,…

… pues hablaremos de otras cosas. Pero, ciertamente, cuando se ha producido una violencia gratuita, innecesaria, absurda, solo por el hecho de practicar la violencia, querer aplicarle a eso atenuantes en relación al modelo de ocio, a las dificultades sociolaborales que puedan tener determinados colectivos o a cualquier otra cosa de los múltiples problemas y contradicciones que tiene una sociedad, es simplemente querer escaparse de una condena unitaria.

Muchas gracias.

text_en:
Thank you, ma'am. Thank you, Mrs. Martinez. Good noon, everyone.

It is true, Mrs González, that we have the same objective. I believe that all of us who have participated here have that objective, which is to ensure the health of adolescents, girls and children who participate in the Internet or in the digital space. But we do not have the same path, nor do we give equal importance to how to carry out these actions.

In the face of parliamentary groups that support the Government, which attach greater importance to the weight of family education and to the importance that the family has in this respect, we, from our group, believe that it has to be from education, from the administrative level, where we also have to share in this education. Let's just say he's a kid grabbed by his hands, both by the family and by the administration. For there comes a time when many families do not have the capacity to educate their children in the digital sphere, because they themselves do not know how to behave in that space.

It is a new space, it is a very changing space, and it has to be from, in this case, from philosophy, since we are creating critical spirits, from where we have to take letters in this matter. The guides will help, but they will not reach all; there will be a large percentage of the population that does not even read them, that does not even look at them. And that percentage is going to participate in the Internet, it's going to participate in social media as if nothing happened. And that's not true. There is a certain danger, there is a great danger, in which you can no longer distinguish what is real from what is false. And the Administration has to be there to manage that space. It can't be a free space, without management.

And it's not interventionism, as Mr. Barrio said. It is to help young people think, to think from that critical spirit, to analyze situations and to take the path themselves that they want to choose, whether they want to expose themselves or not, but to know the risks they run and the risks in the future. Because everything that happens on the Internet is going to stay forever. I mean, the picture you're gonna be walking at 13, 14, 15 is gonna be there when you're 60, or when you're a public office, like my case may be. Until recently I could have a media exposure and now I have another. For all this people do not know him and we must create that consciousness.

I very much agree with Mrs Martinez's metaphor for the children on the street. I think it's very similar. We have to guide them, but we have to guide them among all, not just the family. There is also the Administration and it has to pick up the witness and do its part.
text:
Mila esker, mahaiburu andrea. Mila esker, Martinez andrea. Eguerdi on guztioi.

Es cierto, señora González, tenemos el mismo objetivo. Creo que todos los que hemos participado aquí tenemos ese objetivo, que es velar por la salud de los adolescentes, de las niñas y los niños que participan de Internet o del espacio digital. Pero no tenemos el mismo camino, ni le damos la misma importancia a cómo realizar estas acciones.

Frente a los grupos parlamentarios que sostienen al Gobierno, que dan más importancia al peso de la educación en la familia y a la importancia que la familia tiene en este aspecto, nosotros, desde nuestro grupo, creemos que tiene que ser desde la educación, desde el ámbito administrativo, donde también se tiene que coparticipar en esta educación. Digamos que es un niño agarrado por las manos, tanto por la familia como por la Administración. Pues llega un momento en el cual muchas familias no tienen capacidad de educar a su hijo en el ámbito digital, pues ellos mismos tampoco saben cómo comportarse en ese espacio.

Es un espacio nuevo, es un espacio muy cambiante, y tiene que ser desde, en este caso, desde la filosofía, ya que estamos creando espíritus críticos, desde donde se tiene que tomar cartas en este asunto. Las guías ayudarán, pero no llegarán a todos; habrá un gran porcentaje de la población que ni siquiera las lea, que ni siquiera las mire. Y ese porcentaje va a participar en Internet, va a participar de las redes sociales como si no pasara nada. Y no es cierto. Hay cierto peligro, hay un gran peligro, en el cual ya no se puede diferenciar lo que es real de lo que es mentira. Y la Administración tiene que estar ahí para gestionar ese espacio. No puede ser un espacio libre, sin gestión.

Y no es intervencionismo, como decía el señor Barrio. Es ayudar a los jóvenes a pensar, a pensar desde ese espíritu crítico, analizar las situaciones y que tomen ellos mismos el camino que quieren elegir, si quieren exponerse o no quieren exponerse, pero que sepan los riesgos que corren y los riesgos a futuro. Porque todo lo que pase en Internet se va a quedar para siempre. O sea, la foto que vas a andar con 13, 14, 15 años va a estar allí cuando tengas 60 años, o cuando seas un cargo público, como puede ser mi caso. Yo hasta hace poco podía tener una exposición mediática y ahora tengo otra. Pues todo eso la gente no lo conoce y hay que crear esa conciencia.

Estoy muy de acuerdo en la metáfora que ha puesto la señora Martínez de los niños en la calle. Creo que es muy parecida. Tenemos que guiarles, pero tenemos que guiarles entre todos, no solo la familia. También está la Administración y tiene que recoger el testigo y hacer su parte.

Thank you, Mr. President. Ladies and gentlemen of the Parliament, good noon to all.

Well, from the line Mr. Pastor has said, laity must be traced; laity, euscal educational system, must respect a frame.

As an end, that avoids a declaration of confession on the part of the State, that is to say, taking it for real, and accepting it as his own, we are speaking of a subject which the state does not make a declaration of the confession of a faith, in the 163th article of the Constitution, which puts a laity or non-communciative system.

The nature of this reason consists in the necessity of protecting the religious freedom of the people and their equality. But the protection of the fundamental right of all religious and national freedom to the equality of all the people is likewise to be combined with other rights established in the Constitution in the school.

Hala, Konstituzioko 27.3 artikuluan xedatzen gives: "The public authorities must guarantee the right of parents to receive their children's religious and moral formation according to their own convictions".

So that the last right is set up as a fundamental right, and is mentioned before 16. it must be referred to the ideological, religious, and cultural rights received in the article.

Horren inguruan, Auzitegi Konstituzionalak, 1981.eko otsailaren 13ko epaian, honako hau adierazten zuen: "In a legal-political system based on pluralism, the ideological and religious freedom of individuals and the confessionality of the State, all public institutions and, in particular, educational institutions must be, in fact, neutral".

Iraqaskuntza-askatasunarekin lotuta, jarraian datorena esaten digu Auzitegi Konstitutionalko bigarren salak 1985.eko mayatzaren 29an, drink 359. "The right to religious freedom of each person also includes, in general and specifically, in a state declared to be unconfessional, that of rejecting any religious attitude of the state in relation to the person, and therefore, and in connection with the freedom of teaching recognized and regulated by article 27 of the Constitution, the obligation of the public authorities not to coerce the study of a particular ideological or religious confession".

Eta aurrerago: "Article 27.3 of the Constitution guarantees the right of parents to receive their children's religious and moral formation according to their own convictions".

It is clear that here the constitutional article protects, together with the free choice of a certain moral or religious education, the right to ideological neutrality of public educational institutions, as stated in the above-mentioned judgment of this court of 13 February 1981.

In this context, it is to be considered that the article of 8/1985 organic law of education, which confirms the right of parents and guardians to receive the religious and moral education which agrees with their own beliefs in the centres of their children.

In like manner the law of speaking acknowledges to students the right of respecting their consciences, and of being respected by their religious and moral belief.

Lastly, this law ordains, that in the article 18.1, all the public centres will develop their activity with respect to the principle of ideological neutrality, and to the principle of the ideological neutrality, and to the doctrine of the 27.3th article of the Constitution.

On the other hand, the 1/1990 Organic Law of the general organization of the educational system (LOGSE), the 3rd of October, demands in its second supplementary regulation the teaching of the Catholic religion, which is the 3th of January, 1979, will be adjusted to the agreement between the teaching and cultural affairs of Spain and the Vatican. This regulation has been in all the organic laws of education which have since been published.

The 1/1993 Law of the Public Basque School, February 19, expresses in its article 3.1. "The public school of Euscal, each school in it, is a class of orators, a democratic one, who is in the service of the euscal society, founded in its circle in society and culture, a member of the community, a co-operative of differences, and a combination of diversities."

And he puts it between his designs: "Freedom of the professors' chains," says he, "by which this law ordains, that both parents and guardians should choose a school for their children, and, in the present case, have the right to choose the religion which they desire for their children."

The second additional regulation of 236/2015 Decrets of basic education is given to the teaching of religion, and expresses: "Before learning begins, the students of age will show whether they will learn or not, the parents or guardians of the minors. So Catholic religion will be a field in the First Education, and a lesson in the Second Education of Required, which must necessarily be devoted to schools and elective for students. Those who do not choose religion will perform Sociaal and Cybiic values in the First Education, and the Etitic Values in the High Exercised Education, parents, legal guardians, or, so far as they are concerned, the students are elected."

In the case of Batxiler, the curriculum of Batxiler, and to be placed in the Euscal Autonomia Escimia Escre, is the second additional regulations of the Decreum 1527/2016. "Religions of religion will be introduced into the Union, according to what has been prescribed in this decree. Schools must offer religion in one of the Batxiler lines, in one of the 15.4.b of this decree, and in the 164 articles together with the print."

This is the frame, which is really well defined and well framed, because this subject has been often thorny, and has been set around it a narrow frame.

That's the frame and that's the playground. In order to protect the rights, the Constitution has, therefore, confirmed the neutrality which the institutions have asked, because, as has been mentioned, they could not impose a specific religious option on the students who are occupied by education.

But this neutrality would be broken, if the centres would not choose either the liberty or the religion of the establishment of religion which they please their pupil, and give up the opportunity to make the matter of the Soviets and the Cybitans.

We think, then, that the public euscal school protects the religious freedom of its pupils and the equality of their pupils, by avoiding the neglect of their beliefs.

For this reason we introduced a correction with the Socialist Group, where confession was made to the fundamental task of the public euscal school, and to its laity, and also to require that it should continue to guard the interests, specific wants, and autonomys of education. And likewise the remagation of the public education of quality, in the conditions of equality and equity, where laity, with its neutrality, brings freedom of religion.

Thank you.
text:
Eskerrik asko, legebiltzarburu anderea. Sailburu anderea, legebiltzarkideok, eguerdi on denoi.

Beno, Pastor jaunak esan duen ildotik, laikotasuna enmarkatu egin behar da; laikotasunak, euskal hezkuntza-sisteman, marko bat errespetatu beharra dauka.

Helburu moduan, Estatuaren aldetik konfesionaltasun-adierazpen bat saihesten duen, hau da, benetakotzat hartuz eta berea bezala onartuz, Estatuak fede baten aitormen-adierazpena egin ez dezan, Konstituzioko 16.3 artikuluan jasotako gai batez ari gara, zeinak sistema laiko edo ez-konfesionala ezartzen duen.

Arrazoi horren izaera herritarren askatasun erlijiosoa eta horien arteko berdintasuna babestearen premian datza. Askatasun erlijioso eta herritar guztien berdintasunerako oinarrizko eskubidearen babesa, ordea, era berean, Konstituzioan ezarririko beste eskubide batzuekin uztartu beharra dago eskolan.

Hala, Konstituzioko 27.3 artikuluan xedatzen da: "Los poderes públicos deben garantizar el derecho de los padres a que sus hijos reciban la formación religiosa y moral que esté de acuerdo con sus propias convicciones".

Horrela, azken eskubide hau –"Nadie podrá ser obligado a declarar sobre su ideología, religión o creencia"– oinarrizko eskubide bezala ezartzen duen eta lehen aipatu den 16. artikuluan jasotako askatasun ideologiko, erlijioso eta kulturako eskubidearekin lotu behar da.

Horren inguruan, Auzitegi Konstituzionalak, 1981.eko otsailaren 13ko epaian, honako hau adierazten zuen: "En un sistema jurídico-político basado en el pluralismo, la libertad ideológica y religiosa de los individuos y la aconfesionalidad del Estado, todas las instituciones públicas y, muy especialmente, los centros docentes han de ser, en efecto, neutrales".

Irakaskuntza-askatasunarekin lotuta, jarraian datorrena esaten digu Auzitegi Konstituzionaleko bigarren salak 1985.eko maiatzaren 29an, bere 359. autoan: "El derecho a la libertad religiosa de cada persona comprende también, en general y específicamente, en un estado que se declara aconfesional, el de rechazar cualquier actitud religiosa del estado en relación con la persona, y por ello y en conexión con la libertad de enseñanza que reconoce y regula el artículo 27 de la Constitución, la obligación de los poderes públicos de no imponer coactivamente el estudio de una confesión ideológica o religiosa determinada".

Eta aurrerago: "El artículo 27.3 de la Constitución garantiza el derecho de los padres a que sus hijos reciban la formación religiosa y moral acorde a sus propias convicciones".

Es evidente que aquí el artículo constitucional ampara, junto con la libre elección de una cierta educación moral o religiosa, el derecho a la neutralidad ideológica de los centros docentes públicos, tal como declara la citada sentencia de este tribunal, de 13 de febrero de 1981.

Testuinguru horretan, kontuan izatekoa da hezkuntza-eskubidearen uztailaren 3ko 8/1985 Lege Organikoaren 4.c) artikulua, zeinak berresten duen guraso eta tutoreen eskubidea euren seme-alabek zentroetan euren sinesmenekin bat datorren heziketa erlijioso eta morala jaso dezaten.

Halaber, aipatu legeak euren kontzientzia-askatasunerako zein sinesmen erlijioso eta moralak errespetatuak izateko eskubidea aitortzen die ikasleei.

Azkenik, lege horrek ezartzen du, 18.1 artikuluan, hain zuzen ere, zentro publiko guztiek euren jarduerak neutraltasun ideologikoaren printzipioa eta Konstituzioko 27.3 artikuluan aurreikusitako aukera erlijioso eta moralak errespetatuz garatuko dituztela.

Bestalde, hezkuntza-sistemaren antolamendu orokorreko 1/1990 Lege Organikoak (LOGSE), urriaren 3koak, bere bigarren xedapen gehigarrian xedatzen du erlijio katolikoaren irakaskuntza 1979ko urtarrilaren 3koa den Espainia eta Vatikanoaren artean sinaturiko irakaskuntza eta afera kulturalei buruzko akordioan ezarritakoari doituko zaiola. Xedapen hori gerora argitaratu diren hezkuntzako lege organiko guztietan egon da.

Euskal Eskola Publikoaren 1/1993 Legeak, otsailaren 19koak, bere 3.1 artikuluan adierazten du: "Euskal eskola publikoa, horko ikastetxe bakoitza, elebiduna, demokratikoa da, euskal gizartearen zerbitzura dagoena, gizarte eta kultura mailan bere ingurunean errotua, partaidetzazkoa, ezberdintasunen berdintzailea eta dibertsitateen bateratzailea".

Eta bere xedeen artean ezartzen du: "Irakasleen katedra-askatasuna, lege honek zehazten duen esparruan guraso nahiz tutoreek euren seme-alabentzako ikastetxea aukeratzeko eta, hala dagokionean, legez ezarritako baldintzetan, euren seme-alabentzako nahi duten erlijio-irakaskuntza aukeratzeko eskubidea gauzatuko direla bermatzea".

Oinarrizko hezkuntzaren curriculuma zehaztu eta Euskal Autonomia Erkidegoan ezartzen duen abenduaren 22ko 236/2015 Dekretuko bigarren xedapen gehigarria erlijioaren irakaskuntzari eskaintzen zaio, eta adierazten du: "Ikasturtea hasi baino lehen, erlijioa ikasi nahi duten ala ez adieraziko dute adinez nagusi diren ikasleek eta adingabekoen guraso edo tutoreek. Hala, erlijio katolikoa arloa izango da Lehen Hezkuntzan, eta ikasgaia Derrigorrezko Bigarren Hezkuntzan, nahitaez eskaini beharrekoa ikastetxeentzat eta hautazkoa ikasleentzat. Erlijioa hautatzen ez dutenek, Balio Sozialak eta Zibikoak landuko dute Lehen Hezkuntzan, eta Balio Etikoak Derrigorrezko Bigarren Hezkuntzan, gurasoek, legezko tutoreek edo, hala dagokionean, ikasleak hautatuta".

Batxilergoaren kasuan, Batxilergoko curriculuma zehaztu eta Euskal Autonomia Erkidegoan ezartzeko 127/2016 Dekretuaren bigarren xedapen gehigarriak ezartzen du: "Erlijio-irakaskuntzak Batxilergoan sartuko dira, dekretu honetan ezarritakoaren arabera. Ikastetxeek Erlijioa eskaini behar dute Batxilergoko kurtsoetariko batean, dekretu honetako 15.4.b) eta 16.4 artikuluetan xedatukoarekin bat".

Hori da markoa, marko benetan ondo mugatua eta ondo ezarria, gai hau, behin baino gehiagotan, arantzatsua izan delako, eta horren inguruan marko estua ezarri delako.

Hori da markoa eta hori da jolasgunea. Eskubideak babesteko asmoz, Konstituzioak instituzioei galdegindako neutraltasuna bermatua dator, beraz, aipatu jurisprudentziak azaldu bezala, hezkuntza-zentroek bertan matrikulatzen diren ikasleei aukera erlijioso zehatz bat inposatu ahal ez izateagatik.

Baina neutraltasun hori hautsi egingo litzateke zentroek beren ikasleriari nahi duen erlijio-irakaskuntzaren aukera-askatasuna zein erlijioetariko bat bera ere hautatu ez eta Balore Sozial eta Zibikoen materia egiteko aukera eskaintzeari utziko baliete.

Gure ustez, beraz, euskal eskola publikoak indarrean dagoen marko horren guztiaren eskutik, bere ikasleen erlijio-askatasuna eta horien arteko berdintasuna babesten ditu, euren sinesmenengatik tratu baztertzailea jaso dezaten saihestuz.

Hori dela eta, zuzenketa bat sartu genuen Talde Sozialistarekin batera, non aitortza egiten zitzaion euskal eskola publikoaren funtsezko zereginari eta haren izaera laikori; eta, halaber, eskatzen jakon jarrai dezala hezkuntza-sistemaren interesak, premia espezifikoak eta autonomia zaintzen. Eta, era berean, berma dagiala kalitatezko hezkuntza-sistema publikoa, berdintasun- eta ekitate-baldintzetan, non, zalantzarik gabe, laikotasunak, bere neutraltasunarekin, erlijio-askatasuna ekarriko duen.

Eskerrik asko.

text_en:
The head of the table, the President, the chief of the departments, the members of the legislature, all good days.

This law replaces 1994. This law spoke gravely of protecting Eukadin' nature. And he opened the way to protect space and species. What nature means is, what it is worth, and how it is connected with man with it.

So, here much has changed in nature and human thought and everything indicates in the face of catastrophes that we are better in nature and our thought and sensitivity. This law is another step forward.

Our party wishes to thank the rest of our team for the pleasant and co-working atmosphere we have been able to cultivate, and to those who have shown us the greatest preparation for the agreement we have obtained. No one has ever imposed a text to go build. This text, no doubt, progresss over what is already in force, and opens new roads.

And I at the same time appreciate the thanks. And without getting colored I do it with humility, but especially because I have been able to work with the vice-counsel of Environment Amaia Barredo, whom I greet. And it's also true that technical advisors from the groups have collaborated, especially Iñaki Aizpuru, with whom he also took me..., I have a great friendship and I think it has been a very nice work that I will remember for a long time for the nature with which we have worked.

Just remember that 323 amendments were tabled to this law and nine are being debated in this plenary today; that is, a great deal has been done.

I must also acknowledge that I regret not having reached an agreement with Elkarrekin. We can, mainly because the amendments tabled, basically two, have not been able to conclude on something in which we would all feel comfortable.

When these two amendments were tabled within two days of the expiry of the deadline for amendments such as GNP, they lost their value as amendments to be discussed in the paper and moved to another scenario that made them very difficult to deal with. On the one hand, the creation of the Basque Biodiversity Agency, which exclusively says that it will assume regulatory and management functions of everything related to this law. That is, everything that makes government more deputies.

From there he speaks only in generic that it can be done by order of management transfer of declaration of competences, nobody knows. And that a law creates doubts is the worst thing that can happen to a law.

If we go to GNP we find more reasons and it seems that they are due to possible decoordinations. I do not doubt that they will occur as in so many other things, even within our own parliamentary groups, but that does not lead us to create a parliamentary group agency, but to deepen internally to solve problems or minimize them.

At the same time you are not aware that there are services of four institutions, government and three deputies, which have applied in this field for 40 years, following faithfully the competent division that the LTH made in this matter.

Do you think that breaking down the LTH without further ado and years of experience by putting it all together in a new mega agency will make the decoordinations go away?

In the debate we have analysed different solutions to address an improvement of this coordination, since the proposal for (?) repeat Naturzaintza, as previously defended by Citizens-, until which it has been definitively formulated, to create a coordination council in which the four institutions involved and how many technicians are considered appropriate.

We think that's the best way to solve the dysfunctions. Organizations that handle this law (... ) Getting direct decodinations.

The other amendment in another GNP says that the law itself defines which infrastructures can be located in each of the spaces to be protected and which are not.

This law provides that when a space is indicated as being capable of protecting, a prior order of the space must be made. Such ordination shall indicate the (?) It is not the same as a reserve area with strict protection as areas in need of lesser protection, or those of the Natura 2000 network itself, when the Community directive itself states that it is a question of seeking rules allowing human beings to live together with nature, because we are talking about active protection, not passive conservation.

There is also an amendment on forestry in which there was a surprising single article, which dismantles the entire forest policy of more than 80 years ago from this country and creates a new one with simplicity, which says that by 2040 70% of the forest species that you without any scientific rigour classify as invaders must have disappeared. Listed in which include eucalyptus, radiata pine, douglas fir.

Can one thing be decided from this point of view in an amendment to a single article of this law?, where is scientific knowledge?, where is that which you ask so much to speak with society, with the sector involved, with foresters or with citizens?

And then there is his amendment with which they prohibit preventively, nice legal concept, prohibit preventively, plant protection and biocidal products that are prohibited. So far we agree, it is obvious, if they are prohibited, they are prohibited, neither preventively nor anything, they are prohibited.

But then they say more, they also want to ban others, despite not being prohibited, and they say so, if there is broad scientific consensus to be toxic or harmful. What legal concept is broad scientific consensus?

I don't know, where... I'd like to know where they studied biology or law.

Hori da zuek eta guk maintainen ditugun zuzenketen laburpena. And already, by philosophy for a while, of all this debate of the law I have again found that homo sapiens gives the same in its developmental or protectionist aspects, it remains the permanent intervener in a dynamic balance, deciding what to do.

Some suppose the inexhaustibility of nature, others the need to restore lost balances, deciding what those balances are. In both cases they impose lines of thought. Some call them ecocapitalism and ecosocialism, but it is only anthropocentrism, always, man as a center of decision-making about the rest of the living world.

And even if someone doesn't see it that way...

... ecocapitalism and ecosocialism. But it is only anthropocentrism, always, man as the center of decision-making about the rest of the living world.

And even if someone doesn't see it that way, they know I'm not going to discuss it. It's a finding. That's right, because there's no other one left. To decide to protect nature, and how, is an exclusively human decision. No one else can do it. Will the (will we approach?) One way or another, but we all act as anthropocentrists in the face of nature.

And although this is irrefutable, sometimes it costs me more and more, because I like what Maeterlinck said more than "nature doesn't need happiness." Many times you have to leave her alone.

That's right, we've tried, at least me, not to discuss it in an impostor way. An attempt by those full of enlightened despotism who claim, from theoretical assumptions, to impose on the rural world to whom they try to irresponsibly preserve space, its vital space. Space that, by the way, if we ever look at it to preserve it, it was because it was safe from the (...) urban; and curiously, from the past, it was always surrounded by rural people. That is why I will always flee from those who – and these abound – pontificate over nature. Because it cannot be done, because, as Einstein said, "Nature is constituted in such a way that it is experimentally impossible to determine its movements."

In short, it is complex to legislate on nature. But I will always believe that it must be approached with the pretension of seeking the balance between, on the one hand, the need that human beings have to claim their own space in the natural environment, which they share with millions of other species, but which needs to be sustained, and, on the other, the demand to address it, leaving nature their space and time to recover, restore and rebalance. As it has been doing dynamically for billions of years, it has been shaped from its origin in its permanent adaptation to all foreseeable changes or not.

And let us never forget that what needs to be done is to protect it, because keeping it is too sclerotic for what continues to progress and progress.

And I end with a quote from whom I consider, at least for myself, the great master of ecology, Dr Margalef, who in his work between thermodynamics and the game reflected: "Thinking that man is part of nature must stimulate his cooperative action with it. But the important thing is to keep an open attitude, trying to avoid the momentary pressures of fashion ideologies. In reality, the most militant ideologies lie a little outside ecological consideration, because they tend to see man as something far apart from nature, with the destiny of being its owner or executioner. Finally, the protection of nature must be done by thinking about it without leaving aside a species like Homo Sapiens, which is also part of biodiversity, even if it is the species that most deteriorates it."

This, in essence, is a law to protect us from our own activities, but not to exclude us and us from it. Because we have a unique heritage that we must continue to protect among all. And this law represents one more step in the right direction and gives us a more secure framework to protect nature. But that framework will not work unless we become aware of our responsibility. Our daily activity has a permanent effect, more powerful than that of any other species on the natural environment. And this law will not serve much if we are not supportive and aware that this is a job for all of us and for all of biodiversity.

To say this, I want to thank them again for the work done to all the teams, to get such a law out of the harsher discussions by the effort we made together. And I am sure that it will be as useful as we approve of this new law, and that it will endure for ever, though in the future we hope that such a law should not be necessary.

Thank you very much.
text:
Mahaiburu andrea, lehendakari, sailburuok, legebiltzarkideok, egun on guztioi.

Lege honek 1994koa ordezten du. Lege horrek serio hitz egin zuen Euskadin natura babesteaz. Eta espazioak eta espezieak babesteko bidea ireki zuen. Naturak zer esan nahi duen, zer balio dituen eta gizakiak harekin zer interakzio duen pentsatzearekin batera.

Entonces, aquí mucho ha cambiado en la naturaleza y en el pensamiento humano y todo indica frente a los catastrofismos que estamos mejor en la naturaleza y nuestro pensamiento y sensibilidad. Esta ley es otro peldaño más.

Gure taldeak eskerrak eman nahi dizkie gainerako taldeei landu ahal izan dugun giro atseginagatik eta lankidetzagatik, eta bereziki lortu dugun akordiora iristeko prestasun handiena erakutsi dutenei. Inork ez du inor inposatu testu bateratu bat eraikitzen joateko. Testu horrek, zalantzarik gabe, aurrera egiten du indarrean dagoenaren gainean; eta bide berriak irekitzen ditu.

Y yo al tiempo agradezco los agradecimientos. Y sin ponerme colorado lo hago con humildad, pero sobre todo porque he podido trabajar con la viceconsejera de Medio Ambiente Amaia Barredo, a la que saludo. Y también es verdad han colaborado asesores técnicos de los grupos, especialmente Iñaki Aizpuru, con el que además me llevaba…, tengo una gran amistad y creo que ha sido un trabajo muy bonito que recordaré durante mucho tiempo por la naturalidad con la que hemos trabajado.

Solo recordar que a esta ley se presentaron 323 enmiendas y hoy en este Pleno se debaten nueve; es decir, se ha hecho un gran esfuerzo.

También he de reconocer que me da pena no haber llegado a un acuerdo con Elkarrekin Podemos, principalmente porque las enmiendas presentadas, básicamente dos, no han podido concluir en algo en que todas y todos nos sintiéramos cómodos.

Cuando esas dos enmiendas se presentaron a los dos días de finalizar el plazo de enmiendas como PNL perdieron su valor como enmiendas a debatir en ponencia y pasaron a otro escenario que las convertía en muy difíciles de transaccionar. Por un lado, la creación de la Agencia Vasca de Biodiversidad, que exclusivamente dice que asumirá funciones normativas y de gestión de todo lo relacionado con esta ley. Es decir, todo lo que hacen Gobierno más diputaciones.

A partir de ahí solo habla en genérico de que se podrá hacer por encomienda de gestión traspaso de declaración de competencias, nadie sabe. Y que una ley genere dudas es lo peor que le puede ocurrir a una ley.

Si vamos a la PNL encontramos más razones y parece que se deben a posibles descoordinaciones. Que no dudo que se produzcan como en tantas otras cosas, incluso dentro de nuestros propios grupos parlamentarios, pero eso no nos lleva a crear una agencia de grupo parlamentario, sino a profundizar internamente para resolver los problemas o minimizar.

Al tiempo no son ustedes conscientes de que existen servicios de cuatro instituciones, Gobierno y tres diputaciones, que se aplican en la materia desde hace 40 años, siguiendo fielmente el reparto competencial que en la materia hizo la LTH.

¿Ustedes creen que derruir sin más la LTH y años de experiencia por juntar todo en una nueva mega agencia hará desaparecer las descoordinaciones?

En el debate hemos analizado diferentes soluciones para abordar una mejora de esa coordinación, desde la propuesta de (?)rehacer Naturzaintza, como hasta ahora defendida por Ciudadanos-, hasta la que ha quedado plasmado definitivamente, de crear un consejo de coordinación en que participan las cuatro instituciones implicadas y cuantos técnicos se considera oportuno.

Uste dugu hori dela disfuntzioak konpontzeko modurik onena. Lege hau kudeatzen duten erakundeei (…) deskoordinazioak zuzenean konpontzen.

La otra enmienda plasmada en otra PNL dice que la propia ley delimite qué infraestructuras pueden ubicarse en cada uno de los espacios a proteger y cuáles no.

Esta ley establece que cuando se señale un espacio como susceptible de proteger, se deberá hacer una previa ordenación del mismo. Esa ordenación señalará la (?) mayor o menor con que protegerán las diferentes zonas, y la que en consecuencia determinará lo que sí y no se puede hacer en cada una de ellas, porque no es lo mismo una zona de reserva con estricta protección que zonas necesitadas de menor grado de protección o las propias de la red Natura 2000 cuando la propia directiva comunitaria señala que se trata de buscar normas que permitan la convivencia de seres humanos con la naturaleza, porque estamos hablando de protección activa, no de conservación pasiva.

También hay una enmienda en materia forestal en la que había un sorprendente artículo único, desmontan toda la política forestal de hace más de 80 años de este país y crean una nueva con la simplicidad, que dicen que en 2040 deberá haber desaparecido el 70 % de las especies forestales que ustedes sin ningún rigor científico clasifican de invasoras. Listado en el que incluyen eucalipto, pino radiata, abeto douglas.

¿Se puede decidir una cosa de este calado en una enmienda de un solo artículo de esta ley?, ¿dónde está el conocimiento científico?, ¿dónde está eso que ustedes piden tanto de hablar con la sociedad, con el sector implicado, con los forestalistas o con la ciudadanía?

Y luego está su enmienda con la que prohíben preventivamente, bonito concepto legal, prohibir preventivamente, los fitosanitarios y biocidas que estén prohibidos. Hasta ahí estamos de acuerdo, es obvio, si están prohibidos, se prohíben, ni preventivamente ni nada, se prohíben.

Pero luego dicen más, también quieren prohibir otros, a pesar de no estar prohibidos, y lo dicen así, si existe amplio consenso científico de ser tóxicos o dañinos. ¿Qué concepto jurídico es amplio consenso científico?

No sé, dónde… ya me gustaría saber dónde han estudiado Biología o Derecho.

Hori da zuek eta guk mantentzen ditugun zuzenketen laburpena. Y ya, por filosofar un rato, de todo este debate de la ley he vuelto a constatar que homo sapiens da lo mismo en sus vertientes desarrollista o proteccionista, sigue siendo el interventor permanente en un equilibrio dinámico, decidiendo lo que se debe hacer.

Unos suponen la inagotabilidad de la naturaleza, otros la necesidad de restaurar equilibrios perdidos, decidiendo cuáles son esos equilibrios. En ambos casos imponen líneas de pensamiento. Algunos les llaman ecocapitalismo y ecosocialismo, pero solo es antropocentrismo, siempre, el hombre como centro de toma de decisión sobre el resto del mundo vivo.

Y aunque alguien no lo vea así…

… ecocapitalismo y ecosocialismo. Pero solo es antropocentrismo, siempre, el hombre como centro de toma de decisión sobre el resto del mundo vivo.

Y aunque alguien no lo vea así, sepan que no voy a discutirlo. Es una constatación. Es así, porque no queda otra. Decidir proteger la naturaleza, y cómo, es una decisión exclusivamente humana. Nadie más lo puede hacer. Los (¿abordaremos?) de una manera u otra, pero todos actuamos como antropocentristas frente a la naturaleza.

Y aunque esto es irrenunciable, a veces, a mí cada vez me cuesta más, porque a mí me gusta más lo que dijo Maeterlinck, que "la naturaleza no necesita la felicidad". Muchas veces hay que dejarla tranquila.

Eso sí, hemos intentado, al menos yo, no debatir sobre ella de un modo impostor. Tentación de los llenos de despotismo ilustrado que pretenden, desde supuestos teóricos, imponer al mundo rural al que tratan de irresponsable el modo de conservar el espacio, su espacio vital. Espacio que, por cierto, si alguna vez nos fijamos en él para preservarlo, lo fue porque estuvo a salvo del (…) urbano; y curiosamente, desde antaño, siempre estuvo rodeado de gentes rurales. Por eso siempre huiré de quienes –y estos abundan– pontifican sobre la naturaleza. Porque no se puede hacer, ya que, como dijo Einstein, "la naturaleza está constituida de tal manera que resulta experimentalmente imposible determinar sus movimientos".

En definitiva, legislar sobre la naturaleza es complejo. Pero siempre creeré que debe abordarse con la pretensión de buscar el equilibrio entre, por un lado, la necesidad que el ser humano tiene de reclamar su propio espacio en el medio natural, que comparte con millones de otras especies, pero que necesita ser sostenido, y por otro, la exigencia de abordarlo, dejando a la naturaleza su espacio y su tiempo para que se recupere, se restaure y se reequilibre. Como lleva haciendo dinámicamente miles de millones de años, porque así fue conformada desde su origen en su permanente adaptación a todos los cambios previsibles o no.

Y no olvidemos nunca que lo que hay que hacer es protegerla, porque conservarla resulta demasiado esclerótico para lo que continuamente progresa y avanza.

Y termino con una cita de quien considero, al menos para mí, el gran maestro de la ecología, el doctor Margalef, que en su trabajo entre la termodinámica y el juego reflexionó: "Pensar que el hombre forma parte de la naturaleza ha de estimular su acción cooperativa con ella. Pero lo importante es mantener una actitud abierta, procurando esquivar las presiones momentáneas de las ideologías de moda. En realidad, las ideologías más militantes se sitúan un poco al margen de la consideración ecológica, porque tienden a ver al hombre como algo muy aparte de la naturaleza, con el destino de ser su dueño o su verdugo. En fin, la protección de la naturaleza debe hacerse pensando en ella sin dejar al margen a una especie como Homo Sapiens, que también forma parte de la biodiversidad, aunque sea la especie que más la deteriora".

Esta, en el fondo, es una ley para protegernos de nuestras propias actividades, pero no para excluirnos a nosotros y nosotras de ella. Porque tenemos un patrimonio único que debemos seguir protegiendo entre todas y todos. Y esta ley supone un paso más en la dirección correcta y nos dota de un marco más garantista para proteger la naturaleza. Pero ese marco no servirá si no tomamos conciencia de nuestra responsabilidad. Nuestra actividad cotidiana tiene un efecto permanente, más contundente que el de cualquier otra especie sobre el medio natural. Y esta ley no servirá de mucho si no somos solidarios y conscientes de que este es un trabajo para todas y todos nosotros y para toda la biodiversidad.

Hori esanda, berriz ere eskerrak eman nahi dizkiet talde guztiei egindako lanagatik, horrelako lege bat eztabaida latzagotatik ateratzeko elkarrekin egindako ahaleginagatik. Eta ziur nago lege berri honekin onesten duguna bezain baliagarria izango den eta iraungo duen behin betiko testu batera hurbildu izanagatik, nahiz eta espero dugun etorkizunean horrelako lege bat beharrezkoa ez izatea.

Eskerrik asko bene-benetan.

text_en:
Ladies and gentlemen, good afternoon again.

I would like, Mr Urkullu, to make two assessments, if I may, thanking him, moreover, for the tone, which is different from other lehendakaris which I have had the opportunity to hear from this rostrum.

Look, the ERTE were incorporated into the labour reform – you will remember – in the labour reform of the People's Party, by Fatima Báñez, the Minister of Labour. Yes, yes... That same labor reform as you, the Basque Nationalist Party, voted against it here in this Basque Parliament. Yes, yes, in this Basque Parliament. And that the Basque Socialist Party, with Podemos and Bildu, with that left-wing front, have fortunately failed to repeal before the pandemic; because, if not, we would not have had even ERTE for thousands and thousands of people who need it on our land as in the rest of Spain.

Another assessment, on the subject of Zaldibar. You bring a report. He did not recall that there was also a report from the Ertzaintza, which was talking about signs of crime, or another report from the European Union, from the European Union Commissioner, where in that report, in that Commissioner's comment, he was saying that there was also evidence that the appropriate environmental measures were not taken in Zaldibar.

And the question of Zaldibar, the problem of Zaldibar, was that no investigation was made, it was not reported, it was not inspected as it was to be done in Zaldibar and that that was not improvisations, as the Environment Advisor told him, but that it was realities, realities that unfortunately, today, as I explained earlier, we have what we have in Zaldibar, with still one person, unfortunately, under the rubble of Zaldibar.

I would have started at this time in another way, but after listening to Mrs Iriarte, I think... she has said it very loud, very clear, and even a bit angry or a bit angry, to Mr Egibar, – she is not at this time – but she reminded him of the shames of the Basque Nationalist Party, and she has clarified it and I thank him for clarifying it, Mrs Iriarte: those covenants on the status, on the new status, which are still broader, deeper pacts – "haundiak, zuk esaten zenuen, paktu horietan" – that what they want to present is more self-determination, more right to decide and that they had agreed and had already placed him on the track of the train with you, with the Basque Nationalist Party.

That is why, Mr Urkullu, I say to you: Basque society again... when society, this society, moves, always moves in parameters of needs different from those that you offer us with hidden pacts or interested pacts with certain political groups.

The new status is not the concern of the Basques when they get up in the morning, nor do the Basques think if we need more self-government or less self-government when they get up in the morning; the concern of the Basque citizens, the real concerns, the real problems of the citizens are focusing at the moment, as you know: first, in not getting sick, in not getting infected with this terrible pandemic, and those who are sick want to be healed as soon as possible, and those who are in those ERTE or in those EREs in our society want to find lehenbailehen

Therefore, when you wake up or get up these people only think if you can get out of this crisis, if there is light at the end of this tunnel. They want to know if they will be able to climb the blind of their businesses so many merchants, who do not know if they will have to open or close that blind or if they arrive at the end of the month so many autonomous who have very serious problems. And those are the real problems of this society, because the people, the vast majority, you know, mainly you, are distressed by what is happening right now in our land.

The reality is that we have a different society that four years ago, logically, and even eight months ago, but his speech, look, has not changed anything. I insist, self-criticism zero; I have told you before, Mr Urkullu: you have made a statement of intentions, without compromise, much desire, much aspiration, much intention, as you said, etc., etc., in short, much raca-raca, blah, blah, blah; but, by the way, about the complaints that you told me earlier about education, listen, are the complaints that we still have yesterday... the complaints of educational agents, it is not because we only read them, that also in the media that appear, because the media also talk to the same educational agents, is that it is those educational agents who are transferring these complaints to us, but their recipes are... I told you before, those of the past, those of management failure, improvisation, inefficiency...

You have been ruling for eight years, and you bring here almost again the same program with more vote, really, with a loose majority, a very broad majority for you, which, by the way, is the program that you have not fulfilled, much of it, in the previous legislature. You will remember it; now you are talking about 26 laws, but you promised 28 laws in this House, in your legislative programme – yes, yes, Mr Urkullu, we have read it, we have, I will pass them: 28 laws – Do you know how many of you have passed here in this House?, eight, eight laws, and now by listening to them you bring us the same laws as if they seemed to govern others, other people, other political parties. Society changes and you do not change; in that it is unalterable.

I wanted to talk to you again about the issue of self-government, which you have mentioned on several occasions and which I mentioned earlier at the beginning of my speech. I want to make clear to you our position, that of the People's and Citizens' Group, which is the defence of this Statute of Gernika, and I say to you more: if we have to reform things of the Statute we must reform those things that we want to preserve, we must reform those things that we want to preserve, and here comes the crux of the question: you, the nationalists, do not want to retain this Statute of Gernika, but you want to liquidate it. And I give them an example: if you, for example, are going to change your home or you are going to change your home, you don't commit works of reform and improvements, why if you are going to sell it, if you are going to change? What is happening, what is happening, is that you do want to change houses, you want to change houses with these gentlemen, so you do not want reforms in this statute, and the change of houses is that new status, which serves the independence of the Basque Country and the annexation of Navarre.

I respect him, I'm sorry... I would repeat it to Basque society in campaign to the point of satiety: that you presented yourself here, you will remember, with the lack of moderation, that you were going to park the issue of status in a drawer and that you were going to take it out, you were going to take it out again, after the elections; I told you also in the debate.

I must acknowledge one thing, Mr Urkullu, which has hit speed records. They sent as a ram the Madam President to announce it, the President of Parliament, to announce it in her speech, and you are already going to be on the locomotive running... They're going to put the locomotive in motion for that status.

Because, look, I want to tell you one thing: the reality is that the nationalists, nationalism in general, are still looking for that door of departure, that door of exit of the Constitution, the door of exit of the Statute of Gernika, and you are thundering magnificently, and going from moderation to radicality when you want, in a plas fold. And in some moments you are in this moderation, and you sell us moderation, and in other moments you go to radicality. You can sing Mikel Laboa songs here, and then you go to Madrid and then you sing Manolo Escobar to us. Well... The Basque Nationalist Party is like this, it is like this; they have that game, which is good for them at certain times.

And, as I said before, one thing is the reform of the statute and another very different position in key... , Mr Urkullu, as a keystone of the Spanish Constitution. There you will never find us, talking about bilaterality, when you want, above all, unilaterality and not bilaterality. By the way, a point, since he has cited the topic of forality and its interpretation, I, to tell him that there is nothing more Spanish than forality and, if not – do not laugh – check the history of where it comes from and learn that there is nothing more Spanish than that.

In conclusion, Mr Urkullu, you have quoted the word "collaboration" on numerous occasions.

By the way, Mrs Mendia, you have explained to me here, you have brought me that 91-page torch, which you have hidden and which you have not taught until today, until we have sat the parliamentarians in the seats of this Parliament – the ability to be attentive to the debate and to read it I assure you that it is very complicated for me, it is very complicated... Now, I don't know, I, maybe; I know my limitations, I... (Barreak) Superwoman

But let's talk about one thing: we do read the basics, that five-page "paper", but don't divert attention, Mrs. Mendia, the problem is your piece of paper, I tell you again, how the media said that the status issue is parked; you have said it here, you demarcate, you leave it as a question that doesn't go with you, because you are not going to reach that agreement with the Basque Nationalist Party, fortunately, but you leave Mr. Urkullu free to change his dance partner at that time and go with that lady. Well, all right... Congratulations, Mrs. Mendia!

Finally, Mr Urkullu, he has quoted on numerous occasions, too, that he is reaching out to us and then, I do not know, despises us; I do not know if he wants to build this way, to establish ties with the opposition, as I have said before. You offer us extended hand, and then you offer fist, iron fist.

But I want to tell you, in conclusion, that the Basque-Citizens Popular Group, I insist, to save lives in this country, to revive the economy, to revive the industry, to generate employment..., we will be supporting it in everything, absolutely in everything, but for other velocities, to ruin Euskadi, then you have to look in front of your bench and you will have to talk to the other candidate, Mrs Iriarte, if you want to ruin Euskadi with those of Bildu.

Thank you so much.
text:
Legebiltzarburu andrea, jaun-andreok, arratsalde on berriro.

Me gustaría, señor Urkullu, hacer dos apreciaciones, si me lo permite, agradeciéndole, además, el tono, tono diferente a otros lehendakaris que he tenido la posibilidad de escuchar desde esta tribuna.

Mire usted, los ERTE fueron incorporados en la reforma laboral –usted lo recordará–, en la reforma laboral del Partido Popular, por Fátima Báñez, la ministra de Trabajo. Sí, sí… Esa misma reforma laboral que ustedes, el Partido Nacionalista Vasco, aquí la votaron en contra, en este Parlamento Vasco. Sí, sí, en este Parlamento Vasco. Y que el Partido Socialista de Euskadi, con Podemos y con Bildu, con ese frente de izquierdas, no han logrado, afortunadamente, derogar antes de la pandemia; porque, si no, no hubiésemos tenido ni ERTE para miles y miles de personas que lo necesitan en nuestra tierra como en el resto de España.

Otra apreciación, sobre el tema de Zaldibar. Usted trae un informe. No ha recordado que hay un informe de la Ertzaintza también, que estaba hablando de indicios de criminalidad, u otro informe de la Unión Europea, del comisario de la Unión Europea, donde en ese informe, en ese comentario del comisario, estaba diciendo que hay indicios también de que no se tomaron las medidas medioambientales oportunas en Zaldibar.

Y la cuestión de Zaldibar, el problema de Zaldibar, fue que no se hizo investigación, no se informó, no se inspeccionó como se debía hacer en Zaldibar y que eso no eran improvisaciones, como le decía el consejero de Medio Ambiente, sino que eran realidades, realidades por las que, desgraciadamente, hoy, como le he explicado anteriormente, tenemos lo que tenemos en Zaldibar, con todavía una persona, desgraciadamente, bajo los escombros de Zaldibar.

Yo hubiese comenzado en estos momentos de otra manera, pero después de escucharle a la señora Iriarte, yo creo… ella se lo ha dicho muy alto, muy claro, e incluso medio enfadada o medio cabreada, al señor Egibar, –no está en estos momentos–, pero le recordaba las vergüenzas del Partido Nacionalista Vasco, y lo ha aclarado y le agradezco que lo aclare, señora Iriarte: esos pactos sobre el estatuto, sobre el nuevo estatus, que siguen siendo pactos más amplios, más profundos –"haundiak, zuk esaten zenuen, paktu horietan"–, que lo que quieren presentar es más autodeterminación, más derecho a decidir y que lo tenían pactado y lo tenían ya colocado en la vía del tren con ustedes, con el Partido Nacionalista Vasco.

Por eso, señor Urkullu, yo le digo: la sociedad vasca de nuevo… cuando la sociedad, esta sociedad, se mueve, se mueve siempre en parámetros de necesidades diferentes a los que nos ofrecen ustedes con pactos escondidos o pactos interesados con determinados grupos políticos.

El nuevo estatuto no es la preocupación de los vascos cuando se levantan por la mañana, ni tampoco piensan los vascos si necesitamos más autogobierno o menos autogobierno cuando se levantan por la mañana; la preocupación de los ciudadanos vascos, las verdaderas preocupaciones, los problemas reales de los ciudadanos se están centrando en estos momentos, como usted sabe: primero, en no enfermar, en no contagiarse de esta terrible pandemia, y los que están enfermos quieren sanarse cuanto antes, y los que están en esos ERTE o en esos ERE en nuestra sociedad quieren encontrar lehenbailehen

Por lo tanto, cuando se despierta o se levanta esta gente solo piensa si se puede salir de esta crisis, si es que hay luz al final de este túnel. Quieren saber si podrán subir la persiana de sus comercios tantos y tantos comerciantes, que no saben si van a tener que abrirla o cerrarla esa persiana o si llegan a fin de mes tantos y tantos autónomos que tienen gravísimos problemas. Y esos son los verdaderos problemas de esta sociedad, porque la gente, la gran mayoría, usted lo sabe, principalmente usted, está angustiada por lo que está ocurriendo en estos momentos en nuestra tierra.

La realidad es que tenemos una sociedad diferente que hace cuatro años, lógico, e incluso que hace ocho meses, pero su discurso, mire, no ha cambiado nada.
