Jauzi bat egin beharraz ohartarazten gaitu, bai Korrikak bai Euskaraldiak, ezagutzatik erabilerara egin beharreko jauziaz, eta uste dut gaurko akordio hau bide horretan doala, mundu digitalean ere euskara erabilerarako hizkuntza izan behar delako, ba, esan bezala, biziraun nahi badu.

Beraz, gaur lau horma altu handi hauen artean, eta bihar kalean, Korrikan, denok batzen gaituen −eta oraindik gehiago batuko gaituen− horren alde egingo dugu. Hitzekin, Korrikaren leloak esaten duen bezala, baina ez hitzekin bakarrik, baita ekintzekin egingo dugu. Beraz, eskerrik asko. Eta itxaroten dut bihar denok Korrikan elkar ikustea.

Eskerrik asko.

text_en:
Good morning again.

Before we begin with this subject, I want to thank the laborers, individuals, and platforms of the Gastize platform.

I know you're not interested in this subject, but I'll tell you that the future is the strategic point in connection with what we've been talking about. So you will see if you lose an interesting discussion.

Many and many of you here are parents, besides members of the legislature. What future do you want for your children? A rich future? They'll be able to build the life project they want and they'll have a chance to do it? (For it is one thing to will, and it is another thing to have choice). What value do you promote among your children? Do you want selfish children or soly children? Do you want claristic sons, racists, homophobic, or intelligent children who will fight for a better world, who will know how to form themselves in life, and who will know how to face different situations?

Do you want what you want for your children, too? What kind of social model are you building for that? What kind of society are you fighting for?

Because what we're fighting about today is the model of society we're building. That's what we have today to discuss, because the education model is associated with a social pattern. We often say "an education model," such a social model. And it's not just a fool. It's true.

If the society which we are building is a social society, or if it is a social society, whether it be a society of two-speeds, or a one-speed society, where the rights will be a privilege, or a society where all the rights will be guaranteed to all the citizens, whatever the colour, the origin, economic, social, or culture of the citizens.

The problem is not that of education, the problem is not that of public school, the problem of which is everybody's, the problem we have as a society. It's the mental empanada we've got. But, unfortunately, we turn the problem to school, so that this variety we cannot manage as a society is managed by schools, if it is possible to do so without very little resources and too much noise, without causing too much trouble. We're using the problem to the public school, not always, but most of the time.

And then we reproach the public school that it does not resist or that it does not produce a quality project, that the teachers do not imply or that their parents do not participate in it, or that they are not democratic schools, when in the latter decades the neck of this society has been carried away by the public school, and when it has drawn its course. When public school has been the last decades of this society, and when it is a public school, it is again the 21st. when we think of the affairs of the century as well as of society, or of the precipices, as you would call them, we pull them together, and again draw them again.

This we shall speak afterwards of the right of fathers' decision, to justify ourselves, and to justify ourselves, or of a pupil or family, which is different from us in the study of children.

It's a lie. It's a lie when you say you want to build a school that won't leave anyone behind. Thousands of citizens, families, students, schools, teachers... Because we're leaving behind. It doesn't matter. And I will believe this phrase when I see the measures, the will, and I hope that the agreement we have made today is a starting-point.

It is a lie when it is said that it struggles against poverty, that it is just when we encourage the poverty and the social race; it is a lie when it is said that multiplicity is wealth, when multiplicity is delayed, when multiplicity is generally used for the most part to put all of us to colour the photographs, or to ask for a vote.

You will say that my speech today is very negative, catastrophic. You'll excuse me, but I'm sick of pretty words, I'm sick of hypocrisy, and we're late. There were some of us here watching the schools, we know what's going on, we know. We don't know if everyone knows... It was a pity that the Social Party did not approach the schools.

And we learn nothing, and see all that is going on in other countries before us, we are incapable of learning or of resisting anything. and these challenges have come to stop such difficulties. They came to stay. That's the European society, that's the 21st. the society of the century, whether we like it or not, but that's what we have.

But, well, you can go around the schools and you'll see that we've deserted schools, that we've deserted teachers, and yet teachers do wonders. They perform miracles by patience, by love, and dedication. But, of course, miracles have a limit too.

Many and many of them are models schools, whose names I don't know what fame and what sort of names these schools are called, but they've been marked, they've been stigmatized, and you know that once you put the mark on it, it's very hard to turn it around.

When we speak of the distinction or segregation of students, we immediately place the focus in migration. And you'll excuse me, but migration isn't the problem because I don't know what kind of player children are coming from or whose trainer's children... Everyone wants them in their schools. The question is, therefore, that migration is not a problem; it is a social tie; it is a problem that we have more and more complex society, and the school has no resources and no means to resist it. The difficulty is, that multiplicity is increased, that it is more complex, and that the means which it requires are not adapted to resist it, and to which it ought not to be directed.

Their education is a very high-quality project. But they have bigger difficulty in developing a project. They have a greater difficulty because society and reality are more complex. And then he is not himself in comparison with the schools which must be opposed to a much lower complexity.

We therefore oppose the romances and questions which we have as society, that is to say, we share them among all schools, or (it is another alternative to distinguish the means in a distinct manner, but I think both are necessary, one and the other;) or else we are at liberty.

There's no need to think about it: When we've passed through school, we've been told what measures are, all personnel agree. There's an agreement at the table of high-rate education and plurality.

The Basque Country is not making up precautions, we are only making agreements to push and force these measures to force them into force, to press them in order to force them.

These measures are necessarily the stability of the teacher, because education projects cannot be developed otherwise; the pattern of scholarship must be modified, the schools must be provided with facility, and the resources of human resources must be increased; we need multidilinear equipment, etc., etc., etc., etc., and so on.

The question is, then, that we must take steps, that politics must be made, that we must make an investment, and start the measures, leaving the focus in migration, leaving the students and families to be criminalized, taking a step forward and taking care of what is to be done by the consumers, arranging and damping the classes with their states, instead of looking at the stomachs of public schools, leaving the decision to hide them in the arms of the right, and betting on the side of the invasion, the competition between us, the struggle between us, and the education that has been built between them.

'Cause that's enough! Or we do it among all, or we don't have it! But we're late, we're too late, and society's overrun us. And what comes is worse. It's worse. Then wake up, Mrs. Uriart, wake up! And to-day we have a grip, a starting-point, and let's get the measures in force!

That's what we were asked for in college. We're told to be cool, but come on. What I said: or we all do it or we don't have it.

And even if the value of capitalism is competition, which leads to a purely educational market, we must not forget what is the function of education. The function of education is an equalist function, a compensationer, for the difference of choice. And if we do it wrong, the consequences we'll get from it will be hard. And what we're going to have to suffer as a society is worse, and we're going to have to invest more.

What we're doing even in economic terms is not possible (such as some, in economic terms, you'll understand better). Not to mention that we are now forming worlds, parallel societies in our country, in our society: Those who don't even know what it is, who don't even know our culture, don't even speak our language. They're parallel worlds. Is that how we go on as a village? It's impossible.

Even in the case of modern innovations, Madame Tapia is the possibility that she is not here today even in your eyes (Casanova will know) we would settle on another level, if we were to work on the four adjacent axes: first, inclution; then interaction; the third, the rating of divergence. What for? To get the fourth: to feel a part of this society, to perform "sensencia," the "Lido de lacentencia."

And if we don't work on the first three, the fourth is no use, but we need education policy for the three of us, we need employment policy, we need housing policy, we need culture policy, not the segrant policy we're doing.

Imagine what capital we would have as a country, if, as a society, the whole community were to play the same level, if all the citizens, all the citizens, should be involved in a self-organizing or independent process of activity and activity, if all of them were to be part of this society. "Sentido de la perfectencia." We're not doing that. And then we're thinking about starting a process of self-resistentization or deeper into self-portraits? I don't know how.

And, Mrs. Uriart, it's up to you. Everyone here is responsible, but it's up to you. But don't look the other way, and give me what age demands.

We got an agreement today. It hasn't been easy and hasn't been the first initiative, or will be the last initiative, a starting-point to unlock the theme.

For the first time even a confession is given to the work of the Gastine Table, and its measures are taken notice of. The agreement to-day may be a starting-point to unlock the subject, and above all, a glance at the next lesson in order to force the measures.

And it's up to you, Mrs. Uriart. Start the medaila, lead the way, but move! It's an instrument we leave in your hands. That's right, if you don't, we'll keep working, we'll keep wetting, we'll keep bringing in the initiative, because it's not the first time.

And it seems to us that there is need of all of us there, because that is what we are asking of us from the schools, is what we ask of us in the family, and above all, children and children, who are in need of future citizens, and all of us. So, today there's a grip and we want you to use that handle.

But if you don't share it, or if there's no will to pull it, we prefer to say to the face, that the object of the government is not a champion, but a First Step, Regiorian, &c. A two-speed village, two-speed education.

Let us speak clearly for once, but above all let us quit our discourse, abandon positions, and take measures. They'll thank us very much, and it'll only be good for all of us.
text:
Egun on berriro.

Gai honekin hasi aurretik, lehenik eta behin, eskerrak eman nahi dizkiet segregazioari aurre egiten eta gizarte-kohesioaren alde lan egiten ari diren eragile, norbanako eta plataformei, baita Gasteizeko plataformakoei ere.

Badakit gai hau ez zaizuela interesatzen, baina esango dizuet etorkizunari begira estrategikoa dela, lehen hitz egin dugun gaiarekin lotuta. Beraz, zuek ikusiko duzue eztabaida interesgarria galtzen duzuen.

Hemen zaudeten asko eta asko gurasoak zarete, legebiltzarkideak izateaz gain. Zuen seme-alabentzat zein etorkizun nahi duzue? Etorkizun oparoa? Nahi duten bizitza-proiektua eraikitzeko gai izango dutena eta horretarako aukera izango dutena? (zeren gauza bat da nahi izatea eta beste gauza bat da aukera izatea). Zuen seme-alaben artean zer-nolako baloreak sustatzen dituzue? Seme-alaba berekoiak nahi dituzue ala solidarioak? Seme klasistak, arrazistak, homofoboak nahi dituzue edo mundu hobeago baten, justuago baten alde borrokatuko duten seme-alaba adimentsu, bizitzan moldatzen jakingo dutenak eta egoera desberdinei aurre egiten jakingo dutenak?

Zuen seme-alabentzat nahi duzuena, besteentzat ere nahi duzue? Horretarako, zer-nolako gizarte-eredua eraikitzen ari zarete? Zer-nolako gizartearen alde borrokatzen ari zarete?

Zeren gaurko eztabaidan eztabaidagai daukaguna da eraikitzen ari garen gizarte-eredua. Hori da gaurkoan eztabaidagai daukaguna, zeren hezkuntza-eredua gizarte ereduarekin lotuta dago. Askotan esaten dugu "nolako hezkuntza-eredua, halako gizarte-eredua". Eta ez da lelo huts bat. Egia da.

Eraikitzen ari garen gizartea gizarte soziala den edo gizarte penala den; eraikitzen ari garen gizartea bi abiadurako gizartea den edo abiadura bakarreko gizartea den; eskubideak pribilegio bilakatuko duen gizartea den edo eskubide guztiak herritar guztientzat bermatua egongo den gizartea den, dena delako herritarren azal kolorea, jatorria, maila ekonomikoa, soziala edo kulturala.

Arazoa ez da hezkuntzarena, arazoa ez da eskola publikoarena, arazoa guztiona da, gizarte bezala daukagun arazoa. Arazoa dugun enpanada mentala da. Baina, zoritzarrez, arazoa eskolara bideratzen dugu, gizarte gisa kudeatzeko gai ez garen aniztasun hori eskolak kudeatu dezan, ahal bada baliabide gutxirekin eta zarata gehiegi atera gabe, gehiegi molestatu gabe. Arazoa eskola publikora bideratzen dugu, ez beti, baina ia beti.

Eta gero, gainera, eskola publikoari leporatzen diogu ez duela euskalduntzen edo ez duela kalitatezko proiekturik, irakasleak ez direla inplikatzen edo gurasoek ez dutela parte hartzen, edota ez direla eskola demokratikoak, azken hamarkadetan gizarte honen sama eskola publikoak eraman duenean eta berak tira egin duenean gizarte hau aurrera ateratzeko. Eskola publikoa izan denean azken hamarkadetan gizarte hau euskaldundu duena, eta eskola publikoa denean, berriro ere, XXI. mendean gizarte bezala ditugun arazoei edo erronkei, deitu nahi duzuen bezala, tira egiten eta berriro ere sama bere gain usten dugunean.

Hori bai, gero geure burua justifikatzeko, zuritzeko, gurasoen erabaki-eskubideaz hitz egingo dugu, edota seme-alabak eramaten diren kontzertatuan gurekiko desberdina den ikasle edo familia erabiliko da adibide gisa puntu koloretsua emateko.

Gezurra da. Gezurra da esaten denean inor atzean utziko ez duen eskola eraiki nahi dela. Dagoeneko milaka herritar, familia, ikasle, ikastetxe, irakasle… atzean uzten ari garelako. Ez da neurririk hartzen. Eta esaldi hori sinetsiko dut ikusten ditudanean neurriak, borondatea, eta espero dut gaur lortu dugun akordioa horretarako abiapuntua izatea.

Gezurra da esaten denean pobreziaren aurka borrokatzen ari dela, gizarte-arrakalari aurre egiten ari dela, justu pobrezia eta gizarte-arrakala sustatzen ari garenean; gezurra da aniztasuna aberastasuna dela esaten denean, aniztasuna atzerakada ematen duenean, aniztasuna gehienetan kanpaina elektoraletan guztiok argazkiei kolorea jartzeko erabiltzen dugunean, edota botoa eskatzeko.

Esango duzue gaurko nire diskurtsoa oso negatiboa, katastrofikoa dela. Barkatuko didazue, baina kokoteraino nago hitz politez, kokoteraino nago hipokresiaz, eta oso berandu goaz. Hemen batzuk egon ginen ikastetxeak ikusten, badakigu zer gertatzen ari den, badakigu. Ez dakigu guztiek dakizuen…; pena bat izan zen Alderdi Sozialista ikastetxeetara ez hurbiltzea.

Eta ez gabiltza ezer ikasten eta gure aurretik doazen beste herrialdeetan gertatzen ari den guztia ikusita ere ez gara gai ezer ikasteko edota aurre hartzeko XXI. mendeko erronkei edo arazoei; eta erronka horiek, arazo horiek geratzeko etorri dira. Geratzeko etorri dira. Hori da Europako gizartea, hori da XXI. mendeko gizartea, nahi edo ez, baina hori da daukaguna.

Baina, tira, eman ikastetxeetatik buelta bat eta ikusiko duzue ikastetxeak abandonatuak ditugula, irakasleak abandonatuak ditugula eta, hala ere, irakasleek mirariak egiten dituzte. Mirariak egiten dituzte pazientziaz, maitasunez eta dedikazioz. Baina, noski, mirariek ere muga bat dute.

Asko eta asko ikastetxe eredugarriak dira, mila buelta ematen dizkietenak ez dakit nolako ospea eta ez dakit zer-nolako izena daukaten ikastetxe horiei, baina marka bat jarri zaie, estigmatizatuak izan dira, eta badakizue behin marka jarri ostean horri buelta ematea oso zaila da.

Ikasleen bereizkeriaz edo segregazioaz hitz egiten dugunean, fokua berehala migrazioan jartzen dugu. Eta barkatuko didazue, baina migrazioa ez da arazoa, ze kanpotik datozen ez dakit zer jokalariren seme-alabak edo ez dakit noren entrenatzailearen seme-alabak…, guztiek horiek beraien ikastetxeetan nahi dituzte. Beraz, migrazioa ez da arazoa; arazoa gizarte-arrakala da; arazoa mugikortasuna da; arazoa da dugun gero eta gizarte konplexuagoa, eta eskolak ez du baliabiderik eta ez zaio eman baliabiderik horri aurre egiteko. Arazoa da aniztasuna gero eta handiagoa dela, konplexuagoa dela, eta beharko lituzkeen baliabideak horri aurre egiteko eta horretarako beharko lituzkeen ratio egokituak ez direla bideratu, eta ez direla bideratu nahi.

Euren hezkuntza kalitatezko proiektua da, kalitatezkoa da. Baina proiektua garatzeko zailtasun handiagoak dituzte. Zailtasun handiagoak dituzte aurre egin behar dien gizartea eta errealitatea konplexuagoa delako. Eta, orduan, ez da bera beste konplexutasun askoz ere baxuagoari aurre egin behar dion ikastetxeekin konparatuta.

Beraz, gizarte gisa ditugun erronkei eta arazoei guztion artean aurre egiten diegu, hau da, ikastetxe guztien artean konpartitzen ditugu, edo, bestela (beste aukera bat da baliabideak modu desberdinduan bereiztea, baina nik pentsatzen dut bai biak behar direla, bata eta bestea), edo bestela jai daukagu.

Ez dago zertan horri neurriak asmatzen ibili: ikastetxeetatik pasatu garenean esan digute zeintzuk diren neurriak, eragile guztiek ere bat egiten dute. Gasteizeko Hezkuntza eta Aniztasun Mahaian adostasuna dago.

ez dabil neurriak asmatzen, bakarrik adostasuna dagoen neurriak ekartzen ari gara bultza egiteko eta neurri horiek indarrean jartzeko, presionatzeko benetan neurri horiek indarrean sartzeko.

Neurri horiek, ezinbestean, irakaslearen egonkortasuna dira, hezkuntza-proiektuak bestela ezin direlako garatu; beka-eredua aldatu behar da, ikastetxeei erraztasunak eman behar zaizkie; giza baliabideak areagotu behar dira; bestelako ekipo multidiziplinarrak behar ditugu, eta abar eta abar.

Orduan kontua da urratsak egin behar direla, politikak egin behar direla, inbertsioa egin behar dela eta neurriak abian jarri behar direla, fokua migrazioan jartzeari utziaz, ikasle eta familiak kriminalizatzeari utziaz, kontzertatuek pausu bat aurrera emanez eta dagokien ardura hartuaz, ikastolak egoerekin inplikatuaz eta bustiaz, ikastetxe publikoen artean ere elkarlana bideratuz bakoitzaren zilborrera begiratzen egon beharrean, gurasook erabaki eskubidearen armarrian ezkutatzeari utziaz eta inklusioaren aldeko apustua eginez, gure arteko borroka, lehia, inertziak, denak albo batera utziaz eta denon artean denon hezkuntza, denon gizartea eraikiaz.

Zeren nahikoa da! Edo guztien artean egiten dugu edo jai daukagu! Baina berandu goaz, oso berandu goaz, eta gizartea gainetik pasatu zaigu. Eta datorrena okerragoa da, okerragoa da. Orduan, esnatu, Uriarte andrea, esnatu! Eta gaurkoa daukagu helduleku bat, abiapuntu bat, eta goazen neurriak indarrean sartzera!

Hori da ikastetxeetan eskatu digutena. Esan digute "oso ondo etortzea, baina benga ja". Esan dudana: edo denon artean egiten dugu edo jai daukagu.

Eta nahiz eta kapitalismoaren baloreak lehia diren, hezkuntza merkatu soil izatera bideratzen duten, ez dugu ahaztu behar zein den hezkuntzaren funtzioa. Hezkuntzaren funtzioa funtzio berdintzailea da, konpentsatzailea, aukera-berdintasunerakoa. Eta gaizki egiten badugu, gero jasoko ditugun ondorioak latzak izango dira. Eta gizarte gisa pairatu beharko duguna larriagoa da, eta gehiago inbertitu beharko dugu.

Termino ekonomikoetan ere egiten ari garena ez da bideragarria (horrela batzuek, termino ekonomikoetan, hobeto ulertuko duzue). Kontatu gabe momentu honetan ari garela mundu, gizarte paraleloak sortzen gure herrian, gure gizartean: Euskadi ere zer den ez dakitenak, gure kultura ere ezagutzen ez dutenak, gure hizkuntza ere ez. Mundu paraleloak dira. Horrela egingo dugu herri bezala aurrera? Ezinezkoa da.

Orain modan jarri den berrikuntzaren ikuspegitik ere, Tapia andrea –pena da gaur hemen ez egotea– 4.0 ikuspegitik ere (Casanovak jakingo du) beste maila batean kokatuko ginateke, Champions -en kokatuko ginateke ondorengo lau ardatzen baitan lan egingo bagenu: lehenengo, inklusioa; gero, interakzioa; hirugarrena, dibertsitatearen balorazioa. Zertarako? Laugarrena lortzeko: gizarte honen parte sentitzeko, "sentido de la pertenencia" lantzeko.

Eta lehenengo hirurak ez baditugu lantzen, laugarrena alferrik da, baina lehenengo hirurak ere lantzeko hezkuntza-politika behar dugu, enplegu-politika behar dugu, etxebizitza-politika behar dugu, kultura-politika behar dugu, eta ez egiten ari garen politika segregazionista.

Imajinatu zer-nolako kapitala izango genuke herri bezala, gizarte bezala, Champions -en denek maila berdinean jokatuko balute, herritar guztiek, autogobernu- edo burujabetza-prozesu bat abian jartzeko eta bultzatzeko, guztiok, herritar guztiak sentituko balira gizarte honetako parte. "Sentido de la pertenencia"-rekin. Ez gabiltza hori egiten. Eta gero pentsatzen dugu burujabetza-prozesu bat abiatzea edo autogobernuan sakontzea? Ez dakit nola.

Eta, Uriarte andrea, zure esku dago. Hemen guztiok daukagu erantzukizuna, baina zure esku dago. Baina ez begiratu beste aldera eta eman garaiek eskatzen duten maila.

Gaurkoan adostasun bat lortu dugu. Ez da erraza izan eta ez da ere lehenengo ekimena izan, ezta azkeneko ekimena izango, abiapuntu bat gaia desblokeatzeko.

Lehenengo aldiz, Gasteizko Mahaiak egindako lanari ere aitortza bat ematen zaio eta bertako neurriak kontuan hartzen dira. Gaurko adostasuna abiapuntua izan daiteke gaia desblokeatzen hasteko eta, batez ere, datorren ikasturtera begira neurriak indarrean sartzeko.

Eta zure esku dago, Uriarte andrea. Jarri medaila, lideratu, baina mugitu! Da bitarteko bat zure eskuetan uzten duguna. Hori bai, ez baduzu egiten, guk jarraituko dugu lanean, bustitzen jarraituko dugu, ekimenak ekartzen jarraituko dugu, zeren ez da lehenengo aldia izan.

Eta iruditzen zaigu hor guztion beharra dagoela, zeren hori den ikastetxeetatik eskatzen ari zaiguna, hori da familien aldetik eskatzen zaiguna, eta batez ere, haurrek eta ikasleek, etorkizuneko herritarrek behar dutena eta guztiok behar duguna. Beraz, gaurkoan helduleku bat dago eta nahi duguna da helduleku hori baliatzea.

Baina ez baduzu konpartitzen edo benetan ez badago borondaterik tira egiteko, nahiago dugu aurpegira esatea, Gobernuaren helburua ez dela Champions bat, baizik eta Lehenengo Maila, Erregionala eta abar. Bi abiadurako herri bat, bi abiadurako hezkuntza bat.

Goazen behingoagatik argi hitz egitera, baina batez ere goazen diskurtsoak alde batera uztera, posizionamenduak alde batera uztera eta neurriak hartzera. Asko eskertuko digute eta guztiontzat onura besterik ez da izango.

text_en:
Thank you, President.

Lehendakari, counselors, counselors, ladies and gentlemen. Good morning.

I take this time of explanation of vote to say that the Basque Socialists welcome the adoption of this law and its reform, since it affects one of the bodies that depend on this Parliament, which are accountable to it and to the citizens, and because, with this amendment, we contribute to updating and improving a law that already has 32 years of life, but without losing the flexibility and capacity for self-organisation that has accompanied the proceedings of the Court.

In this regard, I would also like to take the opportunity to convey that the reasonableness, objectivity, independence, that attitude and, ultimately, the quality of the Court's reports are duly guaranteed by the technical solvency of its workers, auditors, lawyers and advisers, and by the work systems, procedures and approval of reports which have been dealt with during all these years.

We are talking about the Court of Auditors, which is responsible for supervising public administrations. And we agree on the need to strengthen the conditions of impartiality, experience and technical knowledge of its members. That is why we highlight as very positive aspects in the amendment of this law and which have already been highlighted previously: the strengthening of the three-fifths majority of the favourable votes of this House to elect the members of the Basque Court of Public Accounts.

The strengthening of transparency, the limitation to a renewal of the term of office of the members of the Tribunal, which has reached a maximum of 12 years' term of office. Expand the profile of candidates, but also a greater demand for experience. The need for a balanced appointment between women and men members of the Basque Court of Auditors. The drafting of an internal regulation and the strengthening of the cases of incompatibility and abstention, as well as the strengthening of impartiality and transparency.

We are therefore very pleased with the work and consensus on all these improvements, because we understand that, with these modifications, we contribute to the credibility and prestige of the public accounts supervisory bodies.

Nothing more. Thank you very much.
text:
Gracias, presidenta.

Lehendakari, consejeras, consejeros, señorías. Buenos días.

Aprovecho este tiempo de explicación de voto para manifestar que los socialistas vascos nos alegramos de la aprobación de esta ley y de su reforma, puesto que afecta a uno de los organismos que dependen de este Parlamento, que rinden cuentas ante él y ante los ciudadanos, y porque, con esta modificación, contribuimos actualizar y mejorar una ley que cuenta ya con 32 años de vida, pero sin perder la flexibilidad y la capacidad de autoorganización que ha acompañado a las actuaciones del Tribunal.

En este sentido, quiero también aprovechar para transmitir que la razonabilidad, la objetividad, independencia, esa actitud y, en definitiva, la calidad de los informes del Tribunal está debidamente garantizada por la solvencia técnica de sus trabajadores, auditores, letrados y consejeros, y por los sistemas de trabajo, procedimientos y aprobación de informes de los que se ha ido tratando durante todos estos años.

Estamos hablando del Tribunal de Cuentas, de quien está encargado de fiscalizar a las administraciones públicas. Y coincidimos en la necesidad de reforzar las condiciones de imparcialidad, de experiencia y de conocimiento técnico de sus miembros. Esa es la razón por la que destacamos como aspectos muy positivos en la modificación de esta ley y que ya se han destacado previamente: el refuerzo de la mayoría de las tres quintas partes de los votos favorables de esta Cámara para elegir a las y los miembros del Tribunal Vasco de Cuentas Públicas.

El refuerzo de la transparencia, la limitación a una renovación en el mandato de los y las miembros del Tribunal, lo que hace un máximo de 12 años de mandato. Ampliar el perfil de los candidatos, pero también una mayor exigencia de experiencia. La necesidad de una designación equilibrada entre mujeres y hombres miembros del Tribunal Vasco de Cuentas. La elaboración de un reglamento interno y el refuerzo de los supuestos de incompatibilidad y abstención, así como el reforzamiento de la imparcialidad y la transparencia.

Por todo ello, nos alegramos mucho del trabajo y del consenso en torno a todas estas mejoras, porque entendemos que, con estas modificaciones, contribuimos a generar credibilidad y prestigio de los órganos fiscalizadores de las cuentas públicas.

Nada más. Muchas gracias.

text_en:
Egun on. Good morning. Thank you, President.

Mr Maeztu, you are asking us in this motion to urge the Basque Government to paralyse at least six months the work of the high-speed train, and in the meantime to commission a cost-benefit analysis to a research group, and when the report is made to make a full monograph in order to reach the broadest possible agreement. It seems that the agreement that already exists, and that has been expressed in countless occasions, does not seem sufficient, or does not take it into consideration.

I'm going to read you some expressions, to see how they sound to you: "Rigurous cost-benefit analysis" versus "ad hoc reports on supposed direct economic impact of a public investment of huge amounts of public money, those reports made to the taste of the payer." Those words are yours, Mr. Maeztu, carried out in the interpellation that gave rise to this motion. In such a spirit, it is difficult for you to approach any report or study of any expert with the right attitude.

You will recognize that your words sound, as little, prejudiced, which is the same as saying that you have an opinion and an unfavorable and tenacious previous choice to the high-speed train, to which knowledge comes only as this knowledge feeds your choice and your opinion.

At the request of the committee, and at your initiative, two experts appeared last month specifically to give their opinion on the economic and social profitability of the high-speed train. Wow, what you're asking for now, we just got it. I don't know if I'd need much more. Professors Germà Bel of the Autonomous University of Barcelona and David Hoyos of the University of the Basque Country were, as has already been recalled.

It is true that as a general conclusion they cast doubts arising from their research into the economic and social profitability of the high-speed train, but, Mr Maeztu, they were not as categorical or as manic as you would have liked. And also as sources of authority we would have to confine them only and exclusively to the areas of knowledge of their disciplines, when there are many more aspects that should be taken into account.

Moreover, by rereading the transcript of appearances, they even pointed to aspects that were positive and that you logically always omit. And I encourage you to read it again, because there are also positive aspects marked by them but not developed.

But, well, if we had to simplify and summarize the conclusion that you drew from those studies, it was that these experts were against the high-speed train. I suppose for the same reason that same afternoon both participants were invited and participated in the talk "Is the Basque Y the railway model that Euskal Herria needs?", organized by the opposition coordinator for the high-speed train Gelditu Elkarlana, in La Bolsa in Bilbao. Come on, you heard them twice on March 4th (continuous session, as in the cinema of children).

But you certainly wouldn't find it so interesting to attend, for example, the days that were also held in Bilbao shortly before, organized by the Chamber of Commerce, on "The high-speed train in Euskadi. New opportunities for tourism activity." But those conclusions, those do not draw them. Okay.

Or also in Bilbao the III International Days on New Technologies in the Railway Sector, organized with the Basque Government and the International Railway Union. I'm sure it wasn't all the conclusions of your taste either.

And what do you think of the analyses and studies by the European Commission, the Ministry of Development, Adif, concerning cost-benefit analyses or economic and social profitability? Or what do you think of the study "Demand and profitability of the project of new railway network of the Basque Country", included in the informative study of economic impact in the Basque Autonomous Community, carried out by the Institute of Public Economy of the University of the Basque Country? Are these ad hoc reports, made to the taste of the payer?

It is important that we see in this House today an unequivocal support, even if it is not unanimous, once again, to the high-speed train and the Basque Y. And it is very important because we are in the foreground of municipal and out-of-town elections, which could confuse the citizen. That is why the groups that have amended their whole initiative have reached an agreement that sends a clear message to the Basques.

The Basque Parliament supports the construction of the Basque Y, and the commitments will be fulfilled. And, as far as the People's Party is concerned, our commitment to the Basque Y does not admit discussion: 600 million euros on average in what we have been ruling as a legislature in Spain. General State Budgets and Official Gazette, that's what counts. Will, determination, seriousness, but above all the facts. And I refer to the facts.

Thank you.
text:
Egun on. Buenos días. Gracias, presidenta.

Señor Maeztu, nos pide usted en esta moción que instemos al Gobierno Vasco a paralizar mínimo seis meses las obras del tren de alta velocidad, y mientras tanto encargar a un grupo de investigación un análisis coste-beneficio, y cuando esté hecho el informe hacer un pleno monográfico para poder llegar a un acuerdo lo más amplio posible. Al parecer, el acuerdo que ya existe, y que se ha manifestado en infinidad de ocasiones, no le parece suficiente, o no lo tiene en consideración.

Le voy a leer unas expresiones, a ver cómo le suenan: "Rigurosos análisis coste-beneficio", versus "informes ad hoc sobre supuestas repercusiones económicas directas de una inversión pública de cantidades ingentes de dinero público, esos informes hechos al gusto del que paga". Esas palabras son suyas, señor Maeztu, realizadas en la interpelación que ha dado origen a esta moción. Con semejante ánimo, es complicado que usted se aproxime a ningún informe o ningún estudio de ningún experto con la actitud debida.

Me reconocerá que sus palabras suenan, como poco, prejuiciosas, que es lo mismo que decir que usted tiene una opinión y una opción previa y tenaz desfavorable al tren de alta velocidad, a cuyo conocimiento se aproxima solo en la medida en que este conocimiento retroalimenta su opción y su opinión.

A petición de la comisión, y a iniciativa de ustedes, comparecieron el mes pasado dos expertos concretamente para dar su opinión sobre la rentabilidad económica y social del tren de alta velocidad. Vaya, lo que usted está pidiendo ahora, acabamos de tenerlo. No sé si necesitaría mucho más. Fueron, como ya se ha recordado, los profesores Germà Bel, de la Universidad Autónoma de Barcelona, y David Hoyos, de la Universidad del País Vasco.

Es cierto que como conclusión general arrojaron dudas derivadas de sus investigaciones sobre la rentabilidad económica y social del tren de alta velocidad, pero, señor Maeztu, no fueron tan categóricos ni tan maniqueos como a usted le hubiera gustado. Y además como fuentes de autoridad tendríamos que circunscribirlos única y exclusivamente a las áreas de conocimiento de sus disciplinas, cuando son muchos más los aspectos que habría que tener en cuenta.

Es más, releyendo la transcripción de las comparecencias, incluso apuntaban a aspectos que eran positivos y que usted lógicamente siempre omite. Y le animo a que lo vuelva a leer, porque existen también aspectos positivos marcados por ellos pero que no desarrollaron.

Pero, bien, si tuviéramos que simplificar y resumir la conclusión que ustedes sacaron de esos estudios, es que estos expertos estaban en contra del tren de alta velocidad. Supongo que por esa misma razón esa misma tarde ambos comparecientes fueron invitados y participaron en la charla "¿Es la Y vasca el modelo ferroviario que Euskal Herria necesita?", organizada por la coordinadora de oposición al tren de alta velocidad Gelditu Elkarlana, en La Bolsa en Bilbao. Vamos, que usted les escuchó dos veces el 4 de marzo (sesión continua, como en el cine de pequeños).

Pero seguro que no le parecería tan interesante asistir, por ejemplo, a las jornadas que también se hicieron en Bilbao poco antes, organizadas por la Cámara de Comercio, sobre "El tren de alta velocidad en Euskadi. Nuevas oportunidades para la actividad turística". Pero esas conclusiones, esas no las saca. Vale.

O también en Bilbao las III Jornadas Internacionales sobre Nuevas Tecnologías en el Sector Ferroviario, organizadas con el Gobierno Vasco y la Unión Internacional de Ferrocarriles. Seguro que tampoco fueron todas las conclusiones de su gusto.

¿Y qué opina usted de los análisis y estudios de la Comisión Europea, del Ministerio de Fomento, de Adif, relativos a los análisis coste-beneficio o la rentabilidad económica y social? ¿O qué opina usted del estudio "Demanda y rentabilidad del proyecto de nueva red ferroviaria del País Vasco", incluido dentro del estudio informativo de impacto económico en la Comunidad Autónoma vasca, realizado por el Instituto de Economía Pública de la Universidad del País Vasco? ¿Son informes ad hoc , hechos al gusto del que paga?

Es importante que hoy se visualice en esta Cámara un respaldo inequívoco, aunque no sea unánime, una vez más, al tren de alta velocidad y a la Y vasca. Y es muy importante porque estamos en la antesala de unas elecciones municipales y forales, que podrían confundir al ciudadano. Por eso los grupos que hemos enmendado a la totalidad su iniciativa hemos alcanzado un acuerdo que mande un mensaje claro a los vascos.

El Parlamento Vasco apoya la construcción de la Y vasca, y se van a cumplir los compromisos. Y, en lo que al Partido Popular corresponde, nuestro compromiso con la Y vasca no admite discusión: 600 millones de euros de media en lo que llevamos de legislatura gobernando en España. Presupuestos Generales del Estado y Boletín Oficial, eso es lo que cuenta. Voluntad, determinación, seriedad, pero sobre todo los hechos. Y a los hechos me remito.

Gracias.

text_en:
It's late, but I can't resist doing the replica.

Mrs López de Ocariz, you've made a mistake on your own initiative. He hasn't read mine, because I don't speak at all on my own initiative or about smoking or anything. I am talking about four things: making a diagnosis among the agents, making a debate open to the future, which no one can deny, and with the conclusions of these two things making a planning. Because a planning that can be done in 1950 is very good, in 1990 and so many, but we are in 2019, almost in the 21st century.

We have to make a planning and implementation of the RDP...

Indeed, it is here that they are talking about years and we are talking about the year 1800. It's been a century. We're talking about the mountains. He has wrongly proposed; simply say it.

And get Gipuzkoa's deputies out. It makes me a terrible grace, because they use it as a wild card for anything:

"

That you did it wrong, gentlemen, ladies of , huh? They were in the congress and they did it very badly.

"

- No, no, no, Well, I will give you a fact, Mrs López de Ocariz: that report was made on January 28, 2015. A meeting was requested here, in Gasteiz, in the Government, on 3 February 2015, and I believe that in 2015 we stopped ruling. It's been four years. I think it's time for everyone to take on their responsibilities. It makes me laugh a little bit, because for four years we've been looking like a century. That sure looks like a century.

And the and the Basque Nationalist Party: we are here because we are concerned, Mr Prieto, but Mr Telleria, too. We're worried; otherwise, we wouldn't be here. And we're concerned to speak a little lightly, Mr. Telleria. The monoculture thing, excuse me, and I know you're sorry because it's all written down, but I didn't say it. You've justified yourself. I have only said massive cultivation of pines; here, the monoculture, let us each take our positions.

Another thing is what we want to plant. He said:

"

You have to plant 1,000 trees, it's okay, they don't make noise.

"

- No, no, no, Actually, they don't make noise, but they can burn. Let's go look at Galicia, let's go look at Cantabria last week, see if when we cross to Cantabria we don't see eucalyptus.

And this is not that someone has been free to plant what he wanted. Indeed, free decisions of the owners. Indeed, this is like saying to the primary sector "Yes, if you are free to sow whatever you want." No! No! They're not free because they're getting help. And if the aids are aimed at planting eucalyptus, they will plant more eucalyptus and we will meet Galicia, we will meet with abandoned pine trees, you said. Indeed, there are abandoned pine trees, there are mountains that are not being managed. That is why I mentioned earlier the differences between Araba, Bizkaia and Gipuzkoa. Indeed, because they are managed here by communities, local entities, not individuals. They are different, management and vision are absolutely different. And we can't say that we have abandoned pine trees, that we have unmanaged piles. No, because the non-management, the non-use, will bring us consequences, and there is nothing but looking towards the cantabrian cornice.

I'm finishing up. We're not just here because we're worried, we're here because we're willing to work. Mrs. López de Ocariz told me not to. I am willing to work, but to listen as well, and to propose and pose, but for that we need tables in common.

That the powers are in the Chambers? Indeed, they are Members of Parliament, but here, the Government, do not throw balloons out. It also has its competence, which is to advise. Otherwise, there wouldn't be a table where the four parties meet. Otherwise, the government would be saying, "Let every deputy, even in my color, do as he pleases." That can't be the case. I think it's good, right?

A forest policy – I don't care about the 19th century, the 20th century, the 21st century or the 21st century – suited to the times. And there are times when smoking can be bad, indeed. We can contaminate aquifers, we can also water the squirrels that walk through the pines. We can do all those things.

I'm sorry, we're not going to meet at that. We're willing to work, yes, but we're not giving white paper for anything.

Thank you.
text:
Es tarde, pero no me puedo resistir a hacer la réplica.

Señora López de Ocariz, se ha equivocado de iniciativa. No ha leído la mía, porque yo no hablo para nada en mi iniciativa ni de fumigar ni de nada. Hablo de cuatro cosas: de hacer un diagnóstico entre los agentes, de hacer un debate abierto al futuro, que a eso nadie se puede negar, y con las conclusiones de estas dos cosas hacer una planificación. Porque una planificación que se pueda hacer en 1950 está muy bien, en el 1990 y tantos también, pero estamos en el 2019, casi en el siglo XXII.

Hay que hacer una planificación y la puesta en marcha del PDR…

Efectivamente, es que aquí están hablando de años y estamos hablando del año 1800. Ha pasado un siglo. Estamos hablando de los montes. Se ha equivocado de propuesta; simplemente, decirlo.

Y saca a la Diputación de Gipuzkoa. Me hace una gracia terrible, porque es que la usan de comodín para cualquier cosa:

"

Que lo hicieron mal, señores, señoras de , ¿eh? Estuvieron en la diputación y lo hicieron muy mal

"

. Pues, le voy a dar un dato, señora López de Ocariz: aquel informe se hizo el 28 de enero de 2015. Se pidió una reunión aquí, en Gasteiz, en el Gobierno, el 3 de febrero del 2015, y creo que en el 2015 dejamos de gobernar. Han pasado cuatro años. Creo que ya es tiempo de que cada uno asuma sus responsabilidades. A mí me da un poco la risa, porque para cuatro años que estuvimos parece un siglo. Eso sí que parece un siglo.

Y al y al Partido Nacionalista Vasco: estamos aquí porque nos preocupa, señor Prieto, pero señor Tellería, también. Nos preocupa; si no, no estaríamos aquí. Y nos preocupa hablar un poco de forma ligera, señor Tellería. Lo de monocultivo, discúlpeme, y sé que le da pena porque se habrá traído todo escrito, pero no lo he dicho yo. Usted se ha justificado a sí mismo. Yo solo he dicho cultivo masivo de pinos; aquí, lo de monocultivo, que cada uno ya vayamos cogiendo nuestras posturas.

Otra cosa es lo que queramos plantar. Ha dicho:

"

Hay que plantar 1.000 árboles, que no pasa nada, no hacen ruido

"

. Efectivamente, no hacen ruido, pero se pueden quemar. Vayamos a mirar a Galicia, vayamos a mirar a Cantabria esta semana pasada, a ver si cuando cruzamos hacia Cantabria no vemos eucaliptos.

Y esto no es que alguien ha sido libre para plantar lo que le ha dado la gana. Efectivamente, libres decisiones de los propietarios. Efectivamente, esto es como decir al sector primario "Sí, si son ustedes libres de sembrar lo que quieran". ¡No! No son libres porque están recibiendo ayudas. Y si las ayudas se encaminan a que se planten eucaliptos, se plantarán más eucaliptos y nos encontraremos con Galicia, nos encontraremos con pinares –decía usted– abandonados. Efectivamente, hay pinares abandonados, hay montes que no se están gestionando. Por eso mencionaba antes las diferencias entre Araba, Bizkaia y Gipuzkoa. Efectivamente, porque aquí los gestionan las comunidades, las entidades locales, no los particulares. Son diferentes, la gestión y la visión son absolutamente diferentes. Y no podemos decir que tenemos pinos abandonados, que tenemos montes sin gestionar. No, porque la no gestión, el no aprovechamiento, nos van a traer consecuencias, y no hay más que mirar hacia la cornisa cantábrica.

Voy acabando. No solamente estamos aquí porque nos preocupa, sino que estamos aquí porque estamos dispuestos a trabajar. Me decía la señora López de Ocariz que no. Yo estoy dispuesta a trabajar, pero a escuchar también, y a proponer y a plantear, pero para eso necesitamos mesas en común.

¿Que las competencias son de las diputaciones? Efectivamente, son de las diputaciones, pero aquí, el Gobierno, que no eche balones fuera. También tiene su competencia, que es asesorar. Si no, no habría una mesa en la que se reúnen las cuatro partes. Si no, el Gobierno estaría diciendo "Que cada diputación, aunque sea de mi color, haga lo que quiera". Eso no puede ser así. Yo creo que ya vale, ¿no?

Una política forestal –me da igual del siglo XIX, del XX, del XXI que del XXII– adecuada a los tiempos. Y hay unos tiempos en los que fumigar puede ser malo, efectivamente. Podemos contaminar acuíferos, podemos regar también a las ardillas que andan por los pinos. Podemos hacer todas esas cosas.

Lo siento, nosotros en eso no nos vamos a encontrar. Estamos dispuestos a trabajar, sí, pero no vamos a dar carta blanca para cualquier cosa.

Eskerrik asko.

text_en:
Thank you, President. Lehendakari jauna, ladies and gentlemen, ladies and gentlemen, good morning.

After a few weeks of discussion with the Rules of Procedure and even knowingly, on the part of everyone, that what was being done was in line with what is provided for by the rules of this House, and a few more days of "that we all cost citizens alike", the day has come when we have to say what we want to do with the resources available to us in a situation of budgetary extension.

And the Socialist Group comes, to this plenary, with the vocation to give certainty and answers to 55,380 people who in 2018 were recipients of income guarantee income and who expect their government responsibility to meet their demands and direct and urgent needs.

We come to Parliament today with the intention that the greater economic resources of the citizenry, which has left in the hands of the government a number of resources through its taxes, will be returned to them in the form of greater income remuneration, because they will accelerate greater economic activity in Euskadi.

We want them to be returned in the form of a guarantee of the education system and also greater social investment. In short, what we intend to do is to promote a return close to 250 million euros to citizenship. And we believe that this economic and social return to citizenship must take place within the exclusive competence of the Government, which is to propose the economic measures that make these commitments possible, in a shared responsibility with those who have been elected and elected by the citizen to represent it, so that the decisions we take today will reflect on the improvement of the life of Basque citizenship.

And he said that we are coming to promote that return, because the Basque Government is going to have more economic resources, because, contrary to what some people have been trying to say outside and inside this House, the latest tax reform, which some have demonized since supposed leftist purity, has shown that it was effective and fair, because it has progressed in progressivity, progressed in paying more those who most enter and has had particular relevance to corporate tax.

And it is not understandable that, when more economic resources are available to the Basque Government, these, due to an extension, remain in the treasury box and are not returned to the citizenry in the form of direct improvements for their lives. It is not understandable to the Basque Socialists that, when the government's accounts can be influenced the most, they should be renounced.

The Socialists do not accept the condemnation, the resignation... of the government in which we participate, which some have also proposed and continue to propose, and today we will certainly also have an opportunity to hear it. That is what we said when the possibility of a budgetary agreement two months ago – in December – in the whole budgetary debate, and that nobody gets confused, that chapter negotiation did not, unfortunately, but there ended the negotiation, although some decisions not to negotiate had already been taken earlier.

For Elkarrekin Podemos, the negotiation ended more than two years ago, when the legislature began and decided to stay in a corner, where nothing could compromise them or leave them, neither in speech nor in title.

For the People's Party, the budget negotiation for 2019 had ended on June 1, because it wanted to take revenge with the Basque Nationalist Party and had not digested the investiture of President Pedro Sánchez by then.

And for , the negotiating adventure ended when he wanted to bring that negotiation back to a sort of alternative Basque pension system that we have, using the generation of false expectations among retired people.

The Basque Socialists have never wanted to stay in the comfort of the seat. And those of us who look from Euskadi at what is happening and what needs Euskadi, who do not want to deceive the pensioners, are working to ensure that tens of thousands of Basques are not harmed by the legitimate but questionable political decisions of others.

And this is the procedure followed for this bill and the two bills that we will see below. A procedure that has always been used. The one used by the governments of the lehendakaris Ibarretxe, Patxi López or Iñigo Urkullu before, the one used by the governments in which we were socialists or the Basque Nationalist Party or Eusko Alkartasuna or .

And already entering into the content of this bill, referring to the increase in income guarantee income and the repeal of the sixth additional provision, the socialists consider it a social chapter aimed at those who have less, those who need this most urgent support from the Basque public administration, those 55,380 people.

And in this matter there is no deception, the original draft budgets, which could not go forward, already covered these two issues, although in the case of income guarantee income it is true that with a more moderate increase, which has already explained to the Finance Advisor what is the reason for the increase that is now proposed. However, in the months following the preparation of the budget project and during its processing, we were seeing how the collection, thanks to the tax reform applied, which seems to some to have been forgotten, allowed for a greater commitment of solidarity. And so he moved to the only parliamentary group that lent itself to budgetary negotiation for 2019.

And he was also transferred to , at that time of negotiation, which is not the current one, which we were not going to do or will do is a parallel pension system, which was the proposal that actually made, with that idea of individualization that has nothing to do with the income guarantee income model that we currently have in force. And I say that we have in force, because, if the Basque Socialists had depended on it, this system of protection would have been reformed already from the proposal that we have registered with the Basque Nationalist Party.

If it had been for the Basque Socialists, we would have perfected that model with a clear distinction between those who have to resort to income-guarantee income but aspire, above all, to stop relying on it, and those who, by virtue of their pension status, have no expectation of improving their income if it is not through this supplement.

If it had been for the socialists, we would already have a model that would guarantee in each household with two pensioners an income of at least 978 euros, together with the housing supplement of 250 euros. Because that is what is foreseen in the amendment of the rule that and other parliamentary groups asked the Socialist Party and the Basque Nationalist Party to leave parked for the moment, and that is what we are talking with all parliamentary groups without exception, to see if we are able to channel this matter into a model that really serves the most vulnerable collective of Basque society. Knowing that we have our differences, but also knowing that, above all, what binds us to this great majority in the House is the conviction about the strength of our social protection system.

And that was our idea and we approached it without waiting for reform, in this bill that we are going to have the opportunity to vote on today. That is not all some groups would like, but I do believe that we should not neglect these economic increases for those who receive income-guarantee income, who are, as I say, the most vulnerable groups in our society.

More can be aspired, there is no doubt about it, and it is very legitimate, but the moment and the negotiating reasons have already been given and rejected, no agreement has been reached. And you can aspire to another social model, of course, and that aspiration is at a table of talks, apart from this issue that we were bringing here today to plenary.

We can aspire to conform to the way in which the proposal we are debating today is not approved.

It can also be made up of 3.5% and 4.5% for pensioners, if we come to approve this proposal, if there are reasons here and we portray each other.

From the Socialist Group, we hope that this opportunity for improvement will be given to the most vulnerable groups.

The People's Party has said publicly that it does not explain why the income guarantee income increase, which is greater than that of civil servants' salaries, that of the rise in the average income of workers and that it is a discrimination with which, it is underlined, they are contributing, and seems to us to be a rather incomprehensible argument to oppose this bill.

We find it incomprehensible in a party that considers itself to be of order and stability, despite the fiscal misconception that has just been organized in Álava by the hand of Orine Araba and Bildu, not knowing that the vast majority of income-guarantee recipients, those 55,000, more than 55,000 people, are women, are 57.8% of income-guarantee recipients in 2018.

They are people who are in a bad situation, precisely because of their economic and labour precariousness, because of their difficulties in accessing the labour market, because they cannot or cannot be allowed to contribute in conditions.

It seems incomprehensible that it should not be taken into account that among the 55,380 currently receiving persons, together with the 15,000 pensioners, there are also more than 10,000 people who are workers, who contribute, who actually contribute, but with salaries so small that they have to be supplemented by their income, thanks, among other things, to the labour reform, of which the People's Party knows something more.

And it is incomprehensible that the argument they use does not take into account that there are another 12,000 collectors over the age of 55, mostly unemployed for a long time, those to which the People's Party Government left without subsidy, which has had to be recovered by the Spanish Government of Pedro Sánchez, and that they would not have had another economic resource, if it were not for this income guarantee income. And it is incomprehensible that it is not taken into account that there are also 8,000 cases of supplemental benefits for single-parent families. And I would like to know why the People's Party does not take into account these special circumstances of vulnerability in income-guarantee income earners, when the economic circumstances of the Government allow for a greater effort, a solidarity effort to increase income-guarantee income by 3.5%.

The argument they have been using is, moreover, quite incomprehensible – even insulting, I would say – and it is not that we have thin skin, and less recently.

The Socialists' commitment is not to convert income-guarantee earners into a permanent subsidiary collective. Our aim is to continue to give them the opportunity to join the labour market and to do so in decent conditions. That is why the rise in the interprofessional minimum wage is important, that is why the plan to combat labour fraud, which has regularized thousands of contracts in Euskadi, is important, that is why the plan to combat the wage gap is important.

And we have already achieved in two years of parliamentary term, here in Euskadi, that opportunities are beginning to be found and we have managed to get 10,000 families to stop having that dependency on income guarantee income, and in the proposed income guarantee income reform we want to deepen our inclusion tools. But, in the meantime, as long as we achieve that goal, the Socialists remain committed to the fact that no one can be left to his own fate, that no one can be deprived of a minimum, decent and dignified income, and that, we are also convinced, that such income must be updated and increased to the extent that the Government has economic possibilities.

In the meantime, we also continue to take steps, from the Basque Government and the Government of Spain, to fulfil one of the commitments we adopted last March in this Parliament, without the support, by all means, of the People's Party, calling for economic recovery to reach the general public, prioritizing the most disadvantaged or worst-off groups in the years of the economic crisis.

Because it is not a matter of wasting public money or wasting public money, as some political group, some parliamentary group, such as the People's Party, seems to want to understand. What this is about, what we are discussing, is to have an active commitment to solidarity and social cohesion in the Basque Country, fighting economic vulnerability and social vulnerability.

That is the proposal that the Basque Socialists are going to support in this House today, that of investing in social cohesion, that of relief, that of providing relief to thousands of families, while designing a better model than the current one and with sufficient consensus. To that end, we call for the support of the rest of the parliamentary groups for this proposal.

Thank you very much.
text:
Gracias, presidenta. Lehendakari jauna, señores consejeras y consejeros, señorías, buenos días.

Tras unas semanas entretenidos con el Reglamento y aun a sabiendas, por parte de todos, que lo que se estaba haciendo era ajustado a lo que prevén las normas de esta Cámara, y otros cuantos días enredando con lo de "que todos por igual le costamos a la ciudadanía", ha llegado el día en el que tenemos que decir qué queremos hacer con los recursos de que disponemos en una situación de prórroga presupuestaria.

Y el Grupo Socialista viene, a este pleno, con vocación de dar certidumbre y respuestas a 55.380 personas que en 2018 fueron perceptoras de la renta de garantía de ingresos y que esperan de su Gobierno responsabilidad para atender sus demandas y necesidades directas y urgentes.

Venimos al Parlamento hoy con la intención de que los mayores recursos económicos de la ciudadanía, que ha dejado en manos del Gobierno una serie de recursos a través de sus impuestos, se les devuelvan en forma de mayores ingresos retributivos, porque van a acelerar una mayor actividad económica en Euskadi.

Pretendemos que se les devuelva en forma de garantía del sistema educativo y también de mayor inversión social. En definitiva, lo que pretendemos es promover un retorno cercano a los 250 millones de euros a la ciudadanía. Y creemos necesario que ese retorno económico y social a la ciudadanía se produzca en el ámbito que queda en la exclusiva competencia del Gobierno, que es la de proponer las medidas económicas que hagan posible esos compromisos, en una responsabilidad compartida con quienes hemos sido elegidas y elegidos por la ciudadanía para representarla, de modo y manera que las decisiones que tomemos hoy tengan reflejo en la mejora de la vida de la ciudadanía vasca.

Y decía que venimos a promover ese retorno, porque el Gobierno Vasco va a contar con más recursos económicos, porque, en contra de lo que algunos se empeñaron en decir fuera y dentro de esta Cámara, la última reforma fiscal, la que algunos demonizaron desde supuestas purezas izquierdistas, ha demostrado que era eficaz y que era justa, porque ha avanzado en progresividad, ha avanzado en que paguen más quienes más ingresen y ha tenido especial relevancia en el impuesto de sociedades.

Y no resulta comprensible que, cuando más recursos económicos tiene el Gobierno de Euskadi, estos, debido a una prórroga, queden en la caja de la tesorería y no se devuelvan a la ciudadanía en forma de mejoras directas para sus vidas. No es comprensible para los socialistas vascos que, cuando más se puede influir en las cuentas del Gobierno, se renuncie a hacerlas.

Los socialistas no aceptamos la condena, la resignación… del Gobierno en el que participamos, que algunos además lo propusieron y lo siguen proponiendo, y hoy también seguramente tendremos ocasión de oírlo. Así lo dijimos cuando se fue al traste la posibilidad de un acuerdo presupuestario hace dos meses –en el mes de diciembre–, en el debate presupuestario de totalidad, y que nadie se confunda, aquella negociación por capítulos no fructificó, lamentablemente, pero allí acabó la negociación, aunque algunas decisiones de no negociar ya se habían adoptado con anterioridad.

Para Elkarrekin Podemos, la negociación acabó hace más de dos años, cuando empezó la legislatura y decidió quedarse en un rincón, en donde nada pudiera comprometerlos ni marcharlos, ni en discurso ni en titular.

Para el Partido Popular, la negociación presupuestaria para 2019 había acabado el día 1 de junio, porque se quería tomar la revancha con el Partido Nacionalista Vasco y no había digerido para entonces la investidura del presidente Pedro Sánchez.

Y para , la aventura negociadora acabó cuando quiso reconducir esa negociación a una suerte de sistema de pensiones vasco alternativo al que tenemos, valiéndose para ello de la generación de expectativas falsas entre las personas jubiladas.

Los socialistas vascos no hemos querido nunca quedarnos en la comodidad del escaño. Y quienes miramos desde Euskadi lo que pasa y lo que necesita Euskadi, quienes no queremos engañar a los pensionistas, nos dedicamos a trabajar para que decenas de miles de vascos no se vieran perjudicados por las legítimas aunque cuestionables decisiones políticas de otros.

Y este es el procedimiento seguido para este proyecto de ley y los dos proyectos de ley que veremos a continuación. Un procedimiento que siempre se ha utilizado. El que han utilizado los gobiernos de los lehendakaris Ibarretxe, Patxi López o Iñigo Urkullu con anterioridad, el que han utilizado gobiernos en los que estábamos los socialistas o el Partido Nacionalista Vasco o Eusko Alkartasuna o .

Y entrando ya en el contenido de este proyecto de ley, referido al incremento de la renta de garantía de ingresos y a la derogación de la disposición adicional sexta, los socialistas consideramos que es un capítulo social orientado a quienes menos tienen, a quienes necesitan ese apoyo más urgente de la Administración pública vasca, a esas 55.380 personas.

Y en este asunto no hay engaño, el proyecto original de presupuestos, el que no pudo seguir adelante, ya contemplaba estas dos cuestiones, aunque en el caso de la renta de garantía de ingresos es cierto que con un incremento más moderado, que ya ha explicado el consejero de Hacienda a qué obedece el incremento que ahora se propone. Sin embargo, en los meses siguientes a la elaboración del proyecto presupuestario y durante su tramitación, fuimos constatando cómo la recaudación, gracias a la reforma fiscal aplicada, que a algunos parece que se les ha olvidado, permitía un mayor compromiso de solidaridad. Y así se trasladó al único grupo parlamentario que se prestó a la negociación presupuestaria para 2019.

Y también se le trasladó a , en ese momento de negociación, que no es el actual, que lo que no íbamos a hacer ni haremos es un sistema paralelo de pensiones, que fue la propuesta que en realidad realizó , con esa idea de individualización que no tiene que ver con el modelo de renta de garantía de ingresos que actualmente tenemos en vigor. Y digo que tenemos en vigor, porque, si de los socialistas vascos hubiera dependido, este sistema de protección se habría reformado ya a partir de la propuesta que tenemos registrada junto con el Partido Nacionalista Vasco.

Si por los Socialistas Vascos hubiese sido, habríamos perfeccionado ese modelo con una clara distinción entre quienes tienen que recurrir a la renta de garantía de ingresos pero aspiran, sobre todo, a dejar de depender de ella, y quienes, por su condición de pensionistas, no tienen expectativas de mejorar sus ingresos si no es a través de este complemento.

Si por los socialistas hubiese sido, tendríamos ya un modelo que garantizase en cada hogar con dos pensionistas unos ingresos de al menos 978 euros, junto con el complemento de vivienda de 250 euros. Porque eso es lo que está previsto en la modificación de la norma que y otros grupos parlamentarios pidieron al Partido Socialista y al Partido Nacionalista Vasco que dejáramos aparcada de momento, y es lo que estamos hablando con todos los grupos parlamentarios sin excepción, para ver si somos capaces de encauzar este asunto en un modelo que, de verdad, sirva para el colectivo más vulnerable de la sociedad vasca. Sabiendo que tenemos nuestras diferencias, pero sabiendo también que, sobre todo, lo que nos une a esta gran mayoría que hay en la Cámara es la convicción sobre la fortaleza de nuestro sistema de protección social.

Y esa era nuestra idea y a ella nos aproximamos sin esperar a la reforma, en este proyecto de ley que hoy vamos a tener ocasión de votar. No es todo lo que quisieran algunos grupos, pero sí creo que no debemos desdeñar esos incrementos económicos para quienes perciben la renta de garantía de ingresos, que son, como digo, los colectivos más vulnerables de nuestra sociedad.

Se puede aspirar a más, no hay duda de ello, y es muy legítimo, pero el momento y las razones negociadoras ya se dieron y se desestimaron, no se alcanzó un acuerdo. Y se puede aspirar a otro modelo social, cómo no, y esa aspiración está en una mesa de conversaciones, aparte de este asunto que hoy traíamos aquí al pleno.

Se puede aspirar a conformarse cómo no se aprueba la propuesta que estamos hoy debatiendo.

Se puede también conformar con el 3,5 % y el 4,5 % para los pensionistas, si llegamos a aprobar esta propuesta, si aquí se dan razones y nos retratamos cada cual.

Desde el Grupo Socialista, esperamos que se dé esta oportunidad de mejora para los colectivos más vulnerables.

El Partido Popular ha dicho públicamente que no se explica el porqué del incremento de la renta de garantía de ingresos, que es mayor que el de los salarios de los funcionarios, que el de la subida de los ingresos medios de los trabajadores y que es una discriminación con los que, se subraya, sí están cotizando, y nos parece un argumento bastante incomprensible para oponerse a este proyecto de ley.

Nos parece incomprensible en un partido que se considera a sí mismo como de orden y de estabilidad, a pesar del despropósito fiscal que acaba de organizar en Álava de la mano de Orain Araba y de Bildu, desconociendo que la gran mayoría de las personas perceptoras de la renta de garantía de ingresos, esas 55.000, más de 55.000 personas, son mujeres, son el 57,8 % de las perceptoras de la renta de garantía de ingresos en 2018.

Que son personas que están en una mala situación, precisamente por su precariedad económica y laboral, por sus dificultades de acceso al mercado laboral, porque no pueden o no les dejan cotizar en condiciones.

Parece incompresible que no se tenga en cuenta que entre esas 55.380 personas actualmente perceptoras, junto a los 15.000 pensionistas, hay también, además, más de 10.000 personas que son trabajadoras, que cotizan, que realmente cotizan, pero con sueldos tan ínfimos que tienen que ver complementado sus ingresos, gracias, entre otras cosas, a la reforma laboral, de la cual sí sabe algo más el Partido Popular.

Y resulta incomprensible que el argumento que utilizan no tenga en cuenta que hay otros 12.000 perceptores mayores de 55 años, en su mayoría parados de larga duración, esos a los que el Gobierno del Partido Popular dejó sin subsidio, que ha tenido que ser recuperado por el Gobierno de España de Pedro Sánchez, y que no habrían tenido otro recurso económico, si no fuera esta renta de garantía de ingresos. Y resulta incompresible que no se tenga en cuenta que también hay 8.000 casos de prestaciones de complementos para familias monoparentales. Y yo quisiera saber por qué no tiene en consideración el Partido Popular esas especiales circunstancias de vulnerabilidad en los y las perceptoras de la renta de garantía de ingresos, cuando las circunstancias económicas del Gobierno permiten un esfuerzo mayor, un esfuerzo solidario para incrementar un 3,5 % la renta de garantía de ingresos.

El argumento que han venido empleando resulta, además, bastante incomprensible –hasta insultante, diría yo–, y no es que tengamos la piel fina, y menos últimamente.

El empeño de los socialistas no es convertir a los perceptores de la renta de garantía de ingresos en un colectivo subsidiario permanente. Nuestro objetivo es seguir dándoles oportunidad para que se incorporen al mercado laboral y que lo hagan en condiciones dignas. Por eso es importante la subida del salario mínimo interprofesional, por eso es importante el plan de lucha contra el fraude laboral, que ha regularizado miles de contratos en Euskadi, por eso es importante el plan de lucha contra la brecha salarial.

Y ya hemos conseguido en dos años de legislatura, aquí en Euskadi, que empiecen a encontrarse oportunidades y hemos conseguido que 10.000 familias dejen de tener esa dependencia en la renta de garantía de ingresos, y en la reforma propuesta de la renta de garantía de ingresos queremos profundizar en nuestras herramientas de inclusión. Pero, mientras tanto, mientras logramos ese objetivo, los socialistas seguimos empeñados en que nadie puede quedar abandonado a su suerte, en que a nadie le puedan faltar unos ingresos mínimos, decentes y dignos, y en que, estamos convencidos, también, de que esos ingresos deben actualizarse e incrementarse en la medida de las posibilidades económicas que tenga el Gobierno.

Y, mientras tanto, también seguimos tomando medidas, desde el Gobierno Vasco y desde el Gobierno de España, para cumplir con uno de los compromisos que aprobamos en marzo del año pasado en este Parlamento, sin el apoyo, por cierto, del Partido Popular, instando a que la recuperación económica llegue a la ciudadanía en general, priorizando a los colectivos más desfavorecidos o que peor lo han pasado en los años de la crisis económica.

Porque no se trata de derrochar o de malgastar el dinero público, como parece querer dar a entender algún grupo político, algún grupo parlamentario, como el Partido Popular. De lo que se trata, de lo que estamos debatiendo, es de tener un compromiso activo con la solidaridad y la cohesión social en Euskadi, luchando contra la vulnerabilidad económica y contra la vulnerabilidad social.

Esa es la propuesta que hoy los socialistas vascos vamos a apoyar en esta Cámara, la de invertir en la cohesión social, la del alivio, la de procurar alivio a miles de familias, mientras diseñamos un modelo mejor que el actual y con el consenso suficiente. Y, para eso, pedimos el apoyo del resto de los grupos parlamentarios a esta propuesta.

Muchas gracias.

Thank you, ma'am, Mr. Damboreea.

I remember the dispute you mentioned here about the Book of Contribution; I was in that dispute, and I also remember your opinion. It's been years since the law has been established, 2007 years.

We're still doing our jobs together, and in the past years, in the process of the process, we've been working on it in the new season, we're working on it and we're working on it.

You say, in fact, there are differences in patterns, from your point of view. But you didn't mention that there are two columns according to the model. On the one hand, do we agree that what we have to do is to make our contribution deep, to support our public policies? That's a strategic decision. And so we have it put on: according to the rent, according to the crude internal exploitation. One.

Two: The opposite of the tax effort, shall we consider the time of borrowing? Yes or no? That's the strategic decision. Two. Do we agree or don't we?

We have a similar relationship with the state. How do we contribute to the state? We're tied to our rent. How do we make our contribution to maintain our general policies? Depends on the rent. And then, measuring the opposite of the tax effort. How old are they? 70% of the rent and the inverse tax effort 30%, so we have it.

But not only in the line of error which you have spoken: it is the standard we have, that we contribute according to the rent; for otherwise we should go to another example, and it is not right. This is not a pattern of the distribution of the revenues, which are made according to the income: so it works with the State, and so it works in us. That's what's important: there is another example, which may be permitted; but what we have in force is not the division of the collection, but the labour of taxes has its important paper. It is not what we have to divide by ourselves, but how we divide it? Depends on the rent. That's the big deal.

That's what you're talking about. Then the fund was established for some balances, but the essence is a long time ago. The fund was adjusted in the last change in the law. And besides that, you haven't mentioned another important thing, and it's very important that you're dealing with the collection. all the indirect taxes are divided, from the point of view of the collection, with coefficients. And indirect taxes are 50 percent of the fat or the general.

That was a big step ahead. There's an indirect taxation that's very basic and important, taxing our consumption, and it's the tax of the added value. This is in the heart of the law of 2007, which has assumed a step forward. The tax of the value added, Lord Damborene, is still in use since 1986. In 20 years, this indirect separation was unsuited. The 2007 law has made a significant progress. I think it's important to keep that in mind.

Third. What you're talking about. the descending of the vertical. If we turn down the vertical, we must all know that we touch the brain of joy and our model, the eucalypine model, the brain: We must be clear about that. You said the adjustment was done, it's true, the disappearance of a tax on economic activity, and a few ten came down. Yes, it was, but there's no other reading.

As you know, the tax on economic activity disappeared, and that was done to adapt it.

But where are the quintessence? That the indirect tax distribution is made horizontally, very important. Two, do we agree to do the contribution according to the rent? Is there another pattern? It's useful to us because it reflects on the financial situation of each country and the opposite of the tax effort is important. Why? Because you have to keep an effort on your mind.

If we didn't encourage that in an advanced economic policy (with the weight of a tax effort and the greatest possible collection of money for popular politics), we'd be involved in a remarkable lack.

That's what we're working on. With the old Alduds, too: there was a patriotic party on one side, the Popular Party on the other, and we're still working on it. And the work is done, and we continue to do the work, because it is our institutional model: the institutions are above the command or command of the one. And even among the institutions, we'll continue the same, and I'm telling you the same thing.

Then another peculiarity. This law is a very special law, by repeating this second word, that it is not only to unite itself among the four institutions, but that it must afterwards be protected by the Chamber. It may happen at some moments that the majority of the United States have not been reflected in the majority of this Chamber. That must also be in consideration, but that doesn't remove the work we have to do.

And another consideration, which is important: what we do by this law, as you have mentioned, is a division of our financial resources, after having fulfilled the duties of the state. And our responsibility in front of the state is to pay for our year's coupe. And to lighten that financial stage is important too. And more proper, because we ought to keep the collection of all resources with the first state, and thus says the Law of the Histric Lands, that it is the duty of the Common-wealth, and then we separate the financial resources here.

Then it is better to do so from the financial point of view. It is not a necessary condition, I know. But it's better to have more sense of financial facilities. How we have so many years of the Common-wealth, as yet unpaid, it has an effect, because we have not the ultimate payment of what we are to pay, which, when separated, binds us in what manner we ought to make this division within us; which also affects us.

So we have to wait until we get this right with the state? Unhappily? No. What do you mean, consistent? Yes, it's better that this financial stage should be cleared, because it has to make adaptations. It depends on the internal division, whether it be of a certain number of relations with him.
