Es un pequeño acto electoral que debió de tener mucho éxito, habida cuenta de que hemos obtenido mayoría absoluta en Lazkao en estas pasadas elecciones municipales, en el cual alguna silla está ocupada y además se ven las sillas del bar de atrás. Pero, bueno, si este es el nivel de un debate parlamentario, pues asumámoslo.

En cuanto a enmendar el error y a la votación, usted alude a una votación del año 2014, de una iniciativa de Izquierda Plural. Yo le he leído el párrafo literal del Diario de Sesiones del Congreso, de un debate mucho más reciente, del 22 de abril del 2015, a iniciativa de Amaiur. En ese sentido, a lo mejor la enmienda ya está hecha.

Después, con el tema de la consulta, primero estamos hablando de un tema que se está negociando. A lo que estamos apelando todos es a que las instancias concernidas de manera directa por esa negociación hagan un ejercicio de transparencia, que últimamente parece que se está dibujando, pero durante mucho tiempo ha sido la opacidad absoluta la que se ha planteado en esas negociaciones.

De hecho, en el primer punto de nuestra enmienda de transacción solicitamos a la Comisión Europea que asuma de una vez el principio de transparencia. Usted mismo ha dicho que no se da; tanto es así que los señores europarlamentarios tienen que meterse en un pequeño cuartito con un papel y un lápiz a tomar apuntes, bajo la atenta mirada de un funcionario de confianza, se supone del Consejo de Europa de turno o la Comisión Europea de turno. Y, entonces, ¿sobre qué base, sobre qué información pretende usted que se convoque una consulta? ¿Sobre los apuntes tomados a lápiz por determinados europarlamentarios?

A lo que nosotros instamos en la transacción que hemos firmado, y que supongo que se aprobará en buena lógica, al Gobierno de Madrid es a que informe al Gobierno Vasco, a que traslade la información de que disponga respecto a este tema, en cumplimiento del artículo 20.5 del Estatuto de Autonomía, ese que dice que "el Gobierno Vasco será informado en la elaboración de los tratados y convenios así como de los proyectos de legislación aduanera, en cuanto afecten a materias de específico interés para el País Vasco".

No cabe duda de que el contenido del TTIP afecta de manera directa a competencias del País Vasco. Y, por tanto, entendemos que, en cumplimiento de ese artículo 20.5, el Gobierno del señor Rajoy, o el que venga después, tendrían que informar de la manera debida al Gobierno Vasco. Hasta la fecha, desde luego, no lo han hecho. Lo que no sé es si por pecado de opacidad propio o porque a su vez sufre esa opacidad que usted afirma con tanta contundencia que existe y que hasta hace muy poco así era, existía.

text_en:
Thank you, Madam President. Good afternoon, everyone. And good afternoon to you too, Mr. Zupiria.

Even if it's paradox, I'll begin to talk about what I won't talk about, because I don't talk about some big newspapers, the biggest ones, and some radios, about the covida, the greatest part of the right five million dollars that your department gave me, not all of them. I won't talk about a few of those media, even from the Industrial Department, taking another big scholarship game. I won't talk about it, even if it's the same newspaper, or if it's the whole or the most important publicity institution. No, I'll leave it there, we could talk about it for a long time.

To-day I come to speak of other media. I'm here to discuss digital papers, magazines, radios, and, above all, eucalyptic media. And as an image is worth more than a thousand words, I come to you with a comparative image: It shows how the separation was made. It's not a graphic, but it's very graphic. On the one hand, here's what's been picked up by the biggest media: five million euros, all of them. Of these the eucalyptic media have only received 6,6%; that is the proportion. On the other hand, local media, telebists, radios, digital media and magazines have taken this.

I don't know if it looks good, do I? That's what they got. And that's where... zero. Zero. Five million, zero. That's the proportion. And that's the way they all stand. And, of course, empty boxes.

It's very difficult to understand that, Mr. Zupiria, there's a great deal of balance between them and each other. We tried to understand, though. And we thought that your department, if it were the Board of Education, and that it was covida, and that if you offered a scholarship to the students who are having trouble with it, then how Mr. Bilartz would do his division. Money, or scholarships, to whom would they be? For students who have the most income, or for those who have the smallest income?

But let's say that he's not only a quantum, but he's also trying to divide these scholarships according to the quantum. In the case of students, there may be a criterion of rewarding. On the media, on the other hand, in a system of communication like ours, what would be our reward? Wouldn't it be a criterion to make Euskuke? This example, then, is of no use to us in understanding what you have done. We still can't understand. Of course we've even played the procession, the key we understand better than we understand, because we think we'll find it there.

This decree of five million from the European provinces is derived from a decree made in 2019. The press of many European states is in a very difficult position, in a weak financial situation, and...

... It comes from a project made in 2019. The press of many European states is in a very difficult position, in a weak state of finance, and, owing to the covida, it is still weaker, because the sales are lowered, and the publicity has been much diminished in the daily press and radios. For all this, the euscal communication system is also in danger, like other media in Europe. So you say in your decree, and we agree with that. Even when you say that a democratic society requires strong and professional media to fight against uninformation. Absolutely.

Even if you say that we people need quality information in a reliable, professional and concrete way, especially this historic and especially important moment, this cursed pandemia. And I'm starting to think about where I got this pandemy, and I get that professional information that is so important to my daily life. And, of course, I get it from these great media, even from our public media. But I live in Durango, and I want to know, for instance, what influence covida is being produced in it, or Abadoulo, or Eldorixon, or again-the whole evening. And I want this information so important to me that I have a right to keep it.

But this is the only means of communicating with me that has guaranteed this right, that is, the whole pandemy has been offered by the Anboto communicative means; A reliable, professional media that gives me detailed information and also supports me. And not only that, as a means of communication with new seasons, I receive every moment the most important data and news that I want and want. Or else, I turn on the website and the paper's (... ), I wait till it is barren, till it is at home. Is not Anbothus and the rest of the eucalyptic media filling the philosophy of the decree? Aren't the closest trustworthy, the professionals themselves? And haven't these local media been in loss for publicity? Aren't they in danger too? Isn't that part of our communication system as well?

But you've decided to feed the big sharks on that starving system alone. But on a ecosystem, sharks are needed, yes, but even small fish: the anchovies, the sardines, and even the smaller. Otherwise, you lose that ecosystem. You haven't looked in the long run. You don't have long eyes. You didn't take care of the ecosystem, only (there's nothing else? ) You have watched for the widest, and teeth, which are the sharpest teeth. One of them, when you don't decide others, you've decided to hand it over to the press system, to the daily press and to the radio, and not to all of them. A lot of local media are weekly press, but they have a web page, or a network like every channel on the Telegram. But they're out of friendship. Their ability to modernize isn't that you didn't reward them.

So digital papers, not even published in a heavy paper structure, are left outside. An historic magazine like light, though digitally, every day, is outside because it's a magazine. On the other hand, the written daily press has been edified by the digital audience. The TV centers are outside, because they're not the press, the radio, even though they're part of the euscal communication system. I'm out of the radio, too, even though I'm just going to give Biscay, Aruba, and Gipuzia. Why, Mr. Zupiria? Why did he stay outside?

On the other hand, scholarships have been distributed according to each audience: Irision. The criterion may be all right, and some of the least results must be demanded, of course, but which measures these audiences? And how? Do we have a system of our own, a system that will measure all media in equality? Do we have that, Mr. Chief? Not really.

And for that purpose, in the polls made by a private company, and not in measurements, which are not the same. You should have based on polls in the polls made by the CIES company. Does this company measure small media and big media alike? Is that possible? He makes polls, paid by the members of the community, and according to their interests. Does that guarantee equality? Is it Transparent? We look at each other and we don't understand. Yes, or yes, Mr. Zupiria, or do we understand? But will you explain to us the real reason why the distribution of money is thus made? Or don't tell me if you don't, we know and we know why it was. Do you think this was the best division of the country?

But this is the question we want to ask you, and we asked you in interpelation. Do you intend to make a policy for strengthening our own media system?

Thank you.

Thank you, ma'am.

Mr. Zupiria, when I was speaking to you first, I saw that you never received any note. And I thought: "Or the deterioration is very great, or does not respond to all the questions I have asked him." And I think that's the second one. Well, maybe you'll remember what it was that asked, but you haven't noticed it in the answer he gave you.

You did mention all those challenges. And, yes, absolutely. I believe that the media are in that eucalyptic press, trying to keep that challenge. They're working on it. They're poor, yes, but they're smart. And very professional, committed. And above all, worthy. And to be dignified, you need protection. And you said, yes, they did. I don't know how much money. Ya, ya. But we're talking about the covida and some help to relieve the damage that has happened.

And you confirmed your judgment. You said, well, you should give it to those who have most audiences, first of all, quantum and quantum criteria. And I think that there is something to be protected by it, even in those special subsidies. And then, it's quantum, but it's paradoxical, because if they're most audiences, they might be in the best condition, don't they? logically. And I believe that those who are in the most vulnerable condition will need more help than those who have such good audiences. I don't know, from my logic, maybe it's not the right logic.

In my opinion, this decree, as I see, is a stage suit, a dress, some media, and in the meantime you've left others naked. You've stripped off the Basque media. It's just a secret how it's done, to the extent of some media. It's injust. It's very unfair, but we won't get involved in injustice. Let's look forward to it.

And, as a village, do you think, strategically, your criterion is appropriate, for instance, to share these helps? Like the village, is this gonna help us? If we want a Basque village, if we want a solid ecosystem, will that help? Is this how we keep the eupscal communication system? Like I said, the damage is done. Now the question is: How? What do we do to fix this? If it be the will, I believe there is an opportunity to defend the other media that are part of this system, and especially the eucalyptic media. And that's what we're asking you to do. Well, today is a question, but, well, the request will be correct. And I think even the eucalyptic media agree with this: If they want to survive, they need a solution. And there must be a balance on the main system, as I have said, some big fish, but there must be small for survival.

So I ask you again, or I ask you: Make the steps, the necessary steps, to build a strong eucaline communication system. Because I don't think so. You say we have a system. I don't think that's the system this town needs. So let us use the public money we have to build, strengthen, and above all to satisfy our wants and our rights.

Thank you.
text:
Gracias, señora presidenta. Buenas tardes a todas y todos. Y buenas tardes a usted también, señor Zupiria.

Paradoxa bada ere, hasiko naiz hitz egiten hitz egingo ez dudanari buruz, ez dudalako berba egingo egunkari handi batzuek, handienek, eta zenbait irratik, covida dela eta, zure Sailak emandako bost milioi euroko laguntza zuzenaren zatirik handiena, dena ez esatearren, hartzeari buruz. Ez dut berbarik egingo komunikabide horietako batzuk, Industria Sailetik ere, beste dirulaguntza partida handi bat ere hartu izanaren inguruan. Ez dut horri buruz hitz egingo, nahiz eta egunkari bertsuak izan, bestela ere publizitate instituzional guztia edo gehiena hartzen dutenak. Ez, hortxe utziko dut, luze egin ahal izango genuke berba eta horren inguruan.

Gaur, ostera, beste komunikabide batzuei buruz berba egitera nator. Egunkari digitalak, aldizkariak, irrati batzuk, eta, batez ere, euskarazko komunikabideei buruz hitz egitera nator. Eta, irudi batek mila hitzek baino gehiago balio duenez, irudi konparatibo batekin natorkizue: banaketa zelan egin den erakusten du. Ez da grafiko bat, baina oso grafikoa da. Batetik, hemen dago komunikabide handienek jaso dutena: bost milioi euro, denen artean. Horietatik, hori bai, euskarazko komunikabideek % 6,6 baino ez dute jaso; hori da proportzioa. Bestalde, tokiko komunikabideek, herri telebistek, zenbat irratik, komunikabide digitalek eta aldizkariek, ostera, hauxe hartu dute.

Ez dakit ondo ikusten den, ez? Horixe jaso dute. Eta hor eta… bai, zero. Zero da. Bost milioi, eta zero. Hori da proportzioa. Eta horrela geratu dira denak, zur eta lur. Eta jakina, kutxak hutsik.

Oso zaila da hori ulertzea, Zupiria jauna, desoreka handia dago batzuen eta besteen artean. Ahaleginak egin ditugu ulertzeko, hala ere. Eta pentsatu dugu zure Saila, ba Hezkuntza Saila balitz, eta covida dela eta txarto pasatzen ari diren ikasleei bekaren bat eskainiz gero, ba zelan egingo ote zuen Bildarratz jaunak banaketa. Diru, edo beka horiek, norentzat izango ziren? Diru-sarrera gehien duten ikasleentzat ala sarrera txikienak dituztenentzat?

Baina, demagun arlo kuantitatiboa ez ezik, ba kualitatiboaren arabera ere banatu nahi dituela beka horiek. Ikasleen kasuan, eszelentzia izan daiteke saritzeko irizpidea. Komunikabideetan, ostera, geurea bezalako komunikazio ekosistema batean, zer sarituko genuke? Euskaraz izatea ez litzateke aintzakotzat hartu beharreko irizpide bat izango? Beraz, adibide honek ez digu balio ere egin duzuen banaketa ulertzeko. Ulertu ezinik gaude oraindik ere. Dekretura ere jo dugu, jakina, ia hobeto ulertzen dugun giltza, ba hor aurkituko dugulakoan.

Bost milioiren dekretu hau, Europako eskualdeetako lantaldetik, 2019an egindako irizpen batetik dator. Bertan azaltzen denez, Europako estatu askotan tokiko prentsa oso posizio zailean dago, finantza egoera ahulean, eta…

… 2019an egindako irizpen batetik dator. Bertan azaltzen denez, Europako estatu askotan tokiko prentsa oso posizio zailean dago, finantza egoera ahulean, eta, covidaren eraginez, oraindik gehiago ahuldu da, salmentak jaitsi eta eguneroko prentsan eta irratietan publizitatea ere asko bajatu delako. Horren guzti horrengatik, euskal komunikazio ekosistema ere arriskuan dago, Europan beste komunikabide batzuek bezala. Hala diozue zuen dekretuan, eta gu ere bat gatoz horrekin. Baita ere, esaten duzuenean gizarte demokratiko batek komunikabide sendo eta profesionalak behar dituela, desinformazioaren aurka borrokatzeko. Erabat ados.

Badiozue ere, herritarrok kalitatezko informazioa behar dugula, modu fidagarri, profesional eta egiaztatuan, batez ere une historiko eta bereziki garrantzitsu honetan, pandemia madarikatu honetan. Eta, pentsatzen hasi naiz, pandemia honetan nondik jaso dudan, eta jasotzen dudan nik, nire eguneroko bizitzarako hain garrantzitsua den gertuko informazio profesional hori. Eta, jakina, komunikabide handi horietatik jasotzen dut, baita gure komunikabide publikoetatik ere. Baina ni Durangon bizi naiz, eta jakin gura dut, esate baterako, covida ze eragin izaten ari den bertan edo Abadiño, edo Elorrixon, edo Berrizen; Durangalde osoan. Eta, neuretzat hain inportantea den informazio hori, euskaraz jaso nahi dut, euskaraz jasotzeko eskubidea ere badudalako.

Baina hori, eskubide hori bermatu didan komunikabide bakarra, pandemia osoan hori eskaini den bakarra Anboto Komunikabideak izan da: gertuko komunikabide fidagarria, profesionala, informazio egiaztatua ematen didana, eta gainera, euskaraz. Eta ez hori bakarrik, sasoi berrietara egokitzen jakin duen komunikabidea denez, Telegrameko bere kanaletik, une oro, nik nahi eta behar ditudan datu eta albisterik garrantzitsuena jasotzen ditut neure mugikorrean. Edo bestela, web orrira jotzen dut, eta paperaren (…), ba barikura arte itxaroten dut, etxean jaso arte. Ez al dute Anbotok eta bera bezalako beste euskarazko komunikabideek dekretuaren filosofia betetzen? Ez al dira gertukoak fidagarriak, profesionalak, eurak ere? Eta ez al dute tokiko komunikabide horiek publizitatearen galerarik izan pandemia dela eta? Ez al daude arriskuan eurak ere? Ez dira, bada, gure komunikazio ekosistemaren parte eurak ere?

Baina, zuok erabaki duzue gosez dagoen ekosistema horretako marrazo handiei, horiei bakarrik, jaten ematea. Baina, ekosistema batean, marrazoak behar dira, bai, baina baita arrain txikiak ere: antxoak, sardinak eta txikiagoak ere bai. Bestela, galdu egiten da ekosistema hori. Zuok ez duzue epe luzera begiratu. Ez duzue begirada luzerik. Ez duzue ekosistema zaindu, bakarrik (agorik?) zabalena, eta hortzik, haginik zorrotzenak dituztenak zaindu dituzue. Batzuei bai, beste batzuei ez erabakitzerakoan, euskal komunikabideen ekosistema osotik, eguneroko prentsa idatziari eta irratiei ematea bakarrik erabaki duzue, eta, horietatik ere, ez denei. Tokiko komunikabide asko astekariak dira, baina web orria dituzte, edo Telegrameko kanal bezalako une oroko sareak. Baina laguntzetatik kanpo geratu dira, daukaten modernizatzeko gaitasuna ez da, ez duzue saritu.

Hortaz, egunkari digitalak, paperezko egitura pisutsu batean argitaratzen ez dutenez ere, kanpoan geratu dira. Argia bezalako aldizkari historiko bat, nahiz eta digitalean, egunero-egunero, egon, kanpoan geratu da, aldizkari bat delako. Eguneroko prentsa idatziari, ostera, kontabilizatu egin diozue digitaleko audientzia. Herri telebistak ere kanpoan geratu dira, ez direlako ez prentsa idatzia, ez irratia, nahiz eta euskal komunikazio ekosistemaren parte garrantzitsua izan. Naiz irrati ere kanpoan geratu da, nahiz eta euskara hutsean emititu Bizkaia, Araba eta Gipuzkoan. Zergatik, Zupiria jauna? Zergatik geratu da kanpoan?

Bestetik, dirulaguntzak bakoitzaren audientziaren arabera banatu dira: irismena. Balekoa izan liteke irizpidea, eta gutxieneko emaitza batzuk exijitu egin behar dira, jakina, baina zeinek neurtzen ditu audientzia horiek? Eta zelan? Badugu guk gure sistema propiorik, komunikabide guztiak aukera berdintasunean neurtuko dituen sistemarik? Badaukagu halakorik, sailburu jauna? Ba ez.

Eta, horretarako, enpresa pribatu batek eginiko inkestetan, eta ez neurketetan, ez baitira gauza bera. Inkestetan oinarritu behar izan duzue, CIES enpresak eginiko inkestetan. Enpresa horrek berdin neurtzen ditu komunikabide txikiak eta handiak? Posible da hori? Inkestak egiten ditu CIESek, bazkide diren enpresek ordainduta eta bakoitzaren interesen arabera. Berdintasuna bermatzen du horrek? Gardena da? Batetik eta bestetik begiratu, eta ulertu ezinik jarraitzen dugu. Edo bai, edo bai, Zupiria jauna, edo bai ulertzen dugu? Baina, hala ere, azalduko diguzu zein den dirulaguntzen banaketa horrela egiteko benetako arrazoia? Edo ez esan nahi ez baduzu, badakigu eta gutxi gorabehera zergatik izan den. Herri bezala banaketarik onena izan dela uste duzu?

Baina, hala ere, hauxe da egin nahi dizugun galdera, eta egin genizuena interpelazioan. Asmorik al duzu gure komunikabide sistema propioa sendotzeko politikarik egiteko?

Eskerrik asko.

Eskerrik asko, mahaiburu andrea.

Zupiria jauna, eske zuri, lehen, berba egiten egon naizenean, ikusi dut ez duzuela inongo notarik jasotzen izan. Eta pentsatu dut: "Edo retentiba oso handia dauka edo ez doa erantzuten nik egin dizkiodan galdera guztiei". Eta nik uste dut bigarren hori izan dela. Bueno, igual, gogoratuko duzu zer galdetu den, baina ez da igarri gero emaniko erantzunean.

Esan duzu, bai, aipatu dituzu erronka guzti horiek. Eta bai, guztiz ados. Nik uste dut euskarazko komunikabideak horretan daudela; erronka horri eutsi guran. Horretan ari dira lanean. Pobreak dira, bai, baina inteligenteak dira. Eta oso profesionalak, konprometituak. Eta, batez ere, duinak. Eta, duina izateko, babesa behar da. Eta esan duzu, bai, eman zaiela ez dakit zenbat diru. Ya, ya. Baina hitz egiten ari gara covida dela eta, jasandako kalteak arintzeko laguntza batzuei buruz.

Eta berretsi egin duzu zure irizpidea. Esan duzu, bueno, audientzia gehien daukatenei eman behar zaien, lehenengo eta behin, irizpide kuantitatiboa eta kualitatiboa. Eta nik uste dut euskaraz izatea badela zerbait babestu behar dena, dirulaguntza berezi horietan ere bai. Eta gero, kuantitatiboa da, baina paradoxikoa da, ze audientziari gehiena dutenak badira, beharbada, egoerarik onenean daudenak izango dira, ezta?, logikoki. Eta uste dut, egoerari zaurgarrienean daudenak, horiek beharko dutela laguntza gehiago, hain audientzia onak dituztenak baino. Ez dakit, nire logikatik; beharbada ez da izango logika zuzena.

Neure iritziz, eta ikusten dudanez, dekretu hau da neurrira egindako traje bat, soineko bat, komunikabide batzuentzat, eta, bien bitartean, larrutsik utzi dituzue beste batzuk. Euskarazko komunikabideak larrutsik utzi dituzue. Dekretua irakurri besterik ez dago, ba zelan dagoen eginda, batzuen komunikabide batzuen neurrira. Injustua da. Oso injustua da, baina ez gara katramilatuko injustizian. Goazen aurrera begira.

Eta, herri bezala, uste duzu, estrategikoki, egokia dela zuen irizpidea, esate baterako, laguntza hauek banatzerako orduan? Herri bezala honek lagunduko digu? Herri euskalduna nahi badugu, ekosistema sendo batekin nahi badugu, horrek lagunduko du? Horrela mantenduko dugu euskal komunikazio sistema? Esan bezala, kaltea eginda dago. Orain, galdera da: zelan? Zer egingo dugu hau konpontzeko? Borondatea izanez gero, uste dut badagoela aukera ekosistema honen parte diren beste komunikabideak, eta batez ere euskarazko komunikabideak, babesteko. Eta horixe eskatzen dizugu. Bueno, gaurkoa galdera da, baina bueno, etorriko da gero eskaera zuzena. Eta nik uste dut euskarazko komunikabideak ere bat datozela honekin: biziraun nahi badute konponbide bat behar dute. Eta oreka bat egon behar da ekosisteman, esan bezala, bai, arrain handiak behar dira, baina txikiak ere egon behar dute bizirauteko.

Beraz, berriro galdetzen dizut edo eskatzen dizut: egin itzazu urratsak, beharrezko urratsak, euskarazko euskal komunikazio sistema sendo bat eraikitzeko. Ze, ez dut uste. Esaten duzu sistema bat daukagula. Nik uste dut sistema hori ez da benetan herri honek behar duen ekosistema. Beraz, daukagun diru publiko hori erabili dezagun sistema hori eraikitzeko, sendotzeko, eta denok ditugun beharrak eta daukagun eskubidea asetzeko batez ere.

Eskerrik asko.

text_en:
Good morning, everyone. Good morning, Chief of Parliament.

Lehendakari jauna, a few days ago his group made it possible, with his vote, to pass the Celaá Law Congress. A law passed by a single member of the margin, which says a lot about the lack of will for agreement and consensus. A law that corneres the concerted centers and laminates the ones of special education, not to mention the contempt of the talent and the marginalization of the Castilian as a vehicle language. A cluster of misconceptions that the PNV has made its own.

In the concerted centres, you know, you study half the Basque student, nothing more and nothing less than half, so your government hastened to say that this law will have a zero impact on Basque; come on, they will look for ways to breach it.

It sounds like a joke of bad taste that the Basque Government presumes to avoid the harm to students and families of a law that the PNV has supported in the Congress of Deputies.

And that's the problem, Mr. President, that this law risks the education of euscal and half of families has been accepted by EAJ's votes. You could have defended freedom and pluralism, but unfortunately you voted for that law and that was a mistake for education.

Therefore, lehendakari jauna, I ask you: how is the basic legislation not being complied with? What will happen if they change their minds within three months or if their socialist partners demand strict application of the law? What will your reassuring words of these days then be worth? What will happen in September with differentiated education centres and their thousands of students in Euskadi? We all know why they say they won't apply the law from the Basque government: because they don't like it. Then the best thing is that there was no law. You have the opportunity to vote against in the Senate and again in the final vote in Congress. And we, from the Basque People-Citizens Group, will also give them an opportunity to ask from this House, with the non-law proposal that we have registered. The question is how do you assess the impact of the Celaá law on Euskadi, lehendakari jauna?

Mr. President, you and I both know this law is no better than the other.

This law is an attack. It is an attack on freedom of choice, it is an attack on concerted education, it is an attack on the Spanish language, but it is also aberrant against special education.

I believe, moreover, that you have made a bet: to pass this law in Madrid and, instead, not to comply with it here. They do not want to fulfill it, because they say clearly that concerted education is going to defend itself and that you are in another line. You approve for Valencia or Lugo or Guadalajara what you hope to fail here in the Basque Country. They say yes in Madrid with the Sánchez-Iglesias government and Bildu, and they put good guys here, in front of the same as Bildu, Socialists and Podemos, regarding this law.

I want to tell you that in the background you, Mr Lehendakari, do not like the Celaá law, as you do not like Sánchez's vaccination plan – you said it yourself –, as you did not like Sánchez's anti-vid plan in the first wave, and your vice-president Lehendakari struck you, Mrs Mendia, when he called you disloyal, Mr Lehendakari – yes, yes, ask Mrs Gorrotxategi and Mrs Iriarte – at that meeting in Lehendakariitza. You guys do like Golden Pine, in the Price circus, triple mortal jump, Mr. lehendakari. There they vote some things, here they come to say something else about the Education Law, the Celaá Law and, of course, Mrs Pinito had no network. You have a network and you have the network of Sanchez and Churches, which are your partners. And that is the problem of you, of the Basque Nationalist Party on this earth, Mr Lehendakari.

Thank you very much.
text:
Egun on guztioi. Egun on, legebiltzarburu andrea.

Lehendakari jauna, hace pocos días su grupo hacía posible, con su voto, la aprobación en el Congreso de la ley Celaá. Una ley aprobada por un único diputado de margen, lo que dice mucho de la nula voluntad de acuerdo y consenso. Una ley que arrincona a los centros concertados y lamina los de educación especial, por no hablar del desprecio al talento y la marginación del castellano como lengua vehicular. Un cúmulo de despropósitos que el PNV ha hecho suyos.

En los centros concertados, usted lo sabe, estudia la mitad del alumnado vasco, nada más y nada menos que la mitad, por eso se apresuró su Gobierno a decir que esa ley tendrá un impacto nulo en Euskadi; vamos, que buscarán cómo incumplirla.

Suena a broma de mal gusto que el Gobierno Vasco presuma de evitar los perjuicios para alumnos y familias de una ley que el PNV ha apoyado en el Congreso de los Diputados.

Eta hori da arazoa, lehendakari jauna, euskal ikasleen eta familien erdiaren hezkuntza arriskuan jartzen duen lege hori EAJren botoekin onartu dela. Askatasun eta pluraltasuna defendatu ahal zenuten, baina, zoritxarrez, zuek lege horren alde bozkatu zenuten eta hori huts galanta izan da hezkuntzarentzat.

Por eso, lehendakari jauna, yo le pregunto: ¿cómo se incumple la legislación básica? ¿Qué pasará si dentro de tres meses cambian de opinión o si sus socios socialistas piden una aplicación estricta de la ley? ¿De qué valdrán, entonces, sus palabras tranquilizadoras de estos días? ¿Qué pasará en septiembre con los centros de educación diferenciada y sus miles de alumnos en Euskadi? Todos sabemos por qué dicen que no aplicarán la ley desde el Gobierno Vasco: porque no les gusta. Entonces, lo mejor es que no hubiera ley. Tienen ustedes ocasión de votar en contra en el Senado y, de nuevo, en la votación definitiva en el Congreso. Y nosotros, desde el grupo Vasco Popular-Ciudadanos, vamos a darles también ocasión de pedirlo desde esta Cámara, con la proposición no de ley que hemos registrado. La pregunta es ¿cómo valora el impacto de la ley Celaá en Euskadi, lehendakari jauna?

Lehendakari jauna, zuk eta biok badakigu lege hau ez dela bestea baino hobea.

Esta ley es un ataque. Es un ataque a la libertad de elección, es un ataque a la educación concertada, es un ataque a la lengua española, pero, además, es aberrante contra la educación especial.

Yo creo, además, que ustedes han hecho una apuesta: aprobar esta ley en Madrid y, en cambio, no cumplirla aquí. No quieren cumplirla, porque dicen claramente que la educación concertada se va a defender y que ustedes están en otra línea. Ustedes aprueban para Valencia o Lugo o para Guadalajara lo que esperan incumplir aquí en el País Vasco. Dicen sí en Madrid con el Gobierno Sánchez-Iglesias y con Bildu, y ponen cara de chicos buenos aquí, frente a los mismos de Bildu, Socialistas y Podemos, respecto a esta ley.

Yo le quiero decir que en el fondo a ustedes, señor lehendakari, no les gusta la ley Celaá, como no les gusta el plan de vacunación de Sánchez –usted mismo lo ha dicho–, como no le gustó el plan anticovid de Sánchez en la primera ola, y su vicelehendakari se lo afeó, la señora Mendia, cuando le llamó desleal a usted, señor lehendakari –sí, sí, pregúnteselo a la señora Gorrotxategi y a la señora Iriarte–, en aquella reunión en Lehendakaritza. Ustedes hacen como Pinito del Oro, en el circo Price, triple salto mortal, señor lehendakari. Allí votan unas cosas, aquí vienen a decir otra cosa de la Ley de Educación, de la ley Celaá y, claro, la señora Pinito no tenía red. Usted tiene una red y tiene la red de Sánchez y de Iglesias, que son sus socios. Y ese es el problema de ustedes, del Partido Nacionalista Vasco en esta tierra, señor lehendakari.

Muchas gracias.

text_en:
Thank you, Mr. President. Good morning, chiefs and congressmen.

Mr Gordillo, honestly, I do not understand what you mean by this motion a few days before you have called the Salburu Garamendi into this House about the transfer of prisons. At that time, his request was fulfilled and perfectly answered, and on that line he will follow and must follow my intervention, because the whole process of transfer of competence in the field of prison services was profusely explained by the Sailburu.

I must start with something indisputable: the clear political commitment of this Government and of this group to fully comply with the Statute of Gernika and achieve self-government in all matters pending transfer. Something you cannot say, because you have given us ample evidence of your refusal to comply with an organic law such as the Statute of Gernika.

As I bring this matter back to the House, I will remind you that in October your colleagues in the People's Party in Congress called for the non-transfer of prison competition to Euskadi. They defended the violation of the law, denying the Statute and denying Euskadi to assume the remaining powers. And there he'll always have us in front of him.

By the way, they called for the non-transfer of a competition that was included in the so-called Zubia Report that the approved in this Basque Parliament in 1993.

We are very clear, we always say the same thing, when there is no election in Madrid and Madrid, and we are not tired of demanding what is legally claimed, and we are not weary of working for all the rights that the State reveals to us.

Currently, up to 32 subjects are pending transfer. Fortunately, we have a timetable and the commitment of two governments to move forward in its implementation. And within the first package of competencies is where the management of prisons is located.

A negotiating process is currently under way, a bilateral negotiation in which efforts are being made to achieve the objective of an agreement on the services and functions to be assumed by our prison administration.

The legal framework in which we work is clear: the reference always the Statute of Gernika, where it is provided for the establishment of a Joint Transfer Commission to work out the consensus that will lead us to exercise our powers in the best way and under the best conditions. For this entire transfer process, we have a comprehensive regulatory framework that supports the change of ownership of this and other competencies and that should guide the text of the agreement. Agreement in which, as I have already told you, technical meetings and working groups are being held between two administrations, that of the State and our Administration, within the said Joint Commission on Transfers. And in which you will contemplate what you know perfectly well: the transfer of the functions of management, organization and administrative and economic management of the prisons located in our autonomous community, and will also take up issues such as obligations and contracts related to the subject matter, the inventory of goods or the personnel assigned to the service.

We do not speak, as you intentionally do, to entangle and confuse prison policy. We are talking about management, a close management that will make it possible to improve the functioning of prisons and the resocialization of prisoners.

An agreement which we urge, in the conviction that it was something already assumed, the Government to be referred to this House.

Our government is firmly leading the pursuit of full self-government, as well as the defence of the already achieved, because this means achieving and guaranteeing greater well-being for Basque citizens. And, as good managers, we will bring this purpose to fruition with the materialization of the outstanding transfers. Among them, the one that today brings us the management of prisons with complete legal certainty and with the best technical conditions. That's what's relevant. We are faced with a complex subject, with many edges, and the important thing is to keep working, not to rest. And be assured that this Government and its advisors and advisers will not stop until they achieve all the competences that by law belong to us, even if for you I am a dark and shady executive.

They speak, and in particular you, in your last speeches, of an exhausted government, of opaque management and of improvisation. Obviously, that is not the reality that we live in this country, if not its desires.

We have a government with solid principles and clear commitments to its citizens, among other things, in self-government, and to assume all the competences that have so far been in the hands of the Spanish State and that must be managed, in the broadest sense, by our institutions. We have a government with sufficient momentum and strength to carry out both the task of transferring outstanding issues and the effective and efficient management of those issues. Close management in all areas that undoubtedly benefit citizens. And we have a government that does, and it also has a large majority in this House, but that, however, from it, is always committed and we are committed to achieving broad consensus.

And on the question of the transfer of powers in the management and operation of the prisons located in Euskadi, you want and intend to launch an invitation to the flotation line of the negotiations being carried out, to the work carried out in the Joint Transfer Commission. He was interested, first, in attacking the negotiating process within the Commission and questioning the work carried out at the technical meetings that were being held, with a planned timetable and at a time of fluid relations between the two parties, the Basque Government and the Spanish Government, in order to conclude with those meetings and to define technically each and every detail of the transfer.

And in their position, they have a clear purpose: to prevent any agreement being reached between the two governments regarding the exercise of the competences which belong to them. Because his policy, that of his party, follows the line opposed to that of self-government. It has no interest in the fulfilment of what was agreed and adopted more than 40 years ago in the Statute of Gernika.

I suppose it will then be your turn, or that of your group, to try or question the model that is adopted to execute such competition. The Council for Equality, Justice and Social Policy will have the competence to develop the new public policy on the organisation, regime and functioning of prison services. And the motions for resolutions that emerged, and were adopted in the monographic plenary on 13 March 2019, will be the basis for defining the prison model to be implemented in Euskadi.

And, indeed, before this Parliament, it will also be transparent and clear in the measures and planning to carry out this model. Today, the commitments we have signed are solid and do not weaken, there is a willingness to negotiate and there is a willingness to agree. And, above all, Mr Gordillo, have no doubt, so far other transfers have materialized. In the past legislature, transfers were made in several areas: roads, railway lines..., which are currently being managed impeccably by our Basque administration. And now arduous but effective work is being done to complete other transfers, such as the management of prison facilities. And when such an agreement is reached, its management, operation, the organization of goods, services, contracts, obligations in relation to prisons, it will be organized with a model of public policy that, in addition to based on the proposals resulting from the full monograph of the last legislature, will follow the key axes marked by our government: people, coexistence, self-government and human rights. And all this, Mr Gordillo, with transparency and clarity.

Excuse me. At the end of the round of speeches, this round of speeches, I would like to ask for a recess so that I can finish signing and subscribing, and, well, some of the remaining fringes, to the compromise amendment to which Mrs Gorrotxategi has referred.

Thank you.
text:
Mila esker, legebiltzarburu andrea. Egun on, sailburuak eta legebiltzarkideok.

Señor Gordillo, sinceramente, no entiendo qué pretende con la interposición de esta moción a escasos días de haber interpelado en esta misma Cámara a la sailburu Garamendi en torno al traspaso de prisiones. En aquel momento se dio cumplida y perfecta respuesta a su solicitud, y en esa línea va a seguir y debe seguir mi intervención, porque todo el proceso de traspaso de la competencia en materia de servicios penitenciarios fue profusamente explicado por la sailburu.

He de comenzar por algo indiscutible: el compromiso político claro de este Gobierno y de este grupo de dar cumplimiento íntegro al Estatuto de Gernika y alcanzar el autogobierno en todas aquellas materias pendientes de transferir. Algo que no pueden decir ustedes, porque nos han dado sobradas muestras de su negativa al cumplimiento de una ley orgánica como es el Estatuto de Gernika.

Ya que vuelve a traer este asunto a la Cámara, le recordaré que en octubre sus compañeros del Partido Popular en el Congreso pidieron la no transferencia a Euskadi de la competencia de prisiones. Defendieron el incumplimiento de la ley, negando el Estatuto y negando a Euskadi que asuma las competencias pendientes. Y ahí nos va a tener siempre enfrente.

Por cierto, reclamaron la no transferencia de una competencia que estaba incluida en el denominado Informe Zubia que el aprobó en este Parlamento Vasco en 1993.

Gu oso argiak gara, gauza bera esaten dugu beti, hemen eta Madrilen, hauteskundeetan eta hauteskunderik ez dagoenean; ez gara nekatuko legez dagokiguna erreklamatzeaz eta ez gara nekatuko Estatutuak aitortzen dizkigun eskumen guztiak izatearen alde lan egiteaz.

Actualmente, hasta 32 materias tenemos pendientes de traspaso. Afortunadamente, contamos con un cronograma y con el compromiso de dos gobiernos de avanzar en su ejecución. Y dentro del primer paquete de competencias es donde se encuentra la gestión de los centros penitenciarios.

En este momento se está incurso en un proceso negociador, en una negociación bilateral en la que se trabaja para alcanzar el objetivo de un acuerdo sobre los servicios y funciones que asumirá nuestra Administración en materia penitenciaria.

El marco legal en el que se trabaja es claro: el referente siempre el Estatuto de Gernika, donde se prevé la constitución de una Comisión Mixta de Transferencias para ir labrando los consensos que nos lleven a ejercer nuestras competencias de la mejor manera y en las mejores condiciones. Para todo este proceso de traspasos disponemos de un amplio marco normativo que avala el cambio de titularidad de esta y otras competencias y que debe guiar el texto del acuerdo. Acuerdo en el que, como ya le he dicho, se está trabajando en reuniones técnicas y grupos de trabajo que están teniendo lugar entre dos administraciones, la del Estado y nuestra Administración, en el seno de la mencionada Comisión Mixta de Transferencias. Y en el que se contemplará lo que usted perfectamente conoce: el traspaso de las funciones de dirección, organización y gestión tanto administrativa como económica de los centros penitenciarios ubicados en nuestra comunidad autónoma, y también recogerá cuestiones como las obligaciones y contratos vinculados a la materia, al inventario de bienes o el personal adscrito al servicio.

No hablamos, como intencionadamente lo hacen ustedes, para enredar y confundir, de la política penitenciaria. Hablamos de gestión, de una gestión cercana que permita mejorar el funcionamiento de las prisiones y la resocialización de las personas presas.

Un acuerdo que instamos, en el convencimiento de que era algo ya asumido, al Gobierno a que sea remitido a esta Cámara.

Nuestro gobierno lidera con pulso firme la consecución de un autogobierno completo, así como la defensa del ya alcanzado, porque ello supone lograr y garantizar un mayor bienestar para la ciudadanía vasca. Y, como buenos gestores, llevaremos a buen puerto tal propósito con la materialización de las transferencias pendientes. Entre ellas, la que hoy nos trae la gestión de centros penitenciarios con total seguridad jurídica y con las mejores condiciones técnicas. Eso es lo relevante. Estamos ante una materia compleja, con muchas aristas, y lo importante es seguir trabajando, no descansar. Y estén seguros de que este Gobierno y sus consejeros y consejeras no pararán hasta lograr todas las competencias que por ley nos corresponden, aunque para ustedes sea un ejecutivo desnortado y oscuro.

Hablan, y en concreto usted, en sus últimas intervenciones, de un gobierno agotado, de gestión opaca y de improvisación. Evidentemente, esa no es la realidad que vivimos en este país, si no son sus anhelos.

Tenemos un gobierno con principios sólidos y con unos compromisos claros para con su ciudadanía, entre otras materias, en autogobierno, y en asumir todas aquellas competencias que hasta ahora han estado en manos del Estado español y que deben pasar a ser gestionadas, en el más amplio sentido, por nuestras instituciones. Tenemos un gobierno con impulso y fuerza suficiente para llevar a cabo la tarea tanto de conseguir la transferencia de las materias pendientes como la gestión eficaz y eficiente de dichas materias. Gestión cercana en todos los ámbitos que, sin duda, redunda en el beneficio de la ciudadanía. Y tenemos un Gobierno que sí, además cuenta con una amplia mayoría en esta Cámara, pero que, sin embargo, desde la misma, siempre se apuesta y apostamos por lograr consensos amplios.

Y en la cuestión relativa a la transferencia de competencias en la gestión y funcionamiento de los centros penitenciarios radicados en Euskadi, usted lo que anhela y pretende es lanzar un envite a la línea de flotación de las negociaciones que se están llevando a cabo, al trabajo desarrollado en la Comisión Mixta de Transferencias. Le interesa, lo primero, atacar el proceso negociador en el seno de dicha Comisión y poner en tela de juicio el trabajo desarrollado en las reuniones técnicas que se están celebrando, con un calendario previsto y en un momento de relación fluida entre las dos partes, Gobierno Vasco y Gobierno español, para concretar con esas reuniones y definir técnicamente todos y cada uno de los detalles de la transferencia.

Y en su postura, tienen un fin claro: evitar que se pueda alcanzar ningún acuerdo entre ambos gobiernos en relación al ejercicio de las competencias que a Euskadi le corresponden. Porque su política, la de su partido, sigue la línea opuesta a la del autogobierno. No tiene ningún interés en que se cumpla lo acordado y lo aprobado hace más de 40 años en el Estatuto de Gernika.

Supongo que luego llegará su turno, o el de su grupo, de tratar o de cuestionar el modelo que se adopte para ejecutar dicha competencia. Corresponderá a la Consejería de Igualdad, Justicia y Políticas Sociales la competencia de desarrollar la nueva política pública en materia de organización, régimen y funcionamiento de los servicios penitenciarios. Y las propuestas de resolución que surgieron, y que fueron aprobadas en el pleno monográfico del 13 de marzo de 2019, serán la base para definir el modelo penitenciario a implantar en Euskadi.

Y, efectivamente, ante este Parlamento, también se será transparente y claro en las medidas y en la planificación de llevar a cabo ese modelo. Hoy los compromisos que tenemos firmados son sólidos y no flaquean, hay voluntad de negociación y hay voluntad de acuerdo. Y, sobre todo, señor Gordillo, no tenga ninguna duda, hasta ahora se han materializado otros traspasos. En la pasada legislatura, se llevaron a cabo transferencias en varias materias: carreteras, líneas ferroviarias…, que actualmente ya se gestionan de manera impecable por nuestra Administración vasca. Y ahora se está realizando un arduo pero eficaz trabajo para culminar otros traspasos, como la de la gestión de centros penitenciarios. Y cuando dicho acuerdo se alcance, su gestión, el funcionamiento, la organización de bienes, servicios, contratos, obligaciones en materia de prisiones, se organizará con un modelo de política pública que, además de basarse en las propuestas resultantes del pleno monográfico de la pasada legislatura, seguirá los ejes claves marcados por nuestro gobierno: las personas, la convivencia, el autogobierno y los derechos humanos. Y todo ello, señor Gordillo, con transparencia y claridad.

Perdón. Quisiera, al término de la ronda de intervenciones, de esta ronda de intervenciones, pedir un receso para poder terminar de firmar y suscribir, y bueno, y algunos flecos que quedan pendientes, de la enmienda transaccional a la que ha hecho referencia la señora Gorrotxategi.

Eskerrik asko.

text_en:
Thank you, Madam President.

I'll take my cell phone out in case you want me to read the recommendations. Of course, it says to me "no, it's that you only read one part"; no, it's that there's only one point where you talk, and I've read it whole to you so you don't cheat, I've read it whole. Not like others do here who read a fragment, but they don't read the important thing.

And the Socialists have been very clear since 2015 - and you can see in the sessional diary of the non-law proposal that my colleague Gloria Sánchez brought here - that what we are demanding was that in this area it was political agreement and social dialogue; and I have told you. In coherence, this is transformed into our 2019 election program. Political agreement, Toledo Pact. What does the Toledo Pact have to do with the political agreement? Well, if I have to explain, we'll just start, we'll just start.

And social dialogue, it tells me in the intervention of the unions in all this. Or doesn't exist. Or, of course, of course, the problem is when you come here to have to explain to certain political parties that usually choose to stay in the essence. Because I can have my position, I can have my position on mutuals, and whenever you want you and I talk about it. But we argued that it was necessary to deal with this type of thing from the point of view of seeking agreement. And when you come to agreements, there are people who give vertigo for not having achieved the maximum, and instead of leaving those hairs on the triggers we talk about many times, they want to keep the banner. He passed the labor reform to , he passed the labor reform; and now every time the unemployment data come out and the number of hired people who are fixed hide under the stones and wonder why they voted against.

Of course, and it has happened to you and some unions who were talking about no, autonomous agreements - which no one put at risk, by the way, no one put at risk - and we have not heard from them again, by the way. What we do know is that there are monthly data on the improvement of unemployment, there are monthly data on the improvement of the recruitment of workers from this country, and we know that it was not thanks to ; and not only not thanks to , not thanks to other parties. We do know that it is thanks to the Socialist Party. That is why it is so important, Mrs Garcia, that you said, the difference is that it governs the Socialist Party? Man, whether he governs the Socialist Party or the People's Party has quite a few differences, quite a few differences.

And even if you want to stage a disagreement today, I'm going to move a reflection. It clings to things seven years ago - as I said - skewedly, but I told you that several things have happened in the economy, in society, in risk prevention, in health prevention, and also the pandemic, which has changed the way of dealing with safety at work; and also the change in the political cycle in Spain, which you are part of and proud of, and also the new strategy presented in this House by Vice-Lehendakari. And a profound transformation that we're immersed in, and that doesn't doubt that it's going to affect us all. It's going to affect labor relations, it's going to affect political parties, it's going to affect every person. And the Socialists see deep currents and listen to everyone.

An important novelty has been the social dialogue table, which will soon be three years old. This photo opens the doors to those who want to participate in public employment policies. And we appreciate the efforts of those who have decided to commit themselves to it; and the same in the Osalan General Council. And we see that there are those who value the possibility of joining, and I hope so, because the better. And don't forget that...

... General Council of Osalan. And we see that there are those who value the possibility of joining, and I hope so, because the better.

And don't forget that the health of working people is the first of the keys, which – also with – the Department that runs Idoia Mendia has considered that it should mark quality employment. I believe that instead of bringing questions here to try to go to a maximum approach, when I say again, where exactly the need for or not to reform that law - which is in the Toledo Pact - has been discussed, has abstained from the conclusions and Podemos has voted in favour of those conclusions - which I have read to him -. That you don't like it, but, of course, you will have to talk to your comrades from Podemos de España, because here it is very easy to come and say that everything the Spanish Government does when it goes well, this is wonderful, but when I don't like it very much, it is that I have even freedom, not to criticise the socialist part of the government anymore, but that I even take off from what my comrades from Podemos in this case have voted for.

Well, ask for explanations from the parliamentary group of Podemos in the Spanish Congress, which have also learned something that would not be wrong to be learned here, and it is that, sometimes, reaching agreements is more important than the maxims.

Nothing more and thank you.
text:
Gracias, señora presidenta.

Me saco el móvil por si quiere que le lea las recomendaciones. Claro, me dice "no, es que usted solo lee una parte"; no, es que solo hay un punto en el que se habla, y se lo he leído entero para no hacer trampas, se lo he leído entero. No como hacen aquí otros que leen un fragmento, pero se quedan sin leer lo importante.

Y los Socialistas hemos tenido muy claro desde el año 2015 −y se puede ver en el diario de sesiones de la proposición no de ley que trajo aquí mi compañera Gloria Sánchez− que lo que nosotros reclamamos que en este ámbito lo que hacía falta era acuerdo político y diálogo social; y se lo he dicho. En coherencia, eso lo transformamos en nuestro programa electoral del año 2019. Acuerdo político, Pacto de Toledo. ¿Qué tiene que ver, me preguntaba, el Pacto de Toledo con el acuerdo político? Pues si se lo tengo que explicar, mal empezamos, mal empezamos.

Y diálogo social, me dice en la intervención de los sindicatos en todo esto. O no existe. O, claro, claro, el problema es cuando uno viene aquí a tenerle que explicar a determinados partidos políticos que suelen optar, normalmente, por quedarse en las esencias. Porque yo puedo tener mi postura, yo puedo tener mi postura sobre las mutuas, y cuando quiera usted y yo lo hablamos. Pero nosotros planteamos que era necesario abordar este tipo de cosas desde el ámbito de la búsqueda del acuerdo. Y cuando se llega a acuerdos, hay a gente a los que les da vértigo por no haber conseguido el máximo, y en vez de dejar esos pelos en las gateras de los que hablamos en muchas ocasiones, se quieren quedar con la pancarta. Les pasó con la reforma laboral a , le pasó con la reforma laboral; y ahora cada vez que salen los datos del desempleo y el número de personas contratadas que son fijas se esconden debajo de las piedras y se preguntan por qué votaron en contra.

Claro, y les ha pasado a ustedes y a algunos sindicatos que estaban hablando de no, unos convenios autonómicos −que nadie ponía en riesgo, por cierto, que nadie ponía en riesgo−, y no hemos vuelto a saber de ellos, por cierto. Lo que sí sabemos es que hay datos mensuales de mejora del desempleo, hay datos mensuales de mejora de la contratación de los trabajadores y trabajadoras de este país, y sabemos que no ha sido gracias a ; y no solo no gracias a , no gracias a otros partidos. Sí sabemos que es gracias al Partido Socialista. Por eso es tan importante, señora Garcia, que decía usted, ¿la diferencia es que gobierne el Partido Socialista? Hombre, pues que gobierne el Partido Socialista o el Partido Popular tiene bastantes diferencias, bastantes diferencias.

Y aunque hoy quiera escenificar un desacuerdo, yo le voy a trasladar una reflexión. Se agarra a cosas de hace siete años −como le he dicho− de forma sesgada, pero yo le he dicho que han pasado varias cosas en la economía, en la sociedad, en la prevención de riesgos, en la prevención de la salud, y también la pandemia, que ha cambiado la forma de afrontar la seguridad en el trabajo; y también el cambio de ciclo político en España, del que ustedes forman parte y se enorgullecen, y también la nueva estrategia presentaba en esta Cámara por la vicelehendakari. Y una profunda transformación en la que estamos inmersos, y que no dude que nos va a afectar a todos. Nos va a afectar a las relaciones laborales, va a afectar a los partidos políticos, a cada persona. Y los Socialistas vemos corrientes de fondo y escuchamos a todo el mundo.

Una novedad importante ha sido la mesa de diálogo social, que cumplirá en breve tres años. Esa foto abre las puertas a quienes quieran participar en las políticas públicas de empleo. Y agradecemos el esfuerzo de quienes han decidido comprometerse con ello; y lo mismo en el Consejo General de Osalan. Y vemos que hay quienes valoran la posibilidad de incorporarse, y ojalá sea así, porque cuantos más mejor. Y no olvide que…

… Consejo General de Osalan. Y vemos que hay quienes valoran la posibilidad de incorporarse, y ojalá sea así, porque cuantos más mejor.

Y no olvide que la salud de las personas trabajadoras es la primera de las claves, que −también con − el Departamento que dirige Idoia Mendia ha considerado que debe marcar el empleo de calidad. Yo creo que en vez de traer cuestiones aquí para intentar ir a un planteamiento de máximos, cuando vuelvo a decir, donde se ha hablado precisamente de la necesidad o no reforma de esa ley −que es en el Pacto de Toledo−, se ha abstenido a las conclusiones y Podemos ha votado a favor de esas conclusiones −que yo le he leído−. Que igual a usted no le gustan, pero, claro, tendrá que hablar con sus compañeros de Podemos de España, porque aquí es muy fácil venir a decir que todo lo que hace el Gobierno de España cuando sale bien, esto es maravilloso, pero cuando no me gusta mucho, es que yo tengo hasta libertad, no ya para criticar a la parte socialista del Gobierno, sino que incluso me despego de lo que mis compañeros y compañeras de Podemos en este caso han votado.

Bueno, pues pídale explicaciones al grupo parlamentario de Podemos en el Congreso de España, que igual han aprendido algo que no vendría mal que se aprenda aquí, y es que, en ocasiones, llegar a acuerdos es más importante que los máximos.

Nada más y gracias.

text_en:
Thank you, Madam President. Mrs. Saez de Egilaz.

Gaztelagun, as you know, is a support programme for youth emancipation, through the granting of direct support for the payment of rent, which we launched in January 2019. The programme is aligned with the needs and concerns of the younger society, and this was reflected in the participatory processes we launched before its launch. It offers monthly support for three years to young people who, in addition to meeting other requirements, have income between 3,000 and 28,000 euros, depending on the number of people living together.

As the report recently published by the Housing Observatory points out, in December 2020 there were 1,620 active aids, but in the first two years of the programme, 1,992 young people have at some point benefited from these aids.

To date, and according to data provided by public society Alokabide, this figure has been exceeded by 2,100 young people who have been helped by the Housing Department to pay rent for their housing. From the birth of Gaztelagun until now we have met all the demands that met the requirements for access to these aids. Therefore, Mrs Saez de Egilaz, I believe that the programme is certainly producing positive results.

Mrs Saez de Egilaz, the low rates of emancipation have their origin in deep and complex problems which have mainly to do with instability in the labour market, but also, indeed, with the dearth and shortage of rented housing.

Gaztelagun is a young and dynamic initiative, just like its recipients. It is a program that has adjusted its requirements and scope in its first year of life, because if something distinguishes and differentiates our Department it is the ongoing evaluation processes, which allows us to measure and adjust the programs to the realities at every moment.

The changes introduced in Gaztelagun in income requirements, age, maximum rental price, have made it possible to substantially increase the number of beneficiaries in 2020, an increase of 127%, and this in a particularly difficult situation, such as the situation we are experiencing as a result of the crisis caused by COVID-19. And the data we have in this scarce month and a half of the year 21 confirm this upward trend.

Gaztelagun was born as a pilot experience, but in these two years of life it has been consolidated and has become a bet not only of the Housing Department, but of the entire Executive, becoming part of the government program, because the Gaztelagun program has come to stay.

But this is not the only tool we are developing to promote youth access to affordable housing. With the aid of Gaztelagun, we have added a strong boost to the supply accommodation programme over the last few years. To this day we have 577 ADA in use, but we have 390 in work, we have 341 tender project and 314 study; total, 1,622 ADA.

And we are also establishing preferential quotas of up to 40% for young people in the award of rental housing.

But returning to Gaztelagun, I sincerely believe that it is a necessary programme and I am convinced that when we overcome the current situation of pandemic crisis and can return to a situation of greater normality, the best conditions will be given for this programme to grow even more intensely.

Thank you very much.
text:
Gracias, señora presidenta. Señora Saez de Egilaz.

Gaztelagun, como usted sabe, es un programa de apoyo a la emancipación juvenil, mediante la concesión de ayudas directas para el pago del alquiler, que pusimos en marcha en enero de 2019. El programa está alineado con las necesidades y preocupaciones de la sociedad más joven, y así se puso de manifiesto en los procesos de participación que lanzamos antes de su puesta en marcha. Ofrece ayudas mensuales durante tres años a jóvenes que, además de cumplir otros requisitos, tengan ingresos entre 3.000 y 28.000 euros, dependiendo del número de personas convivientes.

Tal y como señala el informe recientemente publicado por el Observatorio de Vivienda, en diciembre de 2020 había 1.620 ayudas activas, pero en los dos primeros años del programa, han sido 1.992 jóvenes los que han disfrutado en algún momento de estas ayudas.

A día de hoy, y según datos aportados por la sociedad pública Alokabide, esta cifra se ha superado situándose en 2.100 los jóvenes a los que el Departamento de Vivienda ha ayudado a pagar el alquiler de su vivienda. Desde el nacimiento de Gaztelagun hasta el momento hemos atendido toda la demanda que cumplía los requisitos para acceder a estas ayudas. Por tanto, señora Saez de Egilaz, creo que el programa está dando, sin duda alguna, resultados positivos.

Señora Saez de Egilaz, las bajas tasas de emancipación tienen su origen en problemas profundos y complejos que tienen que ver principalmente con la inestabilidad en el mercado laboral, pero también, efectivamente, con la carestía y escasez de viviendas en alquiler.

Gaztelagun es una iniciativa joven y dinámica, al igual que sus destinatarios. Es un programa que ha ajustado sus requisitos y su alcance en su primer año de vida, porque si algo distingue y diferencia a nuestro Departamento son los procesos de evaluación permanentes, lo que nos permite medir y ajustar los programas a las realidades en cada momento.

Las modificaciones introducidas en Gaztelagun en requisitos de ingresos, edad, precio máximo de alquileres, han permitido incrementar de manera sustancial el número de personas beneficiarias en el 2020, un incremento del 127 %, y ello en una coyuntura especialmente difícil, como es la situación que vivimos como consecuencia de la crisis provocada por la COVID-19. Y los datos que tenemos en este escaso mes y medio del año 21 ratifican esta tendencia ascendente.

Gaztelagun nació como una experiencia piloto, pero en estos dos años de vida se ha consolidado y se ha convertido en una apuesta no solo del Departamento de Vivienda, sino de todo el Ejecutivo, pasando a ser parte del programa de Gobierno, porque el programa Gaztelagun ha venido para quedarse.

Pero esta no es la única herramienta que estamos desarrollando para favorecer el acceso de la juventud a una vivienda asequible. A las ayudas de Gaztelagun, hemos sumado estos años un fuerte impulso al programa de alojamientos dotacionales. A día de hoy tenemos 577 ADA en uso, pero tenemos 390 en obra, tenemos en proyecto de licitación 341 y en estudio 314; total, 1.622 ADA.

Y además estamos estableciendo cupos preferentes de hasta el 40 % para jóvenes en la adjudicación de viviendas de alquiler.

Pero volviendo a Gaztelagun, creo sinceramente que es un programa necesario y estoy convencido de que cuando superemos la actual situación de crisis pandémica y podamos volver a una situación de mayor normalidad, se darán las mejores condiciones para que este programa pueda crecer todavía con mayor intensidad.

Muchas gracias.

text_en:
Yes, thank you, President; on denoi.

Look, the Basque Socialists believe that the support of the administrations for local trade must be strengthened in order to try to minimize, in effect, the disadvantage of the local trader with respect to large digital operators.

We have even said this when the budgets of the Department of Tourism, Commerce and Consumer Affairs were discussed, but I remind you that the budgets were not approved, when the sector was also quite satisfied with the Basque Government's proposal for 2019.

Indeed, the commercial sector accounts for more than 11% of Basque gross domestic product and also has an important role in social coordination and the creation of cohesive communities, as Mr Casanova said. And the Department of Tourism, Commerce and Consumption has been increasing budgetary resources since the beginning of this legislature, and has proposed, in agreement with the sector, new programmes and lines of aid, based on the needs raised by the sector itself.

And we must not forget that we must also improve in the area of governance, trade regulation, and that is a task that transcends the Basque Autonomous Community, and even transcends the State itself.

The rules that come from Europe play a fundamental role in the equalization of playing conditions and rules for the whole trade sector. Because, if we defend decent and sustainable employment in a system of market freedom, we must also fight against the exposure of some advantage, because everyone, everyone, must play with the same rules of play.

In order to have a realistic and balanced view of the situation, I will give some different data, in the sense that, well, they do not adhere to what Mr. Casanova said earlier:

For example, in the first quarter of 2019, the rate of annual change in employment in trade increased by 0.02%, and, by segregating the data, wholesale trade improved by 1%; however, retail trade fell by 0.6%. In the trade sector as a whole, employment in the wage-earners group increased by 1.6% and, however, in the self-employed group decreased by 1.6% as well.

In terms of consumption, the demographic process of ageing is not neutral. The needs and habits of consumption vary according to age, and, in the same way, the differentiated assumption of new technological trends in the different age segments opens up, in turn, a complex game, of needs and opportunities, of differentiated positioning for the Basque trade.

For this reason, trade and its different manifestations are facing disruptive changes, which have come more from the hands of global operators than from other agents, such as large areas.

And that is why, with regard to the proposals made by Bildu in his initiative and, more specifically, with regard to taxation in trade, the Basque Socialists have proposed, as we have repeated on several occasions, and we will also discuss this in the last initiative on the agenda of the plenary, that the relevant institutions should analyse, within the Tax Coordination Body, taxation linked to trade, all taxation linked to trade.

Because the tax on large areas does have an area of autonomous establishment and application, but not that of electronic commerce or that of large operators of commercial distribution.

The great adversary of traditional trade is outside our borders, and therefore governance and taxation must be addressed from a transnational approach and with the impetus of the institutions, which have, in this regard, the capacity to regulate and the possibilities with the tools of competition and the brake on tax avoidance, in order to get all operators to play with the same rules.

Setting a tax for Amazon, for Apple or for Google requires overcoming autonomous and national areas, to agree and apply tax criteria to these large operators of sales and commercial distribution. And the Basque Department of Tourism, Commerce and Consumption has a strong stake in small trade, traditional trade, that trade that is close to us.

And proof of this are the support programmes, such as Hirigune, aimed at encouraging zonal strategies of cooperation, dynamism and urban commercial competitiveness; or also the programme of new business entrepreneurship for autonomous people, as a base bet for rejuvenation and future employment in trade, or also the digitisation and e-commerce programmes, which aim to give tools to Basque trade to confront disruptive operators, with the same instruments and conditions, by promoting equal opportunities.

And the Basque Government, in short, is making an effort to modernise and innovate the sector both in terms of structures and equipment and of creating a business image and culture consistent with new social trends, a role that strengthens its attractiveness to the consumer and empowers it professionally, as a current activity, a creative and also independent activity.

Special attention has been paid to business competitiveness, with individualised and tailored assistance programmes of the advanced and quality management model; also to initiatives and programmes that drive digitisation and the uniqueness that the growth of online trade brings with it, and also to training for employment.

There is a strong involvement of the Basque Government's trade programmes with the sustainability of urban environments, promoting trade collaboration with the rest of the tertiary activities of the urban economy, as well as optimising the new opportunities that arise, for example, around tourism as an emerging activity. And thus, innovation is encouraged, in search of more effective tools of commercial dynamism on the territory.

That is why, in the amendment tabled by the Basque Nationalists and the Basque Socialists, we urge the Department of Tourism, Commerce and Consumption of the Basque Government to analyse the proposal for the establishment of the traditional and historic store name, together with the agents of the sector, in the Advisory Committee on Commerce of Euskadi, which is the advisory body attached to the Directorate of Commerce which has competence in this area and which, by mistake, we had put in the amendment the Trade Bureau. We want it to be the forum in which to discuss and agree on the criteria for aid to promote small trade.

And if a consensus and broad agreement is reached in a body attached to the Directorate for Trade as to the appropriateness and criteria for the establishment of such designations, which may also have special support or special specific aid, we believe that the public administration, that the Basque Government and other institutions can and should never be an obstacle, but, quite the contrary, agents who promote and implement, with determination, these categories or designations and the corresponding aid.

We also urge in our amendment that the department should work and agree with the actors in the sector, and in the area of their competence, the criteria for timetables and establishments in periods of sale, so that, together with the Government of the State, the most beneficial measures can be taken for trade in Euskadi, allowing effective reconciliation and decent working conditions for persons working in the commercial sector.

And we propose this commitment from the Basque Government to try to change the current regulation by the Spanish Government, in the most beneficial way that the sector itself is able to agree and agree.

Because not to adopt, as Bildu says, invasive measures in the field of trade, nullifying those adopted previously, such as opening on holidays, means committing an illegality, by not taking over the ruling of the Constitutional Court, which declared null and void the appeal of unconstitutionality made by the Basque Government back in 2013. And the appeal was based on the fact that Royal Decree Law 20/2012 of 13 July 2012 on measures to guarantee budgetary stability and to promote competitiveness invaded the competences of the Basque Government, which was doing enormous damage to most of the Basque commercial fabric.

But it was then, this appeal was made and a series of measures were put in place to alleviate that damage to the commercial fabric, which was caused by the royal decree, because the appeal was then brought, and until the sentence was issued, it was possible to implement those measures. Which not now.

Not now; after the ruling of the Constitutional Court, it is not possible to jump to the torera measures however very invasive they seem to us. In June 2016, that ruling of the Constitutional Court came out, which stated that both article 27 and article 28 of the Royal Decree-Law were in conformity with Community law, and therefore we cannot commit illegalities or invade.

And, therefore, no matter how much we oppose liberalization, deregulation, which this royal decree raises, there is no alternative but to assume it. And, in any case, generate a series of measures through consensus with the sector itself, which allow the Basque Government to speak with the Spanish Government and try to renew this royal decree, in the most beneficial way for Basque trade.

On the subject of budgets, we have proposed that the increase in budgets should be equivalent to the average increase in the budget of the department as a whole. Because what is not very consistent, Mr Casanova, is that we are now calling for a proportionality between the weight of trade in the Basque gross domestic product and that increase in budgets, when we then come here to negotiate and discuss budgets every year, since the start of the parliamentary term, and you do not approve the budgets, do not support the budgets of the Basque Government, however much we have increased 25, 30, 40, 50 or 100 % these budgets.

"I sell advice, I don't have it for me," and reality sometimes hits us like this. You didn't support it. They tried a negotiation, in which, by the way, there was not a single line for Basque trade. Yes for other matters, but not a single line for Basque trade, which you see so in danger, and which we share that there is a concern that we must tackle with measures, as the Government is doing.

Nothing more and thank you.
text:
Sí, gracias, presidenta; egun on denoi.

Miren, los Socialistas Vascos consideramos que el apoyo de las administraciones al comercio local debe reforzarse para intentar minimizar, efectivamente, la desventaja del comerciante local respeto a los grandes operadores digitales.

Lo hemos dicho incluso cuando se debatieron los presupuestos del Departamento de Turismo, Comercio y Consumo, pero les recuerdo que los presupuestos no se aprobaron, cuando el sector estaba además bastante satisfecho con la propuesta del Gobierno Vasco para el año 2019.

Efectivamente, el sector comercial supone más del 11 % del producto interior bruto vasco y tiene, además, una importante función de articulación social y de creación de comunidades cohesionadas, como ha dicho el señor Casanova. Y el Departamento de Turismo, Comercio y Consumo ha ido incrementando los recursos presupuestarios desde el inicio de esta legislatura, y ha planteado, consensuadamente con el sector, nuevos programas y líneas de ayuda, en base a las necesidades planteadas por el propio sector.

Y no podemos olvidar que, además, hay que mejorar en el ámbito de la gobernanza, de la regulación comercial, y esa es una tarea que trasciende a la Comunidad Autónoma Vasca, e incluso trasciende al propio Estado.

La normativa que viene de Europa tiene un papel fundamental en la equiparación de las condiciones y de las reglas de juego para todo el sector del comercio. Porque, si defendemos un empleo decente y sostenible en un sistema de libertad de mercado, también debemos luchar contra la exposición de ventaja de algunos, porque todos, todos, deben de jugar con las mismas reglas de juego.

Para tener una visión realista y ponderada de la situación, yo daré algunos datos diferentes, en el sentido de que, bueno, no se adscriben a lo que comentaba antes el señor Casanova:

Por ejemplo, en el primer trimestre de 2019, la tasa de variación interanual del empleo en el comercio se incrementó un 0,02 %, y, analizando los datos de forma segregada, el comercio al por mayor mejoró un 1 %; sin embargo, el comercio al por menor descendió un 0,6 %. En el sector del comercio, en su totalidad, aumentó el empleo en el grupo de asalariados un 1,6 % y, sin embargo, disminuyó en el grupo de autónomos un 1,6 % también.

En términos de consumo, el proceso demográfico de envejecimiento no resulta neutro. Las necesidades y los hábitos de consumo varían en función de la edad, y, del mismo modo, la asunción diferenciada de las nuevas tendencias tecnológicas en los distintos segmentos de edad abre, a su vez, un juego complejo, de necesidades y oportunidades, de posicionamiento diferenciado para el comercio vasco.

Por todo ello, el comercio y sus diferentes manifestaciones se están enfrentando a cambios disruptivos, que han llegado más de la mano de operadores globales que de otros agentes, como puedan ser las grandes superficies.

Y por eso, en cuanto a las propuestas que realiza Bildu en su iniciativa y, más concretamente, respecto a la fiscalidad en el comercio, los Socialistas Vascos hemos propuesto, como lo hemos reiterado en varias ocasiones, y debatiremos también esta circunstancia en la última iniciativa del orden del día del pleno, que las instituciones competentes analicen, en el seno del Órgano de Coordinación Tributaria, la fiscalidad vinculada al comercio, toda la fiscalidad vinculada al comercio.

Porque el impuesto a las grandes superficies sí tiene un ámbito de establecimiento y aplicación autonómico, pero no así el del comercio electrónico ni el de los grandes operadores de la distribución comercial.
